name: Company Chocobo
text_html:
Summon your Grand Company-issued battle chocobo.

Born and bred in the city–state of Ishgard, the majority of company chocobos are geldings of the rouncey variety; however, massive destriers and miniature Belah'dian jennets are also raised to accommodate the builds of Roegadyn and Lalafellin riders respectively.

Tooltip:
Chocobos are stout-
hearted creatures, but
they have their limits.
- Mimigun

name: Goobbue
text_html:
Use the odd-shaped horn gifted to you by the wandering minstrel to call a massive goobbue to your side.

Traded for a song by the High Satrap of a distant land, the secret to taming these creatures once thought to be unbreakable was introduced to Eorzea by a mysterious wandering minstrel who journeyed through the realm in the final days before the Calamity.

Tooltip:
Would that I had the
girth of a goobbue!
- Nanamo Ul Namo

name: Legacy Chocobo
text_html:
Five years and a realm-shaking Calamity were not enough to break the bonds between you and your loyal steed. A single whistle and he will be at your side once again.

In the five years following your sudden disappearance from the Carteneau Flats, your ever-faithful chocobo spent each waking moment galloping across the realm in search of his lost master. His myriad adventures are nothing less than fantastical and heartbreaking...but that is a story for another day.

Tooltip:
Go find the chocobo you
rode in on, and ride on out.
- Sevrin

text_html:
Call into battle your suit of Garlond Ironworks-modified magitek armor.

This suit of Garlean-developed reaper-class magitek battle armor has had its original control systems purged and replaced with a new, modified core built by Cid of the Garlond Ironworks.

Tooltip:
At last, our very own
suit of magitek armor!
- Cid Garlond

name: Coeurl
text_html:
Summon your fleet-footed battle coeurl, trained from a pup to recognize you as a friend...not food.

Native to the jungles of the Near East, coeurls were only recently introduced to Eorzea, brought over from faraway lands such as Thavnair by Ul'dahn nobles who thought to breed them as pets. Now, but a handful of skilled tamers living in recluse on the Pearl are
said to be able to train them.

Tooltip:
Hey, good lookin'!
Catch my coeurl yet?
- Swygrael

name: Ahriman
text_html:
Summon forth a riding ahriman, bound to this realm with powerful magicks guaranteed to never fade.

Though little is known of the void and the creatures which call the extra-dimensional realm home, scholars have discovered that there is a strict hierarchy amongst voidsent consisting of twelve distinct tiers. Ahrimans are believed to fall into the fifth, making them formidable foes...when not enthralled by curses.

Tooltip:
Ye'd 'ave t' be blinder'n an
ahriman wi' an eyepatch t'
miss the camp.
- Baderon Tenfingers

name: Unicorn
text_html:
Summon forth the single-horned steed you befriended in the Black Shroud.

Not long ago, Eorzean unicorns numbered in the thousands, and could oft be seen roaming the Coerthas highlands in great majestic herds that would render the mountains white as snow. Poaching has caused the population to decline, and if it were not for your act of kindness, there would be one fewer.

Tooltip:
Your precious horses,
they're just unicorns with
a big empty forehead.
- Chief Chocowacker

name: Behemoth
text_html:
Summon your mighty behemoth, trained from birth to carry you...not trample you underfoot like an ant.

Immediately following the Calamity, an adventurer returning to Gridania from Falcon's Nest in Coerthas claims to have happened upon a den of baby behemoths who had lost their mother. Despite objections from friends and family alike, she kept the beasts, eventually training them to serve as mounts.

Tooltip:
Do not presume to
provoke the behemoth to
battle. You will die.
- Meurise

name: Cavalry Drake
text_html:
Summon your cavalry drake, trained by the drake whisperer of the Brotherhood of Ash.

Training a cavalry drake is a long and arduous process that begins the moment the scalekin hatches. Never allowed to see its mother, the creature is raised solely in the presence of a drake whisperer while being weaned on the incendiary glands of aged battle drakes to ensure it is both submissive and deadly.

Tooltip:
You are as a lost kitten
that has wandered into
the drake's lair.
- Zagozz Teh

Tooltip:
Naught is as exhilarating
as a romp through the
forest on goobbueback.
- Unknown

name: Spriggan
text_html: Spriggans are neither sprites nor faeries, but share similarities with both. They are known to inhabit rocky regions and the deep recesses of mines. These black-furred soulkin are famous for carrying a gem or chunk of ore about with them at all times─a custom which may explain the popularly held belief within the mining fraternity that they are bringers of good fortune. Their classification as soulkin is based on a theory expounded in the Codex of Stone, which asserts that the creatures are naught but vessels for the will of the earth.

name: Coblyn

name: Morbol
text_html: The morbol is a terrible beast that moves upon its slime-covered vines and roots. Rather than rending or chewing, the fang-shaped thorns which line the morbol's maw serve to hold prey immobile during digestion.

name: 2.2 A Realm Reborn Cutscenes [VoiceMan_02200]
text_html:
000020

'Tis I. The situation may be more complicated than we anticipated.


000030

Indeed. I shall remain watchful.


000040

Ere thou goest─another matter requireth thine attention. A young maiden, full eager to─


000050

Wherefore inquirest thou of her fairness!? Very well. Be she damsel or devil, I shall direct her steps to Revenant's Toll.


000060

...Save thine insinuations for one given to such impropriety. Thou shalt not find me amenable.


000070

(-???-)Far across the sea, from the land of Doma, have we traveled. We seek audience with the ruler of these lands. Who here speaks for you?


100010

We have traveled some several thousand malms across the sea, from the nation of Doma, in hopes that we might find sanctuary in these lands.


100020

Sanctuary, Lady Yugiri?


100030

Aye. Lying within Othard, Doma was under the dominion of the Garlean Empire, as I am sure you are aware.


100040

When the war of succession broke out in Garlemald, we espied an opportunity to free ourselves from the yoke of imperial oppression, and took up arms.


100050

...Only to be crushed. And so I gathered what few Domans escaped the reckoning, and guided them hither to your shores.


100060

A war of succession...? Then the Emperor... Forgive me, you said that Doma “was” under imperial rule, did you not?


100070

Doma is gone. Razed to the ground as an example to the other provinces.


100080

Twelve have mercy... And your people?


100090

On a ship anchored in Vesper Bay, flying borrowed colors.


100100

Many were complicit in the rebellion, or are kin to those who were. They will not come ashore until I send word that it is safe to do so.


100110

I sought an audience with your rulers, but was summarily refused.


100120

The lords of Ul'dah are not wont to entertain foreign refugees without suitable encouragement.


100130

Mayhap I was foolish to expect otherwise. But our supplies run low, and we have young ones in urgent need of care.


100140

I have seen the tents outside the gates, however. We are not the first to seek asylum, nor will we be the last.


100150

...Be that as it may, Ul'dah is no friend to Garlemald. Your tale would stir the hearts of many men and women here.


100160

The sultana and the Syndicate will not be so easily swayed─but I shall see that you are granted an opportunity to plead your case.


100170

This is within your power?


100180

Well...far be it from me to boast, but I do have the ear of certain influential individuals.


100190

I am in your debt.


100200

Lady Yugiri, forgive me for observing, but...your choice of attire seems like to evoke feelings of mistrust.


100210

Men are wont to fear the unfamiliar. We know this from experience.


100220

We seek only to spare the people of Ul'dah unnecessary disquiet.


100230

I shall defer to your experience, then.


100240

I thank you for your understanding.


100250

It seems I have urgent business with the Flame General. I leave our guests in your capable hands.


200000

I, Yugiri of Doma, am honored to meet you at last, Your Grace. To mark this auspicious occasion, I should like to present to you the finest treasures our humble nation has to offer...


200010

Alas, the circumstances which have brought me here today have divested me of both time and dignity. I come before you as a pauper in direst need of aid─to request that you grant my people asylum.


200020

I, Nanamo, seventeenth in the line of Ul, welcome you to our city. Be at ease, Lady Yugiri.


200030

Although I myself have heard the tale of your misfortune, I would ask that you recount it once more for the benefit of the others here present.


200040

As you wish, Your Grace. For many years, my nation, Doma, suffered under the yoke of imperial rule, and my people yearned to be free. Thus, when a war of succession broke out in Garlemald, we sought to take advantage of the chaos and reclaim our liberty.


200050

Alas, our enemy proved less preoccupied than we had hoped, and our rebellion was put down in the most brutal fashion.


200060

Those who survived─how many do they number?


200070

More than two hundred souls huddle within the cramped confines of our own galleon's hold. Yet this figure accounts for but one of a number of ships which escaped the purge.


200080

It is my hope that you will allow us all to dwell within your walls. Should that prove unfeasible, however, I humbly ask that you accept as many of my people as your resources allow.


200090

Pray understand, we do not beg a boon, but propose instead an arrangement. We would serve─as soldiers or tradesmen─until our debt is repaid.


200100

What are the Syndicate's opinions on this matter?


200110

I, for one, think it's a marvelous idea. Lady Yugiri and her people strike me as an industrious lot, and there are parts of the city which have yet to be fully restored. If they are willing to work, I see no reason not to let them.


200120

The head of the Mirage Trust is not known for his generosity. He sees profit in this.


200130

I agree. That said, these are foreign refugees. To admit them would require a formal resolution. Shall we call a vote?


200140

The law is the law.


200150

Lord Lolorito?


200160

Tell me: are you blind or willfully ignorant? Even now, our streets are choked with the displaced victims of the Calamity and Ala Mhigan refugees.


200170

They live hand-to-mouth, subsisting on aid provided by the Immortal Flames─the cost of which grows ever higher!


200180

The wealth of Ul'dah is not without limits, my friends.


200190

And need I remind you that these refugees are prone to violence and criminal activity? You have all read the reports, I think?


200200

Without homes or employment, it is only a matter of time before men grow desperate and take that which they imagine has been unjustly denied them. Yet, knowing this, you would have us swell their ranks. Mayhap you think the Brass Blades and the Flames are not hard-pressed enough?


200210

Some say the chairman of the East Aldenard Trading Company passes gil thrice daily. This may explain how he came to be the wealthiest man in Ul'dah. Or it may simply be that he's ruthless beyond reckoning.


200220

Surely the sultanate can support the few hundred Domans Lady Yugiri represents? That our resources have been taxed I do not deny, but we are hardly in danger of financial collapse.


200230

I move that an exception be made.


200240

An exception, Your Grace? I am suddenly reminded of a similar debate some years ago, regarding a number of Ala Mhigan refugees, if memory serves.


200250

What were your words that day? Ah, yes: “The law is the law.” And so our visitors remained in Little Ala Mhigo.


200260

Mayhap our wise and benevolent sultana would be so good as to enlighten us as to which other of our laws should not be upheld?


200270

Mind your tongue, Lolorito.


200280

My lord, I share your concern for the welfare of our great nation, but we must endeavor to take a longer view. You know as well as I that people can be a resource still more precious than gil.


200290

Precious or not, they were never yet so reliable. And unlike those who frequent your establishment, I have no desire to gamble with my future.


200300

Ul'dah's greatest asset is, and has ever been, her material wealth. We risk this at our peril.


200310

One need only look to Teledji Adeledji's example for evidence of the danger in allowing sentiment to dictate policy.


200320

How far the vaunted Mirage hath fallen, both in repute and profitability, since he began employing refugees...


200330

How I choose to conduct my affairs is not your concern, my lord!


200340

A proposal has been tabled. Given its urgency, I move we forgo further debate and call a vote.


200350

To accept the Doman refugees or not. Those in favor, I bid you remain. Those opposed, I bid you leave.


200360

Would that it were within my power to welcome you and your people, Lady Yugiri. As you have observed, however, my authority in such matters is regrettably limited.


200370

Without the consent of the Syndicate, I cannot act.


200380

I understand, Your Grace. And I appreciate all that you have done on our behalf.


200390

The nerve of the man... If that bastard had not forsaken the eastern trade route, Little Ala Mhigo would now be thriving.


200400

That you should have traveled so far, under such dire circumstances, only to be refused in this manner is utterly unconscionable. Pray accept my sincerest apologies.


200410

Now that the Empire no longer poses an immediate threat, they see little reason to maintain the pretense of unity.


200420

The Monetarists have grown especially defiant of late─Lord Lolorito most of all.


200430

But this is neither the time nor place for that discussion.


300010

How goes the fishing? Caught anything slippery?


300020

Aye. Our suspicions were well founded. The Serpent Reavers are indeed the culprits.


300030

The plot thickens...


300040

Has there been any movement in Thanalan?


300050

It has been blessedly quiet. Which is to say the Amalj'aa are being no more or less of a nuisance than usual, summoning Ifrit with such crystals as they have hoarded.


300060

Urianger, too, reports naught out of the ordinary.


300070

Then we have our explanation.


300080

Your explanation for what, pray tell?


300090

For the recent spate of crystal thefts in Thanalan. We naturally assumed that the trail would lead us back to the Amalj'aa.


300100

Yet it did not. It led us across the sea unto Vylbrand.


300110

Vylbrand...?


300120

There have been reports of increased Sahagin activity of late...


300130

Oh gods...they mean to summon Leviathan?


300140

That is the way of it, I fear.


300150

Whilst conducting our investigation on behalf of the Mineral Concern, we came upon evidence implicating the Serpent Reavers.


300160

With the aid of the Maelstrom, I was able to verify our suspicions. 'Tis only a matter of time before Leviathan returns to harrow the seas.


300170

But there is more. One of the Sahagin─an elder, by my judgment─spoke of attaining the “gift and knowledge of eternity.”


300180


400010

Such a disturbance in the aether... If I did not know better, I should think this device defective.


400020

And there is the explanation...


400030

Soon! Sssoon it shall begin! Our Lord shall rise 'midst sssurging waves to wash away the finless ones!


400040

And I shall be granted the gift and knowledge of eternity, and with the emissary ssstand equal! Then shall I know no cesssation, no oblivion!


400050

...Whence comes this promise of immortality? The emissary?


400060

We have outstayed our welcome.


500010

“The gift...and knowledge.”


500020

Are the two of you quite well?


500030

You...you shared that vision, did you not?


500040

Even before the Sahagin made mention of the emissary, I recognized Elidibus's words. He is behind this.


500050

But surely it is not within his power to grant the Echo?


500060

My lady─unless we act swiftly, Leviathan will rise again. The Admiral has already requested that we intervene to prevent this. Failing that, we are to attend to the primal's extermination.


500070

She will have our full cooperation. Let us make haste to Limsa Lominsa.


500080

I mean to play a part in this mission. Tataru─pray take charge in my absence.


500090

My lady, are you sure this is wise?


500100

I am aware of the risks. But there is something I must see with mine own eyes.


500110

...The true nature of the Echo.


500120

Very well. I shall not stand in your way...on the condition that you permit me to accompany you as bodyguard.


500130

Your company is ever welcome, Thancred.


500140

I take it something ill is afoot?


500150

Aye. A primal is about to be loosed upon Eorzea.


500160

A...primal?


500170

A godlike being whose very existence is a bane upon the land. We Scions of the Seventh Dawn are sworn to put an end to their kind.


500180

I see. Know then that I am learned in the arts of war. In return for the kindness you have shown my people, I would lend you my blade.


500190

It would be most welcome. When contending with a primal, one can never have too many able allies.


500200

If you crave a more intimate understanding of the problems facing Eorzea, this experience is like to provide it. Be sure to come well prepared.


600010

Damn them... They have made thralls of soldiers and civilians both...


600030

Did I miss much?


600040

Hah.


600050

Yah.


600060

So that is how you fight in the Far East? Mental note: pick no quarrel with Domans.


600070

But seriously: if I am to keep up, I must needs forsake elegance for efficiency.


600080

Yah.


600090

Hah.


600100

Hmmm...


600110

To the aetheryte!


700010

You'll forgive me my lateness.


700020

I've been something of a liability of late, I know. 'Tis high time I set about making amends.


700030

Pshhh! Long have you shriveled shhhorewalkers tormented our kind!


700040

But no more! Your time is at an end!


700050

You shall perish with sssalt in your wounds and sssea in your lungs!


700060

Lord of the Whorl, hearken to our plea!
Lord of the Whorl, deliver us from our misery!


700070

Do you feel that!?


700080

I know this sensation... It's the Echo!


700090

What!?


700100

Pshhh! Sssuch power! It is...transcendent!


700110

Seven hells...


700120

Pshhhahahahahaaa! Ssstrike me down if you will! It is futile! I have massstered the gift! I am...eternal!


700130

O mighty Leviathan, ruler of the ssseas, born of waters primordial! I offer unto You this frail fleshhh, that You might grant Your faithful servants deliverance!


700140

I beseech You! Come forth!


700150

Die, damn you!


700160

Foolishhh shorewalker! You cannot kill that which is eternal!


700170

Heavens forfend...


700180

Damn it all!


700190

Pshhh!? My being...ebbs away... B-But it should by rightsss be infinite!


700200

Am I not...immortal? Curse you, Emissary! You promised me...everlasssting... Pshhh...


700210

Wh-Where did he go!?


700220

What say you? Nary a single ship!? Hells take that sea demon!


700230

Gather the survivors and get to shore. Leave the wrecks for the pirates.


700240

Leviathan wastes no time. The diversionary squadron is lost.


700250

For a mercy, 'twould seem the primal now makes for open sea. But why does he not press his advantage? Unless...


700260

Gods save us, he means to unleash a tidal wave!


800010

There used to be a hamlet beyond South Tidegate in western La Noscea. Halfstone, 'twas called.


800020

Some years prior to the Maelstrom's founding, Leviathan rose from the briny depths, and set about unleashing watery hell upon us. On that occasion, the Company of Heroes put him down before he could do too much damage.


800030

But when the bastard came next, this time in the wake of the Calamity, we were not so fortunate. Weary of ravaging our shoreline, he summoned a tidal wave which fair leveled Halfstone, and washed the soil away for good measure.


800040

The area was subsequently occupied by the Sahagin.


800050

Aye, the thrice-damned creatures transformed it into a spawning ground for their brood.


800060

Given the quantity of crystals stolen to feed him and his legion of thralls, we can be fairly sure that Leviathan is stronger now than in his previous incarnations.


800070

If that sea demon is left to wreak havoc, what befell Halfstone may well befall a larger settlement─even Limsa.


800080

That cannot happen. The primal must be stopped.


800090

That was ever our objective, Admiral. But how are we to achieve it?


800100

The sea is Leviathan's uncontested domain. The ships of the Third Squadron could not close to within a hundred yalms of the primal, nor could their cannons pierce his defenses.


800110

I have read the reports, Master Thancred. Our warships may as well have been bloody pleasure barges for all the good they did. Seven hells... Is there no way that we might strike back?


800120

The Company of Heroes defeated Leviathan having first lured him into an inlet, but we must needs contend with him upon the open sea. It will avail us little to consult past experience.


800130

Admiral, if I may.


800140

Speak freely, Marshal.


800150

By all accounts, Leviathan's most formidable weapon is the very sea itself. Waves and whirlpools, tides and currents─all these things are his to command. The key to victory, I believe, lies in disarming our foe.


800160

This, in effect, is what the Company of Heroes achieved with their ruse. We cannot lure Leviathan from the sea a second time, but what if we could weaken his hold upon the element of water? I have heard of devices capable of such wonders. They draw upon the power of corrupted crystals, I am told.


800170

If mounted upon a ship, such a device might be used to prevent Leviathan from bringing the full force of the sea to bear against us, rendering him no more dangerous than any other sea serpent.


800180

Of course... Cid built a similar device to grant the Enterprise safe passage through Garuda's tempest, did he not?


800190

Begging your pardon, my lady, but to give credit where it's due, this is something I heard from an old arcanist friend of mine.


800200

It makes little difference who thought of it first, so long as it works. Beg the specifications of this device from your friend, and I shall pass them on to our people at Naldiq & Vymelli's.


800210

But before we proceed any further, I would voice one concern: piercing Garuda's defenses is one thing, suppressing Leviathan's attacks quite another.


800220

In matters of science, I am as a babbling babe, but I cannot well imagine that such a feat would be possible without a veritable mountain of corrupted crystals.


800230

The question being: do we have a ship big enough to bear such a burden?


800240

Mayhap not, Admiral. But two might. Recall you the tale of Mistbeard's greatest haul? It is said that he lashed two ships together, side by side, the better to bear his plunder.


800250

By your leave, we might attempt to repeat the trick. The gods know, it would be quicker than building a new vessel.


800260

Mistbeard did this? Truly, Marshal, upon the subject of the pirate king, you are as a scholar.


800270

Now, from what I have gleaned of these matters, the device will need to be in close and constant proximity to the target. To wit, we must lash our twin vessel to Leviathan.


800280

This in itself will be no small feat. Ramming speed will be required, but given the weight of the cargo, that will only be attainable with the aid of a towing vessel...


800290

Suffice it to say, the task of piloting said vessel will entail considerable danger, and I would not ask it of another. I volunteer myself.


800300

'Twill be dangerous for all involved...but we have no better recourse. Very well.


800310

Commodore. Assemble the remnants of the fleet at Moraby Bay.


800320

Give priority to our soundest vessels. The repairs can wait.


800330

Storm Marshal Slafyrsyn, command of the operation is yours. I want that twin vessel ready to sail posthaste.


800340

At once, Admiral!


800350

And then there is the small matter of slaying the beast... The fate of Limsa Lominsa rests upon your shoulders once again. Go well, Warrior of Light.


900010

We Lominsans are sworn to strive “Till sea swallows all”─and swallow all it would have, had Leviathan prevailed. That we still strive now, we owe in no small part to you.


900020

Not for the first time, you have delivered Limsa Lominsa from the wrath of a primal. Never has our nation known a stouter ally.


900030

On behalf of my people, I give you my humblest thanks.


900040

'Tis meet that I give thanks to old Mistbeard, too, for his fine solution. Whatever else he may have been, 'tis clear he was a resourceful soul. Would that I had a man like him in my service.


900050

Before I set foot in these lands, I had no inkling that the people of Eorzea contended with such mighty foes. Suffice it to say, their existence came as something of a shock─as did the idea that they could be defeated.


900060

This experience has served to remind me of the vastness of the world...and the boundless potential of man.


900070

Though I am but a refugee in this realm, I would fain be of use to you in your fight.


900080

Know that I am tutored in one of the foremost combat arts of the Far East. It may seem...outlandish to the Eorzean eye, but should any of your people care to learn, I would be pleased to initiate them.


900090

And I will see to it that they are grateful. I have no doubt that your knowledge and skills will serve us well.


900100

Besides, your art is not so outlandish as you think. Would you not agree, Master Thancred?


900110

Naught escapes your searching eye, Admiral.


900120

Few are privy to this information, but Limsa Lominsa is home to a certain...secret fraternity. Its members are trained in a form of combat not unlike your own.


900130

By my judgment, it should not be beyond such individuals to adapt to the techniques I witnessed you employing with such admirable deftness.


900140

I am heartened to hear this. I, too, noted a kinship between your style and mine own. Though it seemed to me that you fought differently in the beginning.


900150

A-Aye, I suppose I did... What can I say? I am a man of many talents. Hahaha...


900160

Though you may labor to believe it, Thancred was once something of a scoundrel, who fraternized with the criminal class in these parts.


900170

Y-Y'shtola! You jest, of course!


900180

But for a chance encounter with Alphinaud's grandsire, he might never have left Limsa Lominsa; or received an education in Sharlayan; or taken up his post in Ul'dah─which is where he trained in the blade, lest you wonder.


900190

Minfilia─please!


900200

It would seem there is more to you than meets the eye, Master Thancred.


900210

Lady Yugiri─I am told that you and yours came to Eorzea seeking permanent resettlement, and that many Domans have since been engaged as frontier hands at Revenant's Toll. Mor Dhona is many things, but a place of refuge it is not.


900220

Know that I would like nothing better than to furnish your people with a new home here on Lominsan soil. Alas, racked by instability as we are, our nation is in no fit state to take you in.


900230

Yet I'll not have it said that we turned a blind eye to your suffering. Until such time as we can do more, I pledge to send provisions.


900240

We are in your debt, Admiral. I realize that it scarce qualifies as repayment, but if it please you, I shall set about sharing my martial knowledge with your people at once.


900250

You wished a word in private.


900260

The better not to spoil the festive mood.


900270

History repeats itself, Admiral. As the kobolds did before them, the Sahagin resorted to summoning their god over a territorial feud. They acted in self-preservation.


900280

It may be that the Sahagin initiated this particular clash, but how it begins does not interest me so much as how it ends.


900290

I have not forgotten our conversation, Y'shtola. I am aware that man bears part of the blame for the primals' existence.


900300

Nor am I ignorant of the Sahagin's reason for acting. They sought to secure a place to breed and multiply, that their kind might survive. Self-preservation, as you say.


900310

But we have as much right to live and thrive as they. If our own survival is threatened, are we to lay down our arms and welcome oblivion? Nay.


900320

And so you kill, that you might live. Yet if living is a right, then that right belongs to all peoples, be they men or beastmen.


900330

I'll not deny your reasoning. But when a storm gathers, it falls to me to see my people safely through it. That is my duty, and I shall do it.


900340

As must we all, Admiral. Stay the course, then, but know that it will lead to no good end.


900350

Man has ever put himself first and foremost.


900360

To justify his actions, he clads himself in the armor of righteousness─though it be a fancy of his own making. In this, mayhap the Garleans and we Domans are not so different...


900370

Eorzea has become as a raging sea. If we are to keep our heads above the waves, we cannot scruple to drown the man next to us.


900380

When hopes of coexistence founder, strength must determine who has the greater right to live.


A00010

I have been reflecting upon the events which took place during our visit to Vylbrand.


A00020

If you have a moment, I would share my conclusions with you. Please bear with me.


A00030

When the Sahagin elder summoned Leviathan, he employed the power we have come to know as the Echo.


A00040

Though I cannot well explain the how of it, it would seem he became immortal in so doing.


A00050

When the Admiral subsequently slew him, his spirit emerged from his lifeless flesh, a consciousness shorn of physical form.


A00060

Thus transfigured, he took up residence in the body of his minion with the ease of a man donning a favorite glove.


A00070

Long have I known that the Echo allows one to pass through the walls of a man's soul.


A00080

But never did I imagine that it could free us from our own flesh, nor less that our souls could then occupy the next corporeal vessel to take our fancy.


A00090

It was of this that Elidibus spoke─an existence which knows neither cessation nor oblivion.


A00100

And yet, though the Sahagin had mastered his gift and thereby become immortal, he was by no means invulnerable.


A00110

As we both bore witness, he was ultimately absorbed into Leviathan.


A00120

And the import of this observation? If the Ascians' mode of existence is indeed the same, it can be inferred that they, too, are not invulnerable─that they can be destroyed.


A00130

There exists a legend which tells of souls who are reborn upon the cusp of each Umbral Calamity, that they might stay the encroaching Darkness.


A00140

To most, it is but a faerie tale, yet recent events have given me cause to wonder: could the legend in fact refer to the Echo?


A00150

Much and more yet remains unknown, but I am confident that all will become clear in time.


A00160

For the present, however, what matters is that the key to defeating the Ascians may at last be within sight.


A00170

With Urianger's aid, it is my hope that I shall fathom this matter ere long.


A00180

Ah! I was just about to send for you, my friend.
...Is aught amiss?


A00190

Grave tidings from the Sharlayan motherland, my lady.


A00200

It doth concern our distant allies, the Students of Baldesion.


A00210

What of them?


A00220

My lady...the Isle of Val, which for many years hath been the order's home, is no more.


A00230

No more? Whatever do you mean?


A00240

I relate only that which hath been conveyed unto me by our agents. An aetheric wave of the highest magnitude was recorded in the region. Soon thereafter, 'twas observed that the isle had ceased to be.


A00250

'Tis postulated that a magick was evoked, like in power to Ultima.


A00260

Twelve preserve...


B00010

If there are no other matters, I move that today's meeting be adjourned.


B00020

It is done, my lord.


B00030

I... F-Forgive my impertinence, my lord, but these orders... I am uncertain as to what end they serve.


B00040

Revolution.


C00010

Um. Well, then!


C00020

That's enough of a beating for now!

That said, these are foreign refugees. To admit them would require a formal resolution. Shall we call a vote? 200140 The law is the law. 200150 Lord Lolorito? 200160 Tell me: are you blind or willfully ignorant? Even now, our streets are choked with the displaced victims of the Calamity and Ala Mhigan refugees. 200170 They live hand-to-mouth, subsisting on aid provided by the Immortal Flames the cost of which grows ever higher! 200180 The wealth of Ul'dah is not without limits, my friends. 200190 And need I remind you that these refugees are prone to violence and criminal activity? You have all read the reports, I think? 200200 Without homes or employment, it is only a matter of time before men grow desperate and take that which they imagine has been unjustly denied them. Yet, knowing this, you would have us swell their ranks. Mayhap you think the Brass Blades and the Flames are not hard-pressed enough? 200210 Some say the chairman of the East Aldenard Trading Company passes gil thrice daily. This may explain how he came to be the wealthiest man in Ul'dah. Or it may simply be that he's ruthless beyond reckoning. 200220 Surely the sultanate can support the few hundred Domans Lady Yugiri represents? That our resources have been taxed I do not deny, but we are hardly in danger of financial collapse. 200230 I move that an exception be made. 200240 An exception, Your Grace? I am suddenly reminded of a similar debate some years ago, regarding a number of Ala Mhigan refugees, if memory serves. 200250 What were your words that day? Ah, yes:  The law is the law.  And so our visitors remained in Little Ala Mhigo. 200260 Mayhap our wise and benevolent sultana would be so good as to enlighten us as to which other of our laws should not be upheld? 200270 Mind your tongue, Lolorito. 200280 My lord, I share your concern for the welfare of our great nation, but we must endeavor to take a longer view. You know as well as I that people can be a resource still more precious than gil. 200290 Precious or not, they were never yet so reliable. And unlike those who frequent your establishment, I have no desire to gamble with my future. 200300 Ul'dah's greatest asset is, and has ever been, her material wealth. We risk this at our peril. 200310 One need only look to Teledji Adeledji's example for evidence of the danger in allowing sentiment to dictate policy. 200320 How far the vaunted Mirage hath fallen, both in repute and profitability, since he began employing refugees... 200330 How I choose to conduct my affairs is not your concern, my lord! 200340 A proposal has been tabled. Given its urgency, I move we forgo further debate and call a vote. 200350 To accept the Doman refugees or not. Those in favor, I bid you remain. Those opposed, I bid you leave. 200360 Would that it were within my power to welcome you and your people, Lady Yugiri. As you have observed, however, my authority in such matters is regrettably limited. 200370 Without the consent of the Syndicate, I cannot act. 200380 I understand, Your Grace. And I appreciate all that you have done on our behalf. 200390 The nerve of the man... If that bastard had not forsaken the eastern trade route, Little Ala Mhigo would now be thriving. 200400 That you should have traveled so far, under such dire circumstances, only to be refused in this manner is utterly unconscionable. Pray accept my sincerest apologies. 200410 Now that the Empire no longer poses an immediate threat, they see little reason to maintain the pretense of unity. 200420 The Monetarists have grown especially defiant of late Lord Lolorito most of all. 200430 But this is neither the time nor place for that discussion. 300010 How goes the fishing? Caught anything slippery? 300020 Aye. Our suspicions were well founded. The Serpent Reavers are indeed the culprits. 300030 The plot thickens... 300040 Has there been any movement in Thanalan? 300050 It has been blessedly quiet. Which is to say the Amalj'aa are being no more or less of a nuisance than usual, summoning Ifrit with such crystals as they have hoarded. 300060 Urianger, too, reports naught out of the ordinary. 300070 Then we have our explanation. 300080 Your explanation for what, pray tell? 300090 For the recent spate of crystal thefts in Thanalan. We naturally assumed that the trail would lead us back to the Amalj'aa. 300100 Yet it did not. It led us across the sea unto Vylbrand. 300110 Vylbrand...? 300120 There have been reports of increased Sahagin activity of late... 300130 Oh gods...they mean to summon Leviathan? 300140 That is the way of it, I fear. 300150 Whilst conducting our investigation on behalf of the Mineral Concern, we came upon evidence implicating the Serpent Reavers. 300160 With the aid of the Maelstrom, I was able to verify our suspicions. 'Tis only a matter of time before Leviathan returns to harrow the seas. 300170 But there is more. One of the Sahagin an elder, by my judgment spoke of attaining the  gift and knowledge of eternity.  300180 <moan> 400010 Such a disturbance in the aether... If I did not know better, I should think this device defective. 400020 And there is the explanation... 400030 Soon! Sssoon it shall begin! Our Lord shall rise 'midst sssurging waves to wash away the finless ones! 400040 And I shall be granted the gift and knowledge of eternity, and with the emissary ssstand equal! Then shall I know no cesssation, no oblivion! 400050 ...Whence comes this promise of immortality? The emissary? 400060 We have outstayed our welcome. 500010  The gift...and knowledge.  500020 Are the two of you quite well? 500030 You...you shared that vision, did you not? 500040 Even before the Sahagin made mention of the emissary, I recognized Elidibus's words. He is behind this. 500050 But surely it is not within his power to grant the Echo? 500060 My lady unless we act swiftly, Leviathan will rise again. The Admiral has already requested that we intervene to prevent this. Failing that, we are to attend to the primal's extermination. 500070 She will have our full cooperation. Let us make haste to Limsa Lominsa. 500080 I mean to play a part in this mission. Tataru pray take charge in my absence. 500090 My lady, are you sure this is wise? 500100 I am aware of the risks. But there is something I must see with mine own eyes. 500110 ...The true nature of the Echo. 500120 Very well. I shall not stand in your way...on the condition that you permit me to accompany you as bodyguard. 500130 Your company is ever welcome, Thancred. 500140 I take it something ill is afoot? 500150 Aye. A primal is about to be loosed upon Eorzea. 500160 A...primal? 500170 A godlike being whose very existence is a bane upon the land. We Scions of the Seventh Dawn are sworn to put an end to their kind. 500180 I see. Know then that I am learned in the arts of war. In return for the kindness you have shown my people, I would lend you my blade. 500190 It would be most welcome. When contending with a primal, one can never have too many able allies. 500200 If you crave a more intimate understanding of the problems facing Eorzea, this experience is like to provide it. Be sure to come well prepared. 600010 Damn them... They have made thralls of soldiers and civilians both... 600030 Did I miss much? 600040 Hah. 600050 Yah. 600060 So that is how you fight in the Far East? Mental note: pick no quarrel with Domans. 600070 But seriously: if I am to keep up, I must needs forsake elegance for efficiency. 600080 Yah. 600090 Hah. 600100 Hmmm... 600110 To the aetheryte! 700010 You'll forgive me my lateness. 700020 I've been something of a liability of late, I know. 'Tis high time I set about making amends. 700030 Pshhh! Long have you shriveled shhhorewalkers tormented our kind! 700040 But no more! Your time is at an end! 700050 You shall perish with sssalt in your wounds and sssea in your lungs! 700060 Lord of the Whorl, hearken to our plea! Lord of the Whorl, deliver us from our misery! 700070 Do you feel that!? 700080 I know this sensation... It's the Echo! 700090 What!? 700100 Pshhh! Sssuch power! It is...transcendent! 700110 Seven hells... 700120 Pshhhahahahahaaa! Ssstrike me down if you will! It is futile! I have massstered the gift! I am...eternal! 700130 O mighty Leviathan, ruler of the ssseas, born of waters primordial! I offer unto You this frail fleshhh, that You might grant Your faithful servants deliverance! 700140 I beseech You! Come forth! 700150 Die, damn you! 700160 Foolishhh shorewalker! You cannot kill that which is eternal! 700170 Heavens forfend... 700180 Damn it all! 700190 Pshhh!? My being...ebbs away... B-But it should by rightsss be infinite! 700200 Am I not...immortal? Curse you, Emissary! You promised me...everlasssting... Pshhh... 700210 Wh-Where did he go!? 700220 What say you? Nary a single ship!? Hells take that sea demon! 700230 Gather the survivors and get to shore. Leave the wrecks for the pirates. 700240 Leviathan wastes no time. The diversionary squadron is lost. 700250 For a mercy, 'twould seem the primal now makes for open sea. But why does he not press his advantage? Unless... 700260 Gods save us, he means to unleash a tidal wave! 800010 There used to be a hamlet beyond South Tidegate in western La Noscea. Halfstone, 'twas called. 800020 Some years prior to the Maelstrom's founding, Leviathan rose from the briny depths, and set about unleashing watery hell upon us. On that occasion, the Company of Heroes put him down before he could do too much damage. 800030 But when the bastard came next, this time in the wake of the Calamity, we were not so fortunate. Weary of ravaging our shoreline, he summoned a tidal wave which fair leveled Halfstone, and washed the soil away for good measure. 800040 The area was subsequently occupied by the Sahagin. 800050 Aye, the thrice-damned creatures transformed it into a spawning ground for their brood. 800060 Given the quantity of crystals stolen to feed him and his legion of thralls, we can be fairly sure that Leviathan is stronger now than in his previous incarnations. 800070 If that sea demon is left to wreak havoc, what befell Halfstone may well befall a larger settlement even Limsa. 800080 That cannot happen. The primal must be stopped. 800090 That was ever our objective, Admiral. But how are we to achieve it? 800100 The sea is Leviathan's uncontested domain. The ships of the Third Squadron could not close to within a hundred yalms of the primal, nor could their cannons pierce his defenses. 800110 I have read the reports, Master Thancred. Our warships may as well have been bloody pleasure barges for all the good they did. Seven hells... Is there no way that we might strike back? 800120 The Company of Heroes defeated Leviathan having first lured him into an inlet, but we must needs contend with him upon the open sea. It will avail us little to consult past experience. 800130 Admiral, if I may. 800140 Speak freely, Marshal. 800150 By all accounts, Leviathan's most formidable weapon is the very sea itself. Waves and whirlpools, tides and currents all these things are his to command. The key to victory, I believe, lies in disarming our foe. 800160 This, in effect, is what the Company of Heroes achieved with their ruse. We cannot lure Leviathan from the sea a second time, but what if we could weaken his hold upon the element of water? I have heard of devices capable of such wonders. They draw upon the power of corrupted crystals, I am told. 800170 If mounted upon a ship, such a device might be used to prevent Leviathan from bringing the full force of the sea to bear against us, rendering him no more dangerous than any other sea serpent. 800180 Of course... Cid built a similar device to grant the Enterprise safe passage through Garuda's tempest, did he not? 800190 Begging your pardon, my lady, but to give credit where it's due, this is something I heard from an old arcanist friend of mine. 800200 It makes little difference who thought of it first, so long as it works. Beg the specifications of this device from your friend, and I shall pass them on to our people at Naldiq & Vymelli's. 800210 But before we proceed any further, I would voice one concern: piercing Garuda's defenses is one thing, suppressing Leviathan's attacks quite another. 800220 In matters of science, I am as a babbling babe, but I cannot well imagine that such a feat would be possible without a veritable mountain of corrupted crystals. 800230 The question being: do we have a ship big enough to bear such a burden? 800240 Mayhap not, Admiral. But two might. Recall you the tale of Mistbeard's greatest haul? It is said that he lashed two ships together, side by side, the better to bear his plunder. 800250 By your leave, we might attempt to repeat the trick. The gods know, it would be quicker than building a new vessel. 800260 Mistbeard did this? Truly, Marshal, upon the subject of the pirate king, you are as a scholar. 800270 Now, from what I have gleaned of these matters, the device will need to be in close and constant proximity to the target. To wit, we must lash our twin vessel to Leviathan. 800280 This in itself will be no small feat. Ramming speed will be required, but given the weight of the cargo, that will only be attainable with the aid of a towing vessel... 800290 Suffice it to say, the task of piloting said vessel will entail considerable danger, and I would not ask it of another. I volunteer myself. 800300 'Twill be dangerous for all involved...but we have no better recourse. Very well. 800310 Commodore. Assemble the remnants of the fleet at Moraby Bay. 800320 Give priority to our soundest vessels. The repairs can wait. 800330 Storm Marshal Slafyrsyn, command of the operation is yours. I want that twin vessel ready to sail posthaste. 800340 At once, Admiral! 800350 And then there is the small matter of slaying the beast... The fate of Limsa Lominsa rests upon your shoulders once again. Go well, Warrior of Light. 900010 We Lominsans are sworn to strive  Till sea swallows all and swallow all it would have, had Leviathan prevailed. That we still strive now, we owe in no small part to you. 900020 Not for the first time, you have delivered Limsa Lominsa from the wrath of a primal. Never has our nation known a stouter ally. 900030 On behalf of my people, I give you my humblest thanks. 900040 'Tis meet that I give thanks to old Mistbeard, too, for his fine solution. Whatever else he may have been, 'tis clear he was a resourceful soul. Would that I had a man like him in my service. 900050 Before I set foot in these lands, I had no inkling that the people of Eorzea contended with such mighty foes. Suffice it to say, their existence came as something of a shock as did the idea that they could be defeated. 900060 This experience has served to remind me of the vastness of the world...and the boundless potential of man. 900070 Though I am but a refugee in this realm, I would fain be of use to you in your fight. 900080 Know that I am tutored in one of the foremost combat arts of the Far East. It may seem...outlandish to the Eorzean eye, but should any of your people care to learn, I would be pleased to initiate them. 900090 And I will see to it that they are grateful. I have no doubt that your knowledge and skills will serve us well. 900100 Besides, your art is not so outlandish as you think. Would you not agree, Master Thancred? 900110 Naught escapes your searching eye, Admiral. 900120 Few are privy to this information, but Limsa Lominsa is home to a certain...secret fraternity. Its members are trained in a form of combat not unlike your own. 900130 By my judgment, it should not be beyond such individuals to adapt to the techniques I witnessed you employing with such admirable deftness. 900140 I am heartened to hear this. I, too, noted a kinship between your style and mine own. Though it seemed to me that you fought differently in the beginning. 900150 A-Aye, I suppose I did... What can I say? I am a man of many talents. Hahaha... 900160 Though you may labor to believe it, Thancred was once something of a scoundrel, who fraternized with the criminal class in these parts. 900170 Y-Y'shtola! You jest, of course! 900180 But for a chance encounter with Alphinaud's grandsire, he might never have left Limsa Lominsa; or received an education in Sharlayan; or taken up his post in Ul'dah which is where he trained in the blade, lest you wonder. 900190 Minfilia please! 900200 It would seem there is more to you than meets the eye, Master Thancred. 900210 Lady Yugiri I am told that you and yours came to Eorzea seeking permanent resettlement, and that many Domans have since been engaged as frontier hands at Revenant's Toll. Mor Dhona is many things, but a place of refuge it is not. 900220 Know that I would like nothing better than to furnish your people with a new home here on Lominsan soil. Alas, racked by instability as we are, our nation is in no fit state to take you in. 900230 Yet I'll not have it said that we turned a blind eye to your suffering. Until such time as we can do more, I pledge to send provisions. 900240 We are in your debt, Admiral. I realize that it scarce qualifies as repayment, but if it please you, I shall set about sharing my martial knowledge with your people at once. 900250 You wished a word in private. 900260 The better not to spoil the festive mood. 900270 History repeats itself, Admiral. As the kobolds did before them, the Sahagin resorted to summoning their god over a territorial feud. They acted in self-preservation. 900280 It may be that the Sahagin initiated this particular clash, but how it begins does not interest me so much as how it ends. 900290 I have not forgotten our conversation, Y'shtola. I am aware that man bears part of the blame for the primals' existence. 900300 Nor am I ignorant of the Sahagin's reason for acting. They sought to secure a place to breed and multiply, that their kind might survive. Self-preservation, as you say. 900310 But we have as much right to live and thrive as they. If our own survival is threatened, are we to lay down our arms and welcome oblivion? Nay. 900320 And so you kill, that you might live. Yet if living is a right, then that right belongs to all peoples, be they men or beastmen. 900330 I'll not deny your reasoning. But when a storm gathers, it falls to me to see my people safely through it. That is my duty, and I shall do it. 900340 As must we all, Admiral. Stay the course, then, but know that it will lead to no good end. 900350 Man has ever put himself first and foremost. 900360 To justify his actions, he clads himself in the armor of righteousness though it be a fancy of his own making. In this, mayhap the Garleans and we Domans are not so different... 900370 Eorzea has become as a raging sea. If we are to keep our heads above the waves, we cannot scruple to drown the man next to us. 900380 When hopes of coexistence founder, strength must determine who has the greater right to live. A00010 I have been reflecting upon the events which took place during our visit to Vylbrand. A00020 If you have a moment, I would share my conclusions with you. Please bear with me. A00030 When the Sahagin elder summoned Leviathan, he employed the power we have come to know as the Echo. A00040 Though I cannot well explain the how of it, it would seem he became immortal in so doing. A00050 When the Admiral subsequently slew him, his spirit emerged from his lifeless flesh, a consciousness shorn of physical form. A00060 Thus transfigured, he took up residence in the body of his minion with the ease of a man donning a favorite glove. A00070 Long have I known that the Echo allows one to pass through the walls of a man's soul. A00080 But never did I imagine that it could free us from our own flesh, nor less that our souls could then occupy the next corporeal vessel to take our fancy. A00090 It was of this that Elidibus spoke an existence which knows neither cessation nor oblivion. A00100 And yet, though the Sahagin had mastered his gift and thereby become immortal, he was by no means invulnerable. A00110 As we both bore witness, he was ultimately absorbed into Leviathan. A00120 And the import of this observation? If the Ascians' mode of existence is indeed the same, it can be inferred that they, too, are not invulnerable that they can be destroyed. A00130 There exists a legend which tells of souls who are reborn upon the cusp of each Umbral Calamity, that they might stay the encroaching Darkness. A00140 To most, it is but a faerie tale, yet recent events have given me cause to wonder: could the legend in fact refer to the Echo? A00150 Much and more yet remains unknown, but I am confident that all will become clear in time. A00160 For the present, however, what matters is that the key to defeating the Ascians may at last be within sight. A00170 With Urianger's aid, it is my hope that I shall fathom this matter ere long. A00180 Ah! I was just about to send for you, my friend. ...Is aught amiss? A00190 Grave tidings from the Sharlayan motherland, my lady. A00200 It doth concern our distant allies, the Students of Baldesion. A00210 What of them? A00220 My lady...the Isle of Val, which for many years hath been the order's home, is no more. A00230 No more? Whatever do you mean? A00240 I relate only that which hath been conveyed unto me by our agents. An aetheric wave of the highest magnitude was recorded in the region. Soon thereafter, 'twas observed that the isle had ceased to be. A00250 'Tis postulated that a magick was evoked, like in power to Ultima. A00260 Twelve preserve... B00010 If there are no other matters, I move that today's meeting be adjourned. B00020 It is done, my lord. B00030 I... <cough> F-Forgive my impertinence, my lord, but these orders... I am uncertain as to what end they serve. B00040 Revolution. C00010 Um. Well, then! C00020 That's enough of a beating for now!

name: 2.3 A Realm Reborn Cutscenes [VoiceMan_02300]
text_html:
000020

Ul'dah, on the other hand, is not. This riot was anything but an isolated incident.


000030

There is a restlessness in the air. Tensions long simmering are at last threatening to boil over.


000040

Ul'dah is a nation infamous for the great disparity between the wealthy and the poor. The majority of the populace accepts this state of affairs because they believe that every man bears responsibility for his own lot in life.


000050

To an Ul'dahn, money is the foremost─and some would say the only─measure of a man's worth. Small wonder that the wealthiest wield the greatest influence.


000060

So where do the refugees fit into this social hierarchy? What place is there for those who fled Ala Mhigo and the destruction of the Calamity?


000070

Plainly, there is none. They have no wealth, no power, and no worth. To the Ul'dahn way of thinking, they may as well not exist.


000080

Choosing to ignore their existence, however, is patently not an option. General Raubahn and the sultana understand this, which is why they ordered the Immortal Flames to provide the refugees aid and succor.


000090

Yet none would dispute that the expenses incurred by this policy grow by the day, with no end in sight.


000100

This has prompted more and more Ul'dahns to question their obligation to aid these worthless wanderers...


000110

While more and more refugees have come to resent their treatment at the hands of the sneering citizenry.


000120

The manner of Lord Lolorito's refusal to grant the Domans asylum bespoke a disdain for all refugees─an attitude shared by the rest of the Monetarists. And you may be sure they make no effort to conceal their opinions.


000130

It was only a matter of time before the refugees united in protest. Nor is it any surprise that some among them would ultimately resort to violence.


000140

That the Immortal Flames should choose this of all occasions to engage in joint training exercises with the other Grand Companies... By the time they return, the situation may well have deteriorated beyond mending.


100010

Commander Swift has kept us apprised of your recent activities. You've made great strides towards quelling the violence.


100020

Despite our best efforts to determine what provoked this uprising, the truth continues to elude us. Have you uncovered aught which might shed some light on the mystery?


100030

This information does not leave this room.


100040

The Syndicate's decision to reject the Doman refugees' appeal for asylum had lasting repercussions. A number of those displaced by the Calamity claimed it was proof of a policy of discrimination.


100050

Together with a group of Ala Mhigan refugees, they organized a series of demonstrations to protest against the sultanate.


100060

Demonstrations which became heated, but did not descend into violence.


100070

Until a certain incident served as a call to arms.


100080

A unit of Brass Blades sent to supervise a demonstration loosed arrows upon unarmed protesters.


100090

It was this atrocity which prompted the refugees to take up arms. I need not tell you what followed.


100100

We assumed at first that the attack was born of a miscommunication. When emotions run high, they happen. But suspicions were raised regarding the unit's commanding officer, whom I ordered interrogated.


100110

Sure enough, our fears were soon confirmed. The dog confessed that a merchant had offered him coin to give the order─a merchant in the employ of Teledji Adeledji.


100120

Teledji Adeledji?


100130

But he spoke in favor of the Domans' cause, and has ever seemed sympathetic towards the refugees' plight. Why would he do such a thing?


100140

Know you of the Carteneau Reclamation Bill?


100150

It is a proposal to annex the Carteneau Flats so that refugees may establish permanent settlements.


100160

When last I looked, that was disputed territory.


100170

Aye. Some might even call it a battlefield.


200010

The destruction wrought by Bahamut was greatest at the Carteneau Flats. That much is common knowledge.


200020

What is less well known is that his rampage laid bare ancient Allagan ruins, of which no record existed.


200030

There are certain...differences of opinion as to how these ruins should be handled, which is why each nation maintains a military presence in the region to this day.


200040

Yet differ though we may, we are still allies. Therefore, in the interest of preserving the Eorzean Alliance, we have reached an agreement.


200050

Any conflict which may arise during the course of military exercises in the region shall have no bearing on relations between our nations.


200060

In full knowledge of this delicate state of affairs, Teledji Adeledji proposed the Carteneau Reclamation Bill.


200070

A shameless bloody ruse which stands to benefit him in but one conceivable way.


200080

If successful, he will gain control over the disputed territory, under the guise of assisting in the resettlement effort. And you can be sure he'll build an orphanage next to every Allagan ruin.


200090

The man would threaten the unity of the Eorzean Alliance and risk countless lives for personal gain!


200100

He walks a path all his own, independent of any faction, and beholden to none of his fellows on the Syndicate.


200110

By inciting the less fortunate to violence, he hopes to convince others that the Carteneau Reclamation Bill is the only viable solution.


200120

His sympathy for the plight of the Domans was naught but posturing to gain credibility with the refugees. Of that there can be no doubt.


300010

Forgive me, but what could possibly motivate Teledji Adeledji to go to such lengths? What is so special about these ruins that he would risk his position on the Syndicate, and, most likely, charges of treason against the sultanate?


300020

Omega...


300030

Pardon?


300040

An Allagan monstrosity, not unlike the Ultima Weapon. Mayhap larger. We know not. It has yet to be fully excavated.


300050

Allagan inscriptions indicate that it was created to fell Bahamut himself.


300060

If accurate, it might explain why Nael van Darnus chose to bring the red moon down upon the Carteneau Flats.


300070

Given the ends he went to to ensure Eorzea's annihilation, destroying the one weapon which could stay the elder primal may well have seemed like good sense.


300080

When first I bore witness to the power of the Ultima Weapon, I doubted the evidence of my senses... And now you tell me there is another such weapon─one which could contend with Bahamut. Bahamut.


300090

Aye. We were skeptical ourselves. Truth be told, until the Ultima Weapon's existence came to light, we thought the inscription had been mistranslated.


300100

At present, Omega is more akin to a fossil than a tool of war, having long since ceased to function. As such, its true potential cannot accurately be gauged.


300110

However, if someone were to restore it, as the Garleans did the Ultima Weapon, I have little doubt that he would wield untold power.


300120

Power enough to subjugate Ul'dah, like as not, and the rest of Eorzea besides─which is doubtless why Teledji Adeledji yearns to have it.


300130

That he should aspire to world domination... He who has ever walked two paces behind Lord Lolorito in matters of commerce.


300140

'Tis in acknowledgement of his own limitations that he seeks this power. Woe betide us all should we allow him to have it.


300150

Pray waste no time chasing rats. Only a fool would believe that secrets can be kept in Ul'dah.


300160

It would seem the implications of the sultanate's refugee problem are rather more far-reaching than we assumed...


400010

The incident with the new frontier hands? No, no, you need not elaborate─I have been following their progress with no small amount of interest.


400020

Brave men and women all... They do our nation a great service. The existence of a fortified outpost in Mor Dhona will do much to dissuade the Empire from trespassing on Coerthan soil.


400030

Right glad am I that you have chosen to lend your support to this endeavor. Never let it be said that House Fortemps does not acknowledge the efforts of her allies...or her debts.


400040

'Twas in the spirit of gratitude that I arranged for sundry supplies to be delivered to Revenant's Toll. That the shipment should chance to be waylaid by heretics is poor fortune, indeed.


400050

Poor fortune, I say...yet not without precedent. If you would know the truth of it, these incorrigible villains grow more organized with each passing day.


400060

This new unity of purpose we attribute to their leader─the Lady “Iceheart.” But though I have devoted significant resources to the task of identifying this woman, we have yet to learn so much as her birth name.


400070

What we do know is that the heretics speak of Iceheart in reverent tones, and would gladly embrace death rather than betray her. Such loyalty is rare indeed, and I fear to imagine what so committed a collective might achieve.


400080

The brigands have not yet been so brazen as to risk direct confrontation here in Dragonhead. Some few of their number have, however, been sighted not far to the west of here...and with ever-increasing regularity.


400090

A visit to Whitebrim Front may bring you the answers you seek. Will you brave the snows knowing what implacable foes may lie in wait?


400100
