But a short while ago, the great elemental spoke, and his voice was clarion in its intensity: Ramuh is returned unto the forest. 700030 Scarce had his words ceased to echo in mine ears when we were visited by an emissary from Little Solace. 700050 Our guest informs us that the sylphs, too, have sensed the presence of the Lord of Levin. 700055 Our guest informs us that the sylphs, too, have sensed the presence of the Lord of Levin. 700060 Though his exact whereabouts remain unknown, we may safely assume that the primal was summoned within the heart of the Sylphlands. 700070 Unlike the other primals you have encountered, Lord Ramuh is no raging avatar of destruction. He is revered as much for his wisdom as his strength, serving as both arbiter and guardian to his children. Given that we and the sylphs found a way to share the Twelveswood, it is my hope that this sagely immortal will be amenable to reason, and that conflict may be avoided. 700080 Blessed as you are with the power of the Echo, you are one of the few among us who may commune with a primal without fear of influence. I would ask therefore that you represent us in this most delicate of negotiations. 700090 The Twelveswood has suffered enough. Upon this, we and the sylphs and I would venture Lord Ramuh himself are in perfect accord. Let us not endanger our shared home by engaging in unnecessary hostilities. 700100 Dear friend, I beseech you: safeguard the peace which exists between our peoples. 700110 You have my thanks. 700120 Pray make for Little Solace, then. A member of the Order of the Twin Adder awaits you there. He will advise you on how to find the Lord of Levin. 700130 An ill wind blows through the forest. 700140 Yet...it is not only the Twelveswood that flinches at its coming all the lands of Eorzea shiver in dread anticipation. Have care. 800010 Thine aura betrays thee, servant of Hydaelyn. 800020 Thou art the Bringer of Light...bane of Ifrit, Titan, Garuda, and Leviathan. 800030 I am Ramuh, guardian of the children of the forest. 800040 Thou tramplest upon sacred soil, Bringer of Light. By what right doth man intrude in this sanctuary of the sylphs? 800050 The Gridanians proffer peace? Their words are born of delusion thine offer, an insult. 800060 Thou speakest of harmony, yet carest naught for my children's desires. They did but wish to dwell beneath these boughs in solitude yet even that was too much to ask of man. 800070 Thus did they turn to me for succor. The sentence I pronounce upon thy kind is just. 800080 Gridanian or Garlean, it matters not. The good intent of one excuseth not the misdeeds of the other. 800090 Thy conflicts have brought naught but anguish and misery unto the forest. All blame doth lie with the darkness that resideth in the breast of man. 800100 Whence sprung this calamitous seed? In the beginning, no such duality existed. Were light and dark given form when man was born? 800110 It would explain much. Not least why strife and sorrow follow ever in thy wake. Thou canst not deny the urgings of thine own nature. 800120 Knowing that thy mere presence here portendeth tragedy, wilt thou persist in this pretense of peacemaking? 800130 Thou bearest the crystal which I bestowed upon my wayward charges. That they should entrust so precious a gift to thee... 800140 Thou standest apart from thy kin. Thou art the Bringer of Light, aye...but there is something more in thee... 800150 Very well, I shall consider thy proposal...shouldst thou survive my trial. 800160 If thou wouldst champion the cause of harmony, I must have proof that thou art fit to play the role. Weather mine ire, and prove to me thereby that thou hast strength enough to stay the Darkness which threateneth to consume thee. 800170 Yet if thou shouldst be found wanting, know that all men shall perish in the storm of my judgment! 800180 Come to me, Bringer of Light. I shall await thee on the field of battle! 800190 Urianger. It is rare indeed to find you so far from a tome. 800200 The Lord of Levin himself... Never till this day had I looked upon his visage save in painted renderings, made faint by time... Ever shall this scene remain etched in my mind's eye... Ahem. Beg pardon, my lady. 800210 I must beg thine aid on a point of research. If thou art resolved to face Lord Ramuh, I would ask thy leave to observe the event... 900010 I have taken thy measure, Bringer of Light. 900020 And I judge thee a worthy champion. The task of excising the sin that hath taken root in man's heart is thine. 900030 Shrink not from employing thy strength in service to the forest, and the wider realm beyond. Like hungering shadows do the enemies of harmony gather, and meekness will but feed them. 900040 If man is to be delivered from the Dark, it shall be by thy guiding Light alone. Stray not from the path, for if thou dost, thy people shall be truly lost... 900050 Thou hast slain the Lord of Levin. A regrettable act...but a necessary one. 900060 In witnessing thy struggle, a truth hath been revealed unto me. If I mistake not, it may yet prove a chink in the eternal armor of the Ascians. 900070 But let us conclude our present business. I shall expound upon my findings at the Rising Stones anon. A00010 You are returned to us, dear friend, and none the worse for bearing the heavy burden which I did press upon you. Most glad am I of this. A00020 I am informed that your efforts to negotiate a peace with Lord Ramuh ended in conflict. Pray tell me, what befell? A00030 Ramuh made trial of you? A00040 I fear there is truth to his claim. It is the darkness within us that attracts the Darkness without. A00050 It cannot be denied that misfortune follows man. For evidence, one need only look to the conflict brewing in Carteneau, or to the rising flood of refugees. A00060 Our shared struggle against the Empire should have served to seal our union, yet the ties which bind the Alliance strain under the weight of gross self-interest. A00070 As the scars of the Calamity begin to fade, so too does our sense of common purpose. A00080 Yet now is scarce the time to forget our shared responsibility. If this new-sprung realm is to survive beyond its infancy, it must needs be nurtured by all. A00090 Eorzea must be as one. Yet I fear that dream is still far off. A00100 On behalf of the people of Gridania, and the elementals both, I thank you for all that you and your fellow Scions have done. A00110 Full oft have I been compelled to look to you for aid of late...and offered all too little in return. As leader of this nation, I shall endeavor to prove a more worthy ally to your cause henceforth. A00120 Lord Ramuh has departed, yet the keening of this ill wind grows no less insistent... A00130 Voices of the forest pray speak and I shall listen. What unseen evil begets this unease in my heart? B00010 If everyone is ready, let us begin. B00020 Urianger, the floor is yours. B00030 As all here assembled now know, in its final hours as our order's headquarters, the Waking Sands did play host to a most unexpected visitor. I speak of the Ascian clad in white, Elidibus. B00040 Unwelcome though his presence was, his words that day did serve to confirm a truth long suspected: that the Ascians are eternal beings, to whom physical destruction is as a temporary inconvenience. B00050 In the intervening time, Urianger and I have striven to discover a means by which the Ascians might more permanently be slain. B00060 And 'tis my belief that we have found the thread that will allow us to unravel the twisted skein of their existence. B00070 In the moments prior to Leviathan's most recent manifestation, the Sahagin elder who summoned him was observed to undergo some manner of ascension. B00080 The aetheric readings taken by Y'shtola at the time of this transfiguration have proven most enlightening. B00090 The disruption to the flow of aether was sudden and dramatic. So tangible was the agitation, I scarce had need of my goggles. B00100 The significance of Y'shtola's readings might better be understood in the context of mine own, taken at the instant of the Lord of Levin's demise. Unlike the primal, the Sahagin was not subject to aetheric dissipation. B00110 Before discussing our new discoveries, it may benefit us all to recall what we know of aetheric behavior. B00120 Let us begin at what some might call the end. When we who dwell in the material realm die, our spirits dissolve into the flow of aether, and are returned to the aetherial realm. B00130 In turn, the restless energy which suffuses that plane streams back into our world, giving rise to new life. B00140 'Tis as the heavens did decree the way of all mortal souls. B00150 'Twixt this world and the next do the aetherial currents swirl, bearing the very essence of life. Thus doth the cycle of birth, death, and rebirth continue unabated. B00160 Primals behave somewhat differently. In order to manifest and then maintain a physical presence in this realm, they must consume vast quantities of aether, most often in the form of crystals. Though they may seem to live, their flesh is but aether given shape. B00170 Thus, a defeated primal leaves behind no broken corpse rather, the essence of its form seeps back into the land whence it came, and the energy of its shattered spirit is called back to the aetherial realm. B00180 And there it waiteth till next the prayers of the faithful do draw it forth from the sea of aether to take their offering of crystals and make for itself a new body... B00190 Which brings us on to the third group. These so-called  immortals.  They exist in a manner all their own. B00200 Quite. Even as the Sahagin elder fell to the Admiral's musket shot, I witnessed the release of an aetherial cloud which immediately took possession of a nearby minion. B00210 A soul that dissipateth not upon the death of the flesh... B00220 The secret of life everlasting. And in the claws of a Sahagin, no less. But I wonder: what would happen to one of these obstinate spirits should there be no suitable host for it to claim? B00230 If mortal death entails a return to the aetherial realm, it seems doubtful that the soul of an immortal would venture there. B00240 Nay, it merely withdraweth a distance. Unto the shore of the aetherial sea, perchance, but no further. B00250 Yes, it exists in neither this realm nor the next, abiding instead in the space that lies between them. B00260 The Ascians took control of Thancred by means of a Crystal of Darkness an artifact which, if our theories are correct, serves as a gateway to the place I have just described. B00270 I was hoping people had forgotten about that... B00280 I am sorry, my friend. B00290 For a mercy, the weary road of our research hath brought us unto an answer. B00300 The Sahagin ascended to an immortal state, but he did not possess a Crystal of Darkness through which to flee this realm. Thus was he consumed by Leviathan. B00310 If we could entrap the spirits of defeated Ascians in like manner, and thereby deny them resurrection... B00320 Therein lieth the path to victory. Thou art most perceptive, my lady. B00330 Only when we have trapped the bodiless soul within an aetherial prison can we hope to defeat its unnatural constancy. Thus, might even an eternal Paragon be consigned to oblivion. B00340 These feats are, of course, far easier said than done. At present, we lack a viable means to entrap and extinguish an Ascian soul. B00350 Yet I believe it to be possible. The pieces of the puzzle lie before us we have but to put them together. B00360 I will depart at once to convene with the sages of Sharlayan. Together shall we divine the steps by which our goals may be achieved. B00370 I have the utmost faith in you, Archon. B00380 Beg pardon, Antecedent, but I would raise one final matter... Even now, a Sharlayan survey party seeketh to ascertain the fate of the Students of Baldesion. B00390 Their findings shall soon be known to us. Though you harbor feelings of dread, I bid you surrender not to sorrow, but abide instead in hopeful prayer. B00400 I shall, Archon. Thank you. C00010 Tell me, General: what think you of Alphinaud's bold endeavor? C00020 I think it is more than bold, Your Grace. His organization would pave the way for a united Eorzea. C00030 Well do I understand his impatience. Since facing the common threat of the Ultima Weapon, our nations have seemed farther apart, not closer together. C00040 Considering the many problems we face, should we not be glad that someone else is taking the initiative? C00050 We have all pledged our cooperation, yet the grumbling continues behind closed doors. Ul'dah is not alone in her duplicity. C00060 I myself have doubts as to the good this organization will achieve. C00070 With the inclusion of the finest soldiers of the three Grand Companies, it promises to be a fearsome military body. But whom will it serve? Even under the watchful gaze of the Scions, it is not unthinkable that such a force could perpetrate a great wrong. C00080 Does it not concern you that a significant proportion of its financial backing came from the coffers of the Syndicate? That those unprincipled worms might forge this extraordinary gathering of warriors into a private army? C00090 I have trust in the Scions, Your Grace. They have spared us no end of trouble at the hands of the primals. If they seek reinforcements, I deem it unwise to deny them. C00100 As for their finances, full many gave generously. And though our nobles proffered a sizable sum, their coin did not spill from the pockets of Lolorito and his cronies. C00110 And what of the presence of our stalwart adventurer friend in this endeavor? I doubt the Warrior of Light would betray our cause. C00120 Yes, there is that, I suppose. C00130 Yet I have known people to change. Whether we will or no, the events of the age hurl us this way and that, like a dust devil skipping across the sands... C00140 Can naught be done about Teledji? C00150 I have explored all avenues available to us, Your Grace, but as Ul'dahn law now stands, we lack the evidence to convict him of any crime. To arrest him on spurious grounds would only play into his hands... C00160 He has all but committed treason, and yet we can do nothing!? C00170 Then what good our government!? What worth the royal house!? How deplorable this mockery of justice! C00180 This isn't the text you're looking for. C00190 Have faith, Your Grace. It is not over... D00010 Comrades! Your presence here this day signifies the momentous choice that each of you has made. D00020 With your strength now pledged to the Scions of the Seventh Dawn, you are beholden to no single nation. You stand as the vanguard for a united Eorzea! D00030 From this moment forth, I declare you Crystal Braves! Let us mend this fractured realm, and face our enemies as one! D00040 Whether it be the beastmen and their primals, or the conflict in Carteneau, it is plain that the nations of Eorzea cannot solve the problems which plague the realm. Thus does it fall to some few heroic souls to succeed where they have failed! D00050 Come! Take your place at the Scions' side as guardians of Eorzea! And together we shall fight for the freedom of all! D00060 (-Crystal Braves-)For the freedom of all! D00070 A rousing speech, Alphinaud. Or should I say, Crystal Brave Commander Leveilleur? D00080 Please, Antecedent...the title is honorary. I shall not be  leading the troops into battle,  as it were. D00090 We are of the same purpose. Let us join hands, and do what must be done to save this land. D00100 The Scions stand ready! E00010 I'm eager to see what the Crystal Braves might accomplish. This shall prove an interesting time indeed for the Scions. E00020 Yes, I'm listening. E00030 So, our worst fears are confirmed. The entire isle... Such power defies comprehension... E00040 Truly!? Krile is alive!? Thank the Twelve... E00050 ...I see. Pray inform me if her condition changes. Yes. I shall pass on your words to Urianger. E00060 My thanks. I shall contact you anon. E00070 When I learned of the loss of the Isle of Val, I dared not hope that my friend had survived. Yet by some miracle, it would seem she has. She's still to regain consciousness, it is true, but better that than death. E00080 Putting this happy news to one side, we must now endeavor to make sense of the readings taken by the survey party. E00090 It appears the aetheric disturbance which accompanied the isle's destruction is of a magnitude alarmingly close to that of Ultima. Could the Ascians be responsible for this devastation as well? E00100 I wonder... Have you heard aught from the Mothercrystal since the battle with the Garleans? E00110 Then She speaks to neither one of us. Hydaelyn's silence portends naught but ill, I fear.  E00120 Louisoix... I pray you yet watch over us...

name: 2.4 A Realm Reborn Cutscenes [VoiceMan_02400]
text_html:
000020

...Commander Leveilleur bade you serve us?


000030

These are welcome tidings indeed. Given the sensitive nature of the task, I could not rely on one of my own.


000040

That which I am about to tell you, I tell you in the strictest confidence.


000050

Some days ago, we received certain documents from an anonymous source. They notified us of the presence of a Garlean agent within the ranks of one of the Grand Companies.


000060

Following some discreet inquiries, we identified a suspect among the Immortal Flames whom we detained for questioning.


000070

Alas, the man was not our agent. He was but one of many men in the agent's employ.


000080

We pressed the traitor for a name, but he had none to give. He claims never to have met his master, whom he knows only as the Ivy.


000090

He was, however, certain that this “ivy” had coiled itself around every part of the Immortal Flames. It would seem our quarry joined the company some time ago, and gradually recruited others to his cause.


000100

These conspirators are the vines by which he learns our secrets, all without exposing himself.


000110

It won't be easy to identify the Ivy amidst this tangled mass of subterfuge. But we have a tendril in our hands, and we shall follow it all the way to the gnarled root.


000120

Now, much as I would prefer to proceed with due discretion, circumstances demand that this matter be settled posthaste.


000130

Garlemald's war of succession nears its end, and it is feared that the Empire will soon resume its march on Eorzea.


000140

When it does, we can ill afford to have traitors in our midst. The Ivy must be rooted out now.


000150

We must begin by apprising General Raubahn of our findings. I would ask that you accompany me to the Hall of Flames, and remain on hand to see that things go smoothly.


000160

Assuming the Ivy's tendrils are as widespread as we believe, he will be aware that an investigation is underway. And if that is the case, he may well move against us.


000170

We must be prepared for anything, while taking care not to betray our purpose by seeming prepared. A simple enough task for a one-woman army like you.


100010

Well, well. What brings you here, my friend?


100011

She is here at my behest. Greetings, Raubahn. It has been a while.


100020

Ilberd, you old scoundrel! When they told me you'd be visiting, I scarce believed my ears!


100030

But look at you! The honored captain of the Crystal bloody Braves! Who'd have imagined, eh?


100040

Not many. But fewer still would have imagined your destiny lay in politics, old friend.


100050

Aye...we've both come far, have we not?


100060

Lest you wonder, Ilberd and I go back a long way. We've been friends and rivals since we were lads.


100070

The last time we saw each other, Ala Mhigo had just fallen, so you can guess how many summers it's been. And in all that time, not a word from the fool!


100080

Ah, well, my dealings tended toward the modest and mundane...unlike some I could mention.


100090

As I hear it, no sooner did you reach Thanalan than the Brass Blades clapped you in irons and dragged you off to die on the bloodsands. But being a stubborn sort, you won a thousand matches, and earned yourself a place in the people's hearts while you were about it.


100100

Then, with your mountain of prize money, you bought the Coliseum, and secured a seat on the Syndicate. Thal's balls, brother─rags-to-riches does not do it justice! You're a hero to the common man!


100110

Bah, spare me. I am no hero. If anyone is worthy of that title, it's our friend here. Next to her, I'm little more than a glorified butcher.


100120

But you, Ilberd─you sell yourself short. By all accounts, you were an adventurer of some standing.


100130

I like to think that I did my part for the greater good. But if you are no hero, then I am no adventurer─not in this company. Anyway...


100140

I have tidings.


100150

So there has been progress.


100160

I've let it be known that this meeting is a reunion between old friends. None will give your visit a second thought.


100170

To convene elsewhere would only attract attention. Let us speak here, in plain view of all.


100180

...So it is we who have been compromised.


100190

Teledji Adeledji's machinations have shaken Ul'dah to her foundations. In such uncertain times, a man's loyalty may be bought for a fistful of gil...


100200

But if this snake has truly been in our midst for as long as you say, we must needs consider a far graver possibility: conspiracy. Could it be that the Monetarists have been in league with the Empire from the first?


100210

Very well. I will have my most trusted men investigate the matter. Continue your inquiries in the meantime.


100220

It does me well to see you again, old friend. When next we meet, let it be over a flagon of ale.


100230

I look forward to it. Let us reminisce of bygone days, and drink to the future of our homeland.


100240

Flame General... You wear the mantle well, old friend. I must work hard if I'm to keep up.


100250

Well, it would seem your services were not required after all. I daresay we have Raubahn's prudence to thank for that. Still, I was glad of your presence. My thanks, Scion.


300010

Have faith, my friend. You need only state your case with confidence and clarity.


300020

(-???-)Commander Leveilleur. It is both an honor and a pleasure to meet you.


300030

I am Aymeric, lord commander of the Temple Knights.


300040

Alphinaud Leveilleur, at your service.


300050

Your reputation precedes you, Ser Aymeric. I think we will find that we have much in common.


300060

Speaking of reputations, yours towers over us all. Does it not?


300080

(-Taciturn Temple Knight-)It does indeed, Lord Commander.


300090

I am not too proud to admit that I have followed your activities with an interest bordering on fascination.


300100

Full glad was I to learn that you would be joining us.


300110

Now then, shall we begin?


300120

We know full well that the Garleans will return in force ere long.


300130

What is more, we have yet to achieve a lasting victory over the primal menace. The beast tribes continue to summon their gods, and each incarnation is stronger than the last.


300140

Ishgard is not immune to these threats. I must reiterate that it would behoove your nation to rejoin the Eorzean Alliance.


300150

Once again, I must respectfully disagree.


300160

On what grounds?


300170

Despite their presence in Coerthas, the Ixal do not concern us. Their territorial claims pertain to Gridanian lands, and it is the people of Gridania whom they harry.


300180

Consequently, the Holy See judges this to be a Gridanian affair, and Ishgard does not intervene in the internal affairs of other nations.


300190

Even were that not the case, our forces are wholly committed to the Dravanian conflict. We have not the knights to spare.


300200

As for the Garleans, we are not ignorant of history. We have observed the rise and expansion of the Empire, and we agree that it is only a matter of time before they resume their campaign in Eorzea.


300220

Then surely it would be in our best interests to present a united front?


300230

Mayhap one day, but not yet.


300240

Gaius van Baelsar is dead, and the legion of conscripts he left behind lacks the will to fight. We think it highly unlikely that they will emerge from behind the walls of their castra for some time.


300250

Forgive me, but if Ishgard's position has not changed, why did you agree to this meeting?


300260

It was not only as a representative of Ishgard that I came here.


300270

Pardon?


300280

It is not within my power to change Ishgardian policy, regardless of my personal feelings. There is, however, one area in which I may exert a measure of influence.


300290

Concerns have been raised over the supplies House Fortemps has offered to Revenant's Toll. These have led to calls for restrictions on the provision of aid to foreign powers.


300300

I can ensure that the shipments continue unabated.


300310

Ser Aymeric, we would be in your debt!


300320

No, you would not, for I require something in exchange.


300330

Of late there has been a flurry of Dravanian activity, the purpose of which was not immediately clear.


300340

However, our astrologians have since observed alarming changes in the heavens. The dragon star waxes unnaturally bright, and there are whispers that it portends the resurrection of Midgardsormr.


300350

The fallen guardian of Silvertear Falls? That's absurd.


300360

Full many times have I gazed upon the dragon's corpse, still wound around the Agrius, and wondered how different our world might be if it yet lived to plague the skies.


300370

I do not know, and I do not wish to know. Nor does any son of Ishgard. Yet the mere presence of Dravanian forces is not sufficient grounds to send knights to Mor Dhona, whatever our astrologians say. As I told you before, we have not the forces to spare.


300380

...But we do. So, you will intervene on our behalf if we agree to watch over the Keeper of the Lake.


300390

Do you accept these terms?


300400

I do. I will see that you are kept abreast of any developments.


300410

I regret that we could not come to a similar agreement on other matters, but I understand that you are not at liberty to make such decisions.


300420

Nevertheless, I hope that what we have accomplished here today will serve to demonstrate to your countrymen that we can work together towards a common goal. Mayhap one day we shall look back on this moment as the first step towards a united Eorzea.


300440

Mayhap we shall, Commander.


300450

What is the meaning of this!?


300460

The caravan, my lord! It's been attacked!


300470

It was Iceheart, my lord!


300480

What!? By the Fury! All our precautions were for naught!?


600010

(-???-)The tales do not do you justice, Warrior of Light.


600020

(-???-)Yes, I know who you are. And you know who I am.


600030

(-Iceheart-)I was given the name Ysayle, but I earned the name Iceheart.


600040

(-Iceheart-)This endless cycle of hatred, of bloodshed, of sorrow─ You would see it continue, O noble Warrior of Light?


600050

(-Iceheart-)I would not. I will not. I will bring an end to this war between dragon and man─no matter the cost.


600080

(-Iceheart-)In time, you will come to understand that what we do, we do for the greater good.


600090

(-Iceheart-)For Eorzea. For Hydaelyn.


900010

Change has come to the Garlean Empire, and we must discuss the implications.


900011

The rumors are true then? The war of succession is ended?


900020

It is. A new emperor reigns in Garlemald.


900030

Who!?


900040

The birth and all-too-rapid expansion of the Garlean Empire is commonly attributed to the strategic brilliance of Solus zos Galvus, yet he did not rule alone. Several members of the royal household also distinguished themselves during his reign.


900050

Nevertheless, it was the eldest son who stood to inherit the throne─until his most untimely passing.


900060

I thought us fortunate when I learned that the Emperor had died without naming a successor.


900070

Would that the Garlean Empire had died with him.


900080

'Twas the grandson and his uncle who had the strongest claims, was it not?


900090

Indeed. Yet claims count for little without the power to assert them. High Legatus Varis yae Galvus is a respected military leader─not so, his uncle.


900100

So, young Varis has torn the crown from his uncle's grasp, and taken his place at the head of the Empire.


900120

Given the troubled nature of his succession, the new emperor will require time to seal his grip on power. Yet have no doubt but that he shall, for there are none left with strength enough to oppose him.


900130

Since the success of Operation Archon, the remnants of the XIVth Legion and the forces occupying Ala Mhigo have done naught but fortify their positions.


900140

But you can be sure they'll be ready to march on us again, if their emperor gives the word.


900150

When, not if. They say this Varis was so set upon Eorzean annexation that he spoke out against the Meteor project.


900160

Plainly, the new emperor's intentions are of great concern to us all.


900170

I propose that we set aside the Carteneau dispute for the present and discuss what measures the Alliance might take to prepare for a resumption of hostilities with Garlemald.


900171

Moreover, I move that we reexamine the question of how our former allies in Ishgard might be persuaded to retake their place at our side. Could Eorzea but stand as one, 'twould deal a grave blow to our enemy's ambitions.


900180

Well, I suppose we should be grateful that they have finally acknowledged the inevitability of imperial attack. Who knows, they may even do something about it.


900190

If only the leaders of Ishgard would follow their example, and stop hiding behind their gates, praying for the coming storm to pass them by.


900200

But that is a discussion for another time. At present, I am more concerned by the fact that the Alliance's mooted preparations will be made known to the Garleans many moons before their coming.


900210

So long as the Ivy eludes our grasp, no secret is safe.


B00010

(-???-)Minfilia, am I right?


B00020

None other. I bid you welcome to Revenant's Toll, and thank you for traveling so far on such short notice.


B00030

(-???-)Hah! As if I could ever say no to Urianger!


B00040

Moenbryda is an accomplished Sharlayan scholar and an authority on aetheryte technologies.


B00050

She has played an invaluable role in our search for a means to capture Ascian souls.


B00060

Charmed, I'm sure.


C00010

Everyone, if I could have your attention!


C00011

We have with us an esteemed guest who is come from Sharlayan to assist us.


C00020

I barely succeeded in facilitating travel to an unattuned beacon. That which you describe sounds considerably more difficult.


C00420

And dangerous! Every person who has attempted to teleport in this fashion has died in the process. They, however, did not have white auracite at their disposal!


C00440

C00490

C00500

If the aetherial current still flows, we shall carry out Moenbryda's plan.


C00510

That's the spirit! Let's roll the dice!


D00010

D00020

A peace you would deny us out of ignorance and blind faith.


D00030

No matter. If it is our fate to be at odds, then it is mine to strike you down.


D00040

We whom gods and men have forsaken shall be the instruments of our own deliverance!


D00050

Partake of my flesh─fill this vessel with your light! Walk amongst your brothers and sisters once more!


D00060

O Saint Shiva, still the hatred within our hearts and bless us with eternal grace!


D00070

Hmph...


E00010

E00020

E00021

(-Iceheart-)Mine is the righteous cause!


E00030

E00040

(-Iceheart-)And they are no less ignorant than you! Following the creed of their fathers without question, never thinking to ask why.

(-Iceheart-)Trapped in a delusion of their own creation and blind to the truth.


E00060

(-Iceheart-)Warrior of Light, redemption is not beyond us.


E00070

(-Iceheart-)We who walk before may lead those who walk after.


E00080

(-Iceheart-)Seek the Keeper of the Lake. See with eyes unclouded.


E00090

(-Iceheart-)Do...do not squander Mother's gift.

E00120

(-???-)Nevertheless, Lahabrea will be pleased.


E00130

(-???-)How unfortunate.


F00010

On behalf of the Holy See of Ishgard, allow me to express my deepest thanks.


F00020

Never before have we been required to contend with a primal. Indeed, there were fears in some quarters that our knights might not be equal to the task.


F00030

From what we have now learned of these beings, I can say with certainty that we would have lost a great many men had the Scions not intervened.


F00040

Then the argument for preemptive action should be self-evident. Perchance now you will reconsider my proposal that Ishgard move against Natalan?


F00050

Ere we first met, a similar proposal was tabled─but the Holy See decreed that we were to observe, and that military action should be taken only in self-defense.


F00060

All things considered, it was not an unreasonable decision. Since the Calamity, two vigils have fallen to the Horde, while Garuda has never shown any inclination to storm the Gates of Judgement.


F00070

...Which is why this unprecedented crisis and its resolution may prompt a change in policy.


F00080

You who have faced these primals know well the threat they pose. Ishgard did not─not until now.


F00090

And there is naught like a brush with death to change a man's outlook.


F00110

At the very least, this should silence any lingering objections to our arrangement with Revenant's Toll.


F00120

The Holy See may even feel moved to grant us its formal endorsement.


F00130

So far as it is possible, the Scions shall be compensated for their service.


F00140

We should be grateful for any aid you can provide.


F00150

As a gesture of good faith, I shall withdraw my previous request. Your people are doubtless needed elsewhere.


F00160

That will not be necessary.


F00170

We too have a vested interest in watching Dravania's movements.


F00171

I see. Once more, I must thank you.


F00172

Ser Aymeric, if I may... Do you truly believe that Midgardsormr could return?


F00180

The heavens are a window unto truth, but those who interpret their movements are not infallible. I requested your involvement as a precautionary measure.


F00190

But of course... You sought an excuse to compensate us from the first, mindful of what would happen if Revenant's Toll were taken by your enemies.


F00200

Ishgard is not wont to aid its neighbors, but that does not preclude it from manipulating them to serve its own interests.


F00210

(-Taciturn Temple Knight-)Choose your next words carefully.


F00220

Do you know what sort of man becomes lord commander of the Temple Knights?


F00230

One who comes from good stock. I did not, yet here I am. Now why do you suppose that is?


F00240

Because I swiftly learned to tell the difference between words, deeds, and beliefs.


F00250

...You are correct, Master Leveilleur. Ishgard desires to see Revenant's Toll flourish, as it would present a troublesome obstacle to our enemies from the south.


F00260

We are so glad to be of use to you.


F00270

As we are to you. Ours is a mutually beneficial arrangement, lest we forget. One born of necessity.


F00280

The dragons grow more restless by the day, and the heretics harry us nigh without cease.


F00290

We have contended with such troubles for centuries, but there are limits to even our endurance.


F00300

Yet as a pauper is loath to part with his meager possessions, the leaders of Ishgard are not wont to render up their trust to outsiders.


F00310

But with perseverance on our part, they may yet be made to see the light.


F00320

Nevertheless, one must take care when walking the road less traveled.


F00330

Wise words, Ser Aymeric. I shall make a point to remember them.


F00340

I must apologize for my earlier outburst. I hope it will not sour our good relations.


F00350

Not at all. You but spoke from the heart.


F00360

I trust you understand that, at times, my duties may prevent me from meeting with you.


F00370

On such occasions, my second-in-command will speak for me.


F00380

(-Lucia-)Lucia, at your service.


F00390

(-Lucia-)Pray excuse our reticence. We are but wary of speaking too freely, lest our sentiments be made known to our enemies.


F00400

(-Lucia-)Know that the lord commander and I are of one mind. For the sake of Ishgard─and of Eorzea at large─I pray our peoples can put aside their differences.


F00410

(-Lucia-)Those who dwell in the past risk losing sight of their future.


F00420

Should aught befall one of our shipments, pray inform Lucia immediately. You may also relay to her any words you might have for me alone.


F00430

Not being of Ishgardian birth, she owes no allegiance to any noble house, making her as near to incorruptible as one can find in my homeland. Suffice it to say, I trust her completely, and so may you.


F00440

Which reminds me─ Lord Haurchefant, if you would be so kind.


F00450

Certainly.


F00460

In times such as these, trust is ever in short supply. Mayhap this will go some way to rectify the problem.


F00470

The results of our investigation into the heretics' recent attacks, as well as our interrogation of the merchant you detained.


F00480

Ser Aymeric... I cannot thank you enough.


F00490

Think nothing of it. Ishgard may be many things, but it is no friend to Garlemald.


F00500

Did I not tell you to have faith, my friend?


G00010

Words cannot well express how glad I am to see you returned to us hale and whole.


G00011

Needless to say, I am most eager to hear your account of that which occurred in Coerthas─assuming you are ready to speak of it?


G00020

Excellent. I shall summon the others at once.


G00030

Iceheart used her own body as a vessel for a primal's soul?


G00040

Master Louisoix's writings make no mention of such a possibility. Can we be certain this entity was a primal?


G00050

As certain as we can be that Good King Moggle Mog XII was a primal, I should think. Both were ostensibly summoned.


G00060

Let's not quibble over definitions. Of more concern is the implication that Iceheart retained her will even after she was possessed. We are talking about a mortal wielding the power of a primal!


G00070

It can't possibly be that easy, can it? There must be some sort of sacrifice required. Or maybe she's just special?


G00080

What qualities this woman possesseth, I know not, but full sure am I that she was groomed for this role.


G00090

Few are privy to the secrets of summoning, and but a single party standeth to profit from their dissemination.


G00100

Well, I wouldn't presume to comment on how the lass came to know about summoning, but I will say that what she summoned was a primal. The readings were the same, or near as damn it.


G00110

Strange as it all sounds, it's really no different from what you've faced before.


G00120

Then mayhap it is time that we reexamined our previous encounters.


G00130

Pack your things, Yda. We're going back to Gridania.


G00140

Yes sir!


G00150

About Iceheart's final words to you...


G00200

"Hear... Feel... Think...“


G00210

Hydaelyn speaks to her as well.


G00211

If Iceheart is blessed with the power of the Echo, she will doubtless have used it to further her goals.


G00212

...Or could it be that it was a revelation granted her by the Echo which first set her on this path? She did say that the Ishgardians were blind to the truth.


G00213

Do you think she has knowledge of the origins of the Ishgardian-Dravanian war? It would do much to explain her unwavering conviction.


G00220

Did not the Lady Iceheart implore thee to seek the Keeper of the Lake? And did she not imply that in so doing thou wouldst come to see with eyes unclouded?


G00230

Midgardsormr was a king amongst kings who reigned for centuries on end... But he is dead, and his wisdom lost to the ages─unless the Ishgardians' fears are well founded...


G00240

It would seem we have yet another reason to stand watch over the Keeper of the Lake. For a mercy, we are well positioned to do so.


G00280

Iceheart, Shiva, Ascians, and Midgardsormr. I shudder to think how they are all connected...


H00010

I have heard. Truly bothersome business.


H00020

No, I do not foresee a problem on that front. The main concern is Raubahn─there is no telling what the brute might do.


H00030

Have the Blades watch him and the Flames day and night.


H00040

You may leave the sultana to me. I shall personally attend Her Grace.


H00050


H00060

Sever one of the East Aldenard trade routes. That ought to keep Lolorito occupied for a while.


H00070

Nanamo Ul Namo... For my sake, pray be a good little sultana to the last.


I00010

Welcome back, my friend. I have already received word from Alphinaud.


I00011

To think that Flame Marshal Roaille was the Garlean agent... I know not what to say.


I00020

Together with Raubahn, Eline lent us much-needed aid at the time of our order's founding. She was particularly passionate about the need to tackle the primal threat.


I00030

When we discussed the subject, her eyes fairly shone with determination. Whatever else she may have been, I choose to believe that it was her true self with whom I spoke then...


I00040

But now is not the time to dwell on such matters.


I00050

I have an important announcement to make regarding our effort to defeat the Ascians. We shall begin as soon as everyone is assembled.


I00060

My thanks for coming, friends. Moenbryda, the floor is yours.


I00070

By now, I'm sure you're all familiar with white auracite, the miraculous material that'll allow us to capture Ascian souls.


I00080

Back at Snowcloak, we verified its ability to absorb vast amounts of aether.


I00090

Alas, it leaves something to be desired in the area of stability. The stone can only store aether for a short while before expelling its contents.


I00100

In addition to auracite's inherent limitations, we must needs be wary of our enemy's strength.


I00110

Our foe draweth upon an infinite wellspring of power. Even should we succeed in entrapping him, the stone will not long contain his wrath.


I00120

Meaning that if we want to kill the swine, we'll have to be quick about it.


I00130

'Tis our belief that an Ascian soul may be permanently undone if smitten by a sufficiently concentrated burst of pure aether.


I00140

The only trouble is, we can't say for sure how concentrated the burst needs to be... Without knowing how much aether an Ascian soul is composed of, we're basically guessing.


I00150

Our sole clue lieth in thy struggle with Lahabrea.


I00160

During that encounter, Hydaelyn bid you forge what She called “a blade of Light,” a weapon which took the form of a luminous stream of energy.


I00170

Based on your description, we believe the “blade” with which you vanquished your foe was composed of aether.


I00180

Admittedly, your victory proved ephemeral, as Lahabrea was able to use a Crystal of Darkness to flee into the space that lies between our world and the void.


I00190

The fact remains, however, that Hydaelyn placed the means to destroy the Ascians in your hands.


I00200

Be that as it may, it would be unwise to assume that She will do the same when next we encounter such a foe.


I00210

Quite so, my lady. We must needs find the means to forge our own blade of aether─one to equal that which Hydaelyn did benevolently bestow upon Her champion.


I00220

That is all well and good, but it seems to me that producing such a blade will require a prodigious quantity of aether. Whence will it come, pray tell?


I00230

Ummm... Oh! What if we had two pieces of white auracite? One to trap the Ascian, and the other to store the aether for the blade!


I00240

Nice try, but it's as I said: the stone won't hold aether for any length of time. We'd still need to collect the stuff there and then, sorry to say.


I00250

And therein lies the rub: finding a way to create the blade whenever and wherever we choose.


I00260

'Twould seem more research is in order.


I00270

I'm going to linger awhile─perform a few more tests on the auracite.


I00280

And I could do with some help. Urianger, why don't you lend me a hand?


I00290

M-Mine apologies, but I am required at the Waking Sands.


I00300

Lady Minfilia hath given me sole charge of the premises. 'Twould be unseemly to leave them unattended.


I00310

"Sole charge,“ you say? So...you're basically alone there, then? Well, that settles it! I'll just have to come to you!


I00320

While you were afield, word arrived from the Sharlayan motherland.


I00330

You will recall that a survey party was dispatched to investigate the incident at the Isle of Val. What they discovered was troubling to say the least.


I00340

According to the report, the isle has been erased from existence. 'Twas as if a hole had been torn in the very fabric of reality.


I00350

Aye...yet the mystery endeth not with the isle's disappearance.


I00360

It hath come to light that a number of scholars in various other locales were reported missing at a similar juncture.


I00370

What's more, they all had something in common with the head of the Students of Baldesion. Every last one of them was researching a phenomenon called dimensional compression─or the “Rejoining,” as the ancient texts call it. I'll be damned if that's a coincidence.


I00380

All indications suggest Ascian involvement, but I sense that a force greater still is at work─the entity the dark beings call “the one true god”...


I00390

We must pray that my dear friend Krile regains consciousness soon. If she bore witness to the Isle of Val's final moments, she may be able to shed some light on this mystery...


J00010

Following the Calamity, the forces of the XIVth Imperial Legion entrenched themselves in strategic locations across Eorzea.


J00020

So swiftly did they accomplish this, it was suspected that they had received help. To think that it came from Roaille... My right hand.


J00030

There is more. We have reason to believe that Roaille didn't deal exclusively with the XIVth. She also answered to a higher authority in Garlemald.


J00040

But this higher authority could not have been the Emperor. By consenting to the Meteor project, Solus zos Galvus showed himself to be more concerned about preventing the spread of primal influence than claiming Eorzea for the Empire. He would happily have seen the lot reduced to ash.


J00050

We believe a number of high-ranking figures within the royal household were against the decision, but that they knew better than to oppose the Emperor openly. Of course, this didn't prevent them from making clandestine provisions, in which Roaille played a part.


J00060

Alas, these provisions did not prevent Dalamud from falling, and the ensuing chaos changed the face of the realm forever. Yet Eorzea survived.


J00070

To all intents and purposes, the Meteor project had failed, and the Empire was left to rue its lack of a decisive means to eliminate the primals. Until, that is, it stumbled upon the Ultima Weapon.


J00080

Even before the accursed thing was dug up, it seemed to me the XIVth had the might to overwhelm our weakened armies. Yet they chose to hide behind their walls. Why?


J00090

The Black Wolf was wary of making the denizens of Eorzea desperate, lest more primals emerge to bleed the land. The discovery of the Ultima Weapon, however, emboldened him to resume his war of conquest in earnest.


J00100

But there was one in Garlemald who believed that van Baelsar's actions were premature─one who stood higher in the imperial army's chain of command. He ordered the legatus to halt his advance, only to find that the Black Wolf had slipped its leash, and that the XIVth now acted alone.


J00110

In a bid to bring van Baelsar to heel, he used the agent he had planted in Ul'dah prior to the Calamity to undermine the legion's efforts.


J00120

A man who outranks van Baelsar, yet opposed the late emperor's decision to annihilate Eorzea... This could only be the former high legatus of the Garlean Army, now known as Emperor Varis zos Galvus.


J00130

So he was Roaille's true master...


J00140

But one of several, in actual fact. We've learned that even as Roaille served the Empire's interests, she sold imperial secrets to a certain faction in Eorzea.


J00150

In so doing, she helped to maintain the status quo, thus prolonging the conflict. Considering who stands to profit from war, it isn't hard to imagine who her other masters were.


J00160

Seven hells... You mean to say that she was a double agent?


J00170

Triple, if you consider her services to van Baelsar and the new emperor as separate.


J00180

As neatly as these pieces seem to fit, one aspect of the puzzle remains unclear to me.


J00190

By whose will was the marshal feeding intelligence to the heretics? And try as I might, I fail to see how aiding their cause would profit either her imperial or Monetarist masters.


J00200

Could it be that another hand is at work here? If so, Roaille must be made to reveal whose it is.


J00210

Not only have I lost a trusted friend; now I must interrogate her as a stranger.


J00220

Not a pleasant task, I grant you, but a necessary one. Unless we weed out the Ivy, root, stalk, and stem, it will simply grow back.


J00230

I know that full well. Those closest to Roaille have already been detained, and I will question them alongside her.


J00240

General. Pray keep in mind that there may be unwitting abettors among them.


J00250

All will be treated fairly─on that you have my word. Those who are innocent have no cause to fear.


J00260

You have ever been a friend of truth, General. I hope the unpleasant task of weeding out falsehood will not detain you too long. Though it be for the sake of Eorzea, doubting one's comrades is poison to the soul.


J00270

...And with that, I take my leave.


J00280

All these years, I've been made to dance to their tune...


J00290

How could you, Roaille? How could you side with them...?


J00300

...Those cankers who take from this land and give naught in return─who use their power to disempower, and grow fat while the people starve!


J00310

I know you can hear me, Monetarist scum! Your crimes will not go unpunished!


J00320

One day, I will purge this land of your sickness! Before the eyes of the Twelve, I swear it!


J00330

Raaaaaargh!


K00010

I shall have no further need of you this day.


K00020

(-Lady-In-Waiting-)Your Grace.


K00030

I fear that not even mine own chambers shall remain private for long.


K00040

Has the situation grown so grim?


K00050

Ever since he proposed the Carteneau Reclamation Bill, Teledji Adeledji has risen to greater prominence upon the backs of impoverished refugees.


K00060

The Monetarists were ever united in their pursuit of profit, but the man's actions have torn a rift in their ranks. They snap at each other as rabid dogs.


K00070

Yet now is not the time to be bickering among ourselves.


K00080

If this bickering is a threat to law and order, might you not have grounds to dissolve the Syndicate?


K00090

Would that the solution were so simple, Admiral. Alas, my moving to dissolve the Syndicate is certain to spark outrage among the influential merchant class, whom the cabal represents.


K00100

This would serve to exacerbate the current unrest, and peace would slip still further away.


K00110

Be they rich or poor, natives or refugees, all who reside in Ul'dah have a right to pursue happiness. It is the duty of a ruler to protect this right.


K00120

If I am to perform my duty, I must needs tread warily. It would not do to make enemies heedlessly.


K00130

Were Lord Lolorito here, he would doubtless say that I have my head in the clouds.


K00140

A ruler is required to take a wide view. Try as we might to cater to all needs, some will inevitably be overlooked. As such, there shall ever be citizens who feel aggrieved. It cannot be helped.


K00150

But as you have informed us, the Monetarists take no view but their own. They hunger for power while the masses starve.


K00160

In the absence of a common cause, it seems beyond any one individual to make Ul'dah whole.


K00170

And the presence of a Garlean agent within the Immortal Flames only makes matters worse.


K00180

Even accounting for Ul'dah's historic reliance upon mercenaries, such a grievous breach of security is unprecedented. I fear this business will provide the Monetarists with a rod to beat Raubahn.


K00190

Eorzea can ill afford for the Immortal Flames to be dampened now. Ere long, the Garleans will turn their ravenous gaze toward our lands once more. If we are to resist their might, our nations must stand together.


K00200

Yet for this to happen, our nations must be whole. Can naught be done to improve the situation in Ul'dah?


K00210

The true wealth of Ul'dah lies in the health, happiness, and hopes of her citizens. Alas, the citizens shall never know these things so long as their lives are ruled by the ambitions of the few.


K00220

The Monetarists claim to represent the best interests of the people, but in sooth they desire only to manipulate them for their own selfish ends.


K00230

For the government to serve the people, it must be formed of the people.


K00240

For Ul'dah to move forward, it is not only the Syndicate that must be dissolved.


K00250

Nay... You jest...


K00260

My friends─it was for no other reason than to make known to you mine intent that I requested your presence here.


K00270

When I make my declaration to the people, chaos shall inevitably ensue.


K00280

As the last monarch in the line of Ul, I make unto you this request.


K00290

Help Raubahn to preserve order, and protect the people. Forsake them, and you forsake yourselves, for a strong Eorzea will ever have need of a strong Ul'dah.


K00300

Your Grace... Are you certain of this?


K00310

There is no other way.


K00320

When the time is ripe, the nation shall become a true republic. Both Royalists and Monetarists shall cease to be.


K00330

Ul'dah will no longer belong to kings or queens or merchant princes, but to her people.


K00340

Raubahn... Forgive me for casting aside all that you have toiled for in my name...


K00350

Beyond this gesture, I am powerless to help my subjects.

Every last one of them was researching a phenomenon called dimensional compression or the  Rejoining,  as the ancient texts call it. I'll be damned if that's a coincidence. I00380 All indications suggest Ascian involvement, but I sense that a force greater still is at work the entity the dark beings call  the one true god ... I00390 We must pray that my dear friend Krile regains consciousness soon. If she bore witness to the Isle of Val's final moments, she may be able to shed some light on this mystery... J00010 Following the Calamity, the forces of the XIVth Imperial Legion entrenched themselves in strategic locations across Eorzea. J00020 So swiftly did they accomplish this, it was suspected that they had received help. To think that it came from Roaille... My right hand. J00030 There is more. We have reason to believe that Roaille didn't deal exclusively with the XIVth. She also answered to a higher authority in Garlemald. J00040 But this higher authority could not have been the Emperor. By consenting to the Meteor project, Solus zos Galvus showed himself to be more concerned about preventing the spread of primal influence than claiming Eorzea for the Empire. He would happily have seen the lot reduced to ash. J00050 We believe a number of high-ranking figures within the royal household were against the decision, but that they knew better than to oppose the Emperor openly. Of course, this didn't prevent them from making clandestine provisions, in which Roaille played a part. J00060 Alas, these provisions did not prevent Dalamud from falling, and the ensuing chaos changed the face of the realm forever. Yet Eorzea survived. J00070 To all intents and purposes, the Meteor project had failed, and the Empire was left to rue its lack of a decisive means to eliminate the primals. Until, that is, it stumbled upon the Ultima Weapon. J00080 Even before the accursed thing was dug up, it seemed to me the XIVth had the might to overwhelm our weakened armies. Yet they chose to hide behind their walls. Why? J00090 The Black Wolf was wary of making the denizens of Eorzea desperate, lest more primals emerge to bleed the land. The discovery of the Ultima Weapon, however, emboldened him to resume his war of conquest in earnest. J00100 But there was one in Garlemald who believed that van Baelsar's actions were premature one who stood higher in the imperial army's chain of command. He ordered the legatus to halt his advance, only to find that the Black Wolf had slipped its leash, and that the XIVth now acted alone. J00110 In a bid to bring van Baelsar to heel, he used the agent he had planted in Ul'dah prior to the Calamity to undermine the legion's efforts. J00120 A man who outranks van Baelsar, yet opposed the late emperor's decision to annihilate Eorzea... This could only be the former high legatus of the Garlean Army, now known as Emperor Varis zos Galvus. J00130 So he was Roaille's true master... J00140 But one of several, in actual fact. We've learned that even as Roaille served the Empire's interests, she sold imperial secrets to a certain faction in Eorzea. J00150 In so doing, she helped to maintain the status quo, thus prolonging the conflict. Considering who stands to profit from war, it isn't hard to imagine who her other masters were. J00160 Seven hells... You mean to say that she was a double agent? J00170 Triple, if you consider her services to van Baelsar and the new emperor as separate. J00180 As neatly as these pieces seem to fit, one aspect of the puzzle remains unclear to me. J00190 By whose will was the marshal feeding intelligence to the heretics? And try as I might, I fail to see how aiding their cause would profit either her imperial or Monetarist masters. J00200 Could it be that another hand is at work here? If so, Roaille must be made to reveal whose it is. J00210 Not only have I lost a trusted friend; now I must interrogate her as a stranger. J00220 Not a pleasant task, I grant you, but a necessary one. Unless we weed out the Ivy, root, stalk, and stem, it will simply grow back. J00230 I know that full well. Those closest to Roaille have already been detained, and I will question them alongside her. J00240 General. Pray keep in mind that there may be unwitting abettors among them. J00250 All will be treated fairly on that you have my word. Those who are innocent have no cause to fear. J00260 You have ever been a friend of truth, General. I hope the unpleasant task of weeding out falsehood will not detain you too long. Though it be for the sake of Eorzea, doubting one's comrades is poison to the soul. J00270 ...And with that, I take my leave. J00280 All these years, I've been made to dance to their tune... J00290 How could you, Roaille? How could you side with them...? J00300 ...Those cankers who take from this land and give naught in return who use their power to disempower, and grow fat while the people starve! J00310 I know you can hear me, Monetarist scum! Your crimes will not go unpunished! J00320 One day, I will purge this land of your sickness! Before the eyes of the Twelve, I swear it! J00330 Raaaaaargh! K00010 I shall have no further need of you this day. K00020 (-Lady-In-Waiting-)Your Grace. K00030 I fear that not even mine own chambers shall remain private for long. K00040 Has the situation grown so grim? K00050 Ever since he proposed the Carteneau Reclamation Bill, Teledji Adeledji has risen to greater prominence upon the backs of impoverished refugees. K00060 The Monetarists were ever united in their pursuit of profit, but the man's actions have torn a rift in their ranks. They snap at each other as rabid dogs. K00070 Yet now is not the time to be bickering among ourselves. K00080 If this bickering is a threat to law and order, might you not have grounds to dissolve the Syndicate? K00090 Would that the solution were so simple, Admiral. Alas, my moving to dissolve the Syndicate is certain to spark outrage among the influential merchant class, whom the cabal represents. K00100 This would serve to exacerbate the current unrest, and peace would slip still further away. K00110 Be they rich or poor, natives or refugees, all who reside in Ul'dah have a right to pursue happiness. It is the duty of a ruler to protect this right. K00120 If I am to perform my duty, I must needs tread warily. It would not do to make enemies heedlessly. K00130 Were Lord Lolorito here, he would doubtless say that I have my head in the clouds. K00140 A ruler is required to take a wide view. Try as we might to cater to all needs, some will inevitably be overlooked. As such, there shall ever be citizens who feel aggrieved. It cannot be helped. K00150 But as you have informed us, the Monetarists take no view but their own. They hunger for power while the masses starve. K00160 In the absence of a common cause, it seems beyond any one individual to make Ul'dah whole. K00170 And the presence of a Garlean agent within the Immortal Flames only makes matters worse. K00180 Even accounting for Ul'dah's historic reliance upon mercenaries, such a grievous breach of security is unprecedented. I fear this business will provide the Monetarists with a rod to beat Raubahn. K00190 Eorzea can ill afford for the Immortal Flames to be dampened now. Ere long, the Garleans will turn their ravenous gaze toward our lands once more. If we are to resist their might, our nations must stand together. K00200 Yet for this to happen, our nations must be whole. Can naught be done to improve the situation in Ul'dah? K00210 The true wealth of Ul'dah lies in the health, happiness, and hopes of her citizens. Alas, the citizens shall never know these things so long as their lives are ruled by the ambitions of the few. K00220 The Monetarists claim to represent the best interests of the people, but in sooth they desire only to manipulate them for their own selfish ends. K00230 For the government to serve the people, it must be formed of the people. K00240 For Ul'dah to move forward, it is not only the Syndicate that must be dissolved. K00250 Nay... You jest... K00260 My friends it was for no other reason than to make known to you mine intent that I requested your presence here. K00270 When I make my declaration to the people, chaos shall inevitably ensue. K00280 As the last monarch in the line of Ul, I make unto you this request. K00290 Help Raubahn to preserve order, and protect the people. Forsake them, and you forsake yourselves, for a strong Eorzea will ever have need of a strong Ul'dah. K00300 Your Grace... Are you certain of this? K00310 There is no other way. K00320 When the time is ripe, the nation shall become a true republic. Both Royalists and Monetarists shall cease to be. K00330 Ul'dah will no longer belong to kings or queens or merchant princes, but to her people. K00340 Raubahn... Forgive me for casting aside all that you have toiled for in my name... K00350 Beyond this gesture, I am powerless to help my subjects.

name: 2.4 A Realm Reborn Cutscenes [VoiceMan_02401]
text_html:
300020

His size is staggering... I can scarce imagine how Grandfather stood against such a monstrosity.


300030

This cannot be allowed to proceed any further. Let us disable the coil and move on.


300040

Grandfather!


300060

No, that man is dead. I will not dishonor my beloved grandsire's memory by calling you such.


300070

You are but his twisted shade─the thrall of a mad primal.


300080

You were foolish to disregard my warning, child. Are you so convinced of your own righteousness?


300090

'Tis the rightness of our path that led us to return. Eorzea will never be safe whilst Bahamut remains to threaten all we hold dear.


300100

What of the hero who gave his life in defense of the realm? Do you truly dispute the justice of our cause?


300110

My poor, ignorant grandchildren─your world is shaped by naught but recent conflict. Listen, and I will speak to you of “justice.”


300120

'Twas in the twilight of the Third Astral Era... The southern land of Meracydia suffered invasion at the hands of the Allagan Empire. With no atrocity too depraved for their purpose, the forces of Allag were unstoppable in their advance.


300130

Desperate for salvation, the dragons prayed to one of the first brood─to their ancestor Bahamut. Infused by the power of their fervent supplications, Bahamut arose from the abyss of death and took wing as the Meracydians' newborn god.


300140

Yet this great miracle would only serve to further the maniacal designs of the dragons' imperial conquerors. The cruel fetters which bind my lord stand testament to the Allagans' boundless greed and hubris.


300150

I once summoned the Twelve in an attempt to forestall the advent of the Seventh Umbral Era.


300160

What then did the dragons of Meracydia do that I did not? Wherefore are they accursed and I exalted?


300170

'Tis man's overweening belief in his own primacy that blinds him to the commonness of his condition...and the truth of his own tyranny.


300180

As long as man is suffered to remain, the dragons shall never be at peace.


300190

Only when the plague of people has been expunged shall the children of Lord Bahamut be free. Then shall the world know true justice.


300200

Stop it! Grandfather would never say such things! His belief that people were worth saving never faltered!


300210

He had faith in their strength...that they could stand together and push back against the darkness seeking to shape them.


300220

A false hope. 'Tis folly to place one's faith in so flawed a race.


300230

"Stand together“? Hmph. They would first need to agree on which direction to face. If history teaches us anything, it is that man cannot find common ground between his own two feet.


300240

Even you, twins whose veins run with the same blood, struggle to fathom each other's reasoning. You hide your differing agendas behind the convenient banner of Eorzea's salvation. Given your obvious self-interest, can you truly claim no kinship with the Allagans?


300250

And though I hoped they might bring you closer, 'twould seem that the twin grimoires I bestowed upon you were a wasted gesture...


300260

There may well be truth in your judgment of Alisaie and me... But such a one-sided tirade bemoaning the evils of man rings false coming from the lips of Archon Louisoix.


300270

Tell me─do you champion the cause of dragons because Bahamut compels you as his thrall?


300280

Or is it because you yourself have transcended the limits of man's existence?


300290

Ah, so the possibility did not escape your notice? What I prayed for, and what I have become...these are the keys that unlock the truth behind Eorzea's rebirth.


300300

If you would have them, then you must needs take them by force. Come, rend this divine form asunder and claim your answers!


300310

But...I thought... He has become a primal!?


300320

'Tis difficult I know, but you must accept it: that entity is no phantom or impostor─it is our beloved grandsire!


300330

Please─for his sake and for ours─you must defeat our grandfather!


400010

Grandfather is truly gone this time. But better it end this way than the alternative...


400020

I am yet here, Alisaie. My dear, sweet granddaughter...


400030

Grandfather...?


400040

I must thank you, Warrior of Light. Without your valor, I might never have broken free of Bahamut's control.


400050

These last few moments are mine to live as the man I once was.


400060

This is all that I wanted. Yet now that it is happening, I find myself struggling to believe it... Is it really you?


400070

Grandfather, pray forgive me my insolence. It was not my intent to demean you.


400080

Forgive you? I am proud of you, child. You were wise enough to deduce the manner of creature I had become.


400090

Alphinaud. Alisaie. If any here should beg forgiveness, it is I.


400100

Grandfather, I must ask... Will you not tell us what befell during the Calamity?


400110

Yes. Yes, of course. You have come far to hear the truth...


400120

Let us then begin the tale at the Battle of Carteneau, where clashed the forces of the Garlean Empire and the Eorzean Alliance.


400130

'Twas there in the sky above the surging armies that the elder primal Bahamut broke free of the red moon, Dalamud.


400140

In an effort to contain this avatar of destruction, I called upon the Twelve to aid me in the creation of a prison of aether...


400150

But Bahamut would not be caged by such feeble bars─too vast was his might; too fierce his rage.


400170

You know of what happened next. I used the last of my strength to send you and your companions outside of time, and then prepared to meet my end.


400180

Little choice remained to me. I used the last of my strength to entrust our hope unto the future, and prepared to meet my end.


500010

As you have no doubt surmised, I did not perish. When the cage built from the essences of the Twelve was destroyed, the sky was filled with a colossal cloud of aether...


500020

This drifting energy responded to the prayers of those fighting below─and to my own desperate wish that the dying realm be saved─by infusing me with the power of a primal.


500030

I became the immortal Phoenix, ancient symbol of rebirth.


500040

Rising into the sky, I struck Bahamut with all my newfound strength. The blow shattered his earthly form, and a shower of aether rained down upon the land.


500050

Thus began the rejuvenation of Eorzea.


500060

Believing the deed done, I relinquished my hold on that staggering energy, desirous that it should be returned to the realm without delay.


500070

But I had not reckoned on Bahamut's tenacious will. Even as he teetered upon the cusp of oblivion, the dragon reached out to claim me.


500080

Alas, within my fast fading form, enough remained of the Phoenix's energy to offer Bahamut a hold, and he dragged me along in his wake.


500090

And thus began your existence as the elder primal's thrall...


500100

I cannot help but wonder at his will to survive... Though he was all but obliterated, Bahamut found a way to seize the power you surrendered.


500110

That would explain why part of his physical form survived to be entombed underground.


500120

'Twould also explain why Eorzea was so terribly warped. Even as the land sought to restore itself, the returning flow of aether was cut off.


500130

Very good. When his grip on existence was once again secured, Bahamut did not cease his feast until he had consumed every last mote of aether that yet floated in the air.


500140

And still he was not fully restored...


500150

You must remember that by this time, much of the freed aether had already returned to the land. That which remained was not sufficient to reconstruct so massive a form in its entirety.


500160

But there did not need to be─not for a being sustained by the marvels of Allagan technology.


500170

As long as some piece of Bahamut persists, the coils will seek it out and continue their regenerative task.


500180

The fragments of Dalamud appear motionless from the surface, but deep beneath the ground they had been searching...tunneling through rock and soil towards their escaped prisoner.


500190

And, as you have observed for yourselves, they found his heart.


500200

Warrior of Light, heed me. You must put a stop to Bahamut's regeneration.


500210

Whether it be for man or for dragonkind, the question of justice is irrelevant. The elder primal will leave naught but a smoldering wasteland for both his children and ours.


500220

I beg you to defend Eorzea─as you always have, and as I always knew you would.


500230

I beg you to defend Eorzea, and guide its people to the future they yet struggle to find.


500240

This portal will take you to the final internment hulk. 'Tis time for the tale of Bahamut and his part in the Calamity to come to an end!


500250

Alphinaud, Alisaie. Pray come closer.


500260

Your hopes and dreams must no longer be an extension of mine. You must needs find your own reason to fight for this realm─your own meaning in this sea of chaos.


500270

Will you do that for me?


500280

Of course, Grandfather. I have already made it my mission to see this newborn Eorzea survive and flourish.


500290

Alisaie. While I was yet in thrall to Bahamut, you spoke of my faith in man's strength. Know that your words reached me, imprisoned though my soul still was.


500300

So forceful was your conviction, I wonder if that belief has not become your own. Perhaps, after all your anger and sorrow was spent, you found something greater within you.


500310

See this fight to its culmination. 'Tis also your strength in which I have faith.


500320

Thank you...for everything... Pray take your rest, Grandfather... You deserve it.


500330

There are records of an art that allowed one to summon the power of a primal from the essence of its demise.


500340

And though I am no true primal, all that I have left, I give to you.


500350

Alphinaud. Alisaie. My darling grandchildren. May Light's blessings ever keep and protect you.


500360

Come, Warrior of Light. Our task remains undone!


600010

'Twas a long and arduous road, but at last we reach its end.


600020

Farewell, Bahamut. I banish you back to the aether!


600030

He is not yet whole! I did not think him capable...


600040

Ah!


600050

Ugh!


600060

Ugh... Alisaie! ALISAIE!


600070

I had thought it finally over...


600080

We'll not survive another blast!


600090

No... Is this how I honor my promise to Grandfather?


600100

You must needs find your own reason to fight for this realm─your own meaning in this sea of chaos. Will you do that for me?


600110

I will, Grandfather. In fact, I believe I already have.


600120

That reason has been with me all along, guiding me─Eorzea's blade of Light, shearing through the endless shrouds of darkness...


600130

I have been shown the miraculous feats of which we are all capable. Of which I am capable.


600140

Bahamut! You have wreaked enough havoc!


600150

I will not let your wrathful fires consume all that we know and love!


600160

Ugh!


600170

How long I have waited to hear you say that! You have found your resolve at last!


600180

Let me join my strength to yours.


600190

In this place, in this moment, our purpose has become one!


600191

(-Alphinaud and Alisaie-)For the future of Eorzea!


600200

This last task is yours, Warrior of Light! You must destroy Bahamut's crystal core!


700010

You did it!


700020

But one task remains...


700030

With this last coil disabled, there shall be naught left to bind Bahamut to this world. His beloved children will finally know peace...


700040

'Tis done. He is truly gone.


700050

You knew, didn't you? You knew what Grandfather had become.


700060

I...was not certain. But from all I had gleaned, it seemed a distinct possibility.


700070

The scene people describe of the Battle of Carteneau was one of unimaginable devastation. And 'tis through the combined prayers of the desperate─and an abundant source of aether─that primals are born. I merely put two and two together.


700080

And you consider that a sufficient explanation?


700090

Well, however you stumbled across your theory, 'twas this revelation that made you wary of my attachment to Grandfather.


700100

You feared that in my obsession, I would fall under his primal sway. Is that why you decided to join us? To pull me back should I show signs of wavering?


700110

Pray forgive me, Sister. I wished only to protect you. Yet I see now that I needn't have doubted the strength of your conviction.


700120

May I ask you a question? What do you now intend to do with the truth you have uncovered?


700130

Which particular truth was that, Brother? The fact that desperate prayer gave rise to the primal Phoenix? That this new god was responsible for setting Eorzea on the path to rebirth?


700140

Should such a tale become common knowledge, people would soon offer up their prayers in earnest─they would beseech Phoenix to complete the healing that was begun.


700150

Yet as you and I know all too well, the very act of calling forth this savior would do more harm to the land than good.


700160

We cannot encourage such worship for this very reason. Were Grandfather forced to return as an aether-draining primal, 'twould undo all that he had worked to protect.


700170

Your abiding love for him was the key that unlocked the truth of the Calamity.


700180

But keys may also serve to seal doors that were best left unopened.


700190

Let your love now guide your actions, and lock away deep inside the fate of both Grandfather and Bahamut.


700200

Fear not, Alphinaud─I understand what must be done.


700210

The realm need not know the truth for it to be saved.


700220

That the elder primal is banished, to return no more...that is enough.


700230

Let us make our way back to the surface. Poor Urianger must be beside himself with worry!
