That which remained was not sufficient to reconstruct so massive a form in its entirety. 500160 But there did not need to be not for a being sustained by the marvels of Allagan technology. 500170 As long as some piece of Bahamut persists, the coils will seek it out and continue their regenerative task. 500180 The fragments of Dalamud appear motionless from the surface, but deep beneath the ground they had been searching...tunneling through rock and soil towards their escaped prisoner. 500190 And, as you have observed for yourselves, they found his heart. 500200 Warrior of Light, heed me. You must put a stop to Bahamut's regeneration. 500210 Whether it be for man or for dragonkind, the question of justice is irrelevant. The elder primal will leave naught but a smoldering wasteland for both his children and ours. 500220 I beg you to defend Eorzea as you always have, and as I always knew you would. 500230 I beg you to defend Eorzea, and guide its people to the future they yet struggle to find. 500240 This portal will take you to the final internment hulk. 'Tis time for the tale of Bahamut and his part in the Calamity to come to an end! 500250 Alphinaud, Alisaie. Pray come closer. 500260 Your hopes and dreams must no longer be an extension of mine. You must needs find your own reason to fight for this realm your own meaning in this sea of chaos. 500270 Will you do that for me? 500280 Of course, Grandfather. I have already made it my mission to see this newborn Eorzea survive and flourish. 500290 Alisaie. While I was yet in thrall to Bahamut, you spoke of my faith in man's strength. Know that your words reached me, imprisoned though my soul still was. 500300 So forceful was your conviction, I wonder if that belief has not become your own. Perhaps, after all your anger and sorrow was spent, you found something greater within you. 500310 See this fight to its culmination. 'Tis also your strength in which I have faith. 500320 Thank you...for everything... Pray take your rest, Grandfather... You deserve it. 500330 There are records of an art that allowed one to summon the power of a primal from the essence of its demise. 500340 And though I am no true primal, all that I have left, I give to you. 500350 Alphinaud. Alisaie. My darling grandchildren. May Light's blessings ever keep and protect you. 500360 Come, Warrior of Light. Our task remains undone! 600010 'Twas a long and arduous road, but at last we reach its end. 600020 Farewell, Bahamut. I banish you back to the aether! 600030 He is not yet whole! I did not think him capable... 600040 Ah! 600050 Ugh! 600060 Ugh... Alisaie! ALISAIE! 600070 I had thought it finally over... 600080 We'll not survive another blast! 600090 No... Is this how I honor my promise to Grandfather? 600100 You must needs find your own reason to fight for this realm your own meaning in this sea of chaos. Will you do that for me? 600110 I will, Grandfather. In fact, I believe I already have. 600120 That reason has been with me all along, guiding me Eorzea's blade of Light, shearing through the endless shrouds of darkness... 600130 I have been shown the miraculous feats of which we are all capable. Of which I am capable. 600140 Bahamut! You have wreaked enough havoc! 600150 I will not let your wrathful fires consume all that we know and love! 600160 Ugh! 600170 How long I have waited to hear you say that! You have found your resolve at last! 600180 Let me join my strength to yours. 600190 In this place, in this moment, our purpose has become one! 600191 (-Alphinaud and Alisaie-)For the future of Eorzea! 600200 This last task is yours, Warrior of Light! You must destroy Bahamut's crystal core! 700010 You did it! 700020 But one task remains... 700030 With this last coil disabled, there shall be naught left to bind Bahamut to this world. His beloved children will finally know peace... 700040 'Tis done. He is truly gone. 700050 You knew, didn't you? You knew what Grandfather had become. 700060 I...was not certain. But from all I had gleaned, it seemed a distinct possibility. 700070 The scene people describe of the Battle of Carteneau was one of unimaginable devastation. And 'tis through the combined prayers of the desperate and an abundant source of aether that primals are born. I merely put two and two together. 700080 And you consider that a sufficient explanation? 700090 Well, however you stumbled across your theory, 'twas this revelation that made you wary of my attachment to Grandfather. 700100 You feared that in my obsession, I would fall under his primal sway. Is that why you decided to join us? To pull me back should I show signs of wavering? 700110 Pray forgive me, Sister. I wished only to protect you. Yet I see now that I needn't have doubted the strength of your conviction. 700120 May I ask you a question? What do you now intend to do with the truth you have uncovered? 700130 Which particular truth was that, Brother? The fact that desperate prayer gave rise to the primal Phoenix? That this new god was responsible for setting Eorzea on the path to rebirth? 700140 Should such a tale become common knowledge, people would soon offer up their prayers in earnest they would beseech Phoenix to complete the healing that was begun. 700150 Yet as you and I know all too well, the very act of calling forth this savior would do more harm to the land than good. 700160 We cannot encourage such worship for this very reason. Were Grandfather forced to return as an aether-draining primal, 'twould undo all that he had worked to protect. 700170 Your abiding love for him was the key that unlocked the truth of the Calamity. 700180 But keys may also serve to seal doors that were best left unopened. 700190 Let your love now guide your actions, and lock away deep inside the fate of both Grandfather and Bahamut. 700200 Fear not, Alphinaud I understand what must be done. 700210 The realm need not know the truth for it to be saved. 700220 That the elder primal is banished, to return no more...that is enough. 700230 Let us make our way back to the surface. Poor Urianger must be beside himself with worry!

name: 2.5 A Realm Reborn Cutscenes [VoiceMan_02500]
text_html:
000020

I believe the two of you have met?


000030

We have. I had hoped to speak with Commander Leveilleur as well, but I cannot afford to wait any longer.


000040

The lord commander sent me hither to request your aid in a matter of grave import.


000050

You see now why I had Tataru summon you.


000060

Now that we are all assembled, perhaps you would be good enough to elaborate on the nature of the matter which brought you to us.


000070

The Observatorium's astrologians have sounded the alarum.


000080

Last night, the dragon star burned with an intensity not seen in fifteen summers.


000090

Not since the Dravanians engaged the Empire in the Battle of Silvertear Skies.


000100

“The northern sky doth burn full bright upon the wyrm lord's call. The red behemoth beckoneth, and flame consumeth all.”


000110

The old Coerthan rhyme, aye.


000120

The brightening of the dragon star is said to accompany the roar of a great wyrm. The astrologians believe that it was Midgardsormr himself who cried out on this occasion.


000130

After an absence of centuries, the king of kings did return to lead his kind against the might of Garlemald...


000140

...Only to fall in his duel with the Agrius, proud flagship of the Garlean fleet. Devoid of life, his corpse remaineth entwined about the magitek monstrosity even unto this day.


000150

Urianger has the right of it. Whatever this alteration in the dragon star portends, the great wyrm has shown no sign of life.


000160

Tataru, have the Domans reported aught out of the ordinary?


000170

Correct me if I'm wrong, but if Midgardsormr had roared, wouldn't we have heard it here in Revenant's Toll?


000180

“Roar” is but a figure of speech. Dravanians can communicate in ways beyond our ken.


000190

It is for this very reason that we are forced to look for signs in the heavens. We cannot say with any confidence that a great wyrm roared at all, much less that it was Midgardsormr.


000200

Only by directly examining the Keeper of the Lake can we be certain. However, it will take too long to gain the Holy See's approval to dispatch the Temple Knights.


000210

Therefore, Ser Aymeric would entrust this task to you. Do you accept?


000220

We knew you would not disappoint us. Now, if you would excuse me, I must return and assist the lord commander. We have precious little time to prepare.


000230

To prepare for what, pray tell?


000240

When a great wyrm roars, his brethren cannot choose but answer. We prepare for battle.


100010

Who treadeth now upon my bones and waketh me from slumber sweet?


100020

Thou hast forgotten the face of thy lord. Remember, mortal, and fear me.


200010

By Her gifts hast thou earned a moment's reprieve.


200020

Speak, mortal, and I shall listen.


200030

Guided by a star...? Heh heh heh.


200040

My people have heard the song. Ishgard shall burn.


200050

Sons must answer for their fathers' misdeeds.


200060

We do not forget. We do not forgive.


200070

Seven children did I sire. One now singeth of retribution.


200080

I rise to join in the chorus.


200090

Thou art powerless to silence us, mortal. Yet thou shalt not live to labor in vain. Thy reprieve is at an end.


200100

Hmph. Trickery is thy shield. This frail, ignoble creature is not gifted, but chosen...


200110

Hearken to me, Hydaelyn! I remember...and I consent.


200120

Fear not, mortal... I shall not harm thee...


200130

Heh heh heh. Mayhap thou thinkest me an oathbreaker?


200140

Thou art mistaken. If thou comest to harm, it shall be by another's hand, not mine.


200150

I did but strip thee of thy mistress's feeble blessing.


200160

Thou didst profit much by Her grace, but no more.


200170

The covenant binds me to thee.


200180

I shall watch...listen...and wait.


200190

Fight and struggle, if it be thy will.


200200

Man hath ever coveted that which lieth beyond his grasp.


200210

I drink of Her body, and thence doth mine own find new life.


200220

When it hath grown whole, the loyal and penitent shall rejoice.


200230

The Dragonsong heraldeth a beginning...and an end.


300010

My friend! I can scarce believe it! You confronted the wyrm lord and lived to tell the tale!


300020

I give thanks to Halone for your preservation. It is our sole cause for gladness.


300030

Your encounter with the Keeper of the Lake served to confirm our fears. A great wyrm has roared, and it makes little difference if it was one of the two in Eorzea or any other...


300040

The Dravanians are coming.


300050

I am told that Ishgard has magical defenses against Dravanian attack, though I am not privy to their exact nature.


300060

Will they be enough to repel a massive force?


300070

Ishgard has weathered countless assaults over centuries. This will be no different.


300080

And now that you have confirmed the threat, none can ignore the lord commander's calls for the wards to be strengthened.


300090

I dare not presume to speak for him, but I expect the lord commander would sing your praises.


300100

I must away, but we shall meet again soon.


300110

Countless assaults weathered...and this will be no different? Why am I not convinced?


400010

Now that everything's calmed down a bit─relatively speaking, I mean─I thought it might be a good time to share our progress on the weapon.


400020

I believe we're on the verge of a breakthrough.


400030

Well, don't keep us all in suspense.


400040

Just in case anyone's forgotten, let's start by reviewing what we already know. So! An Ascian is an immortal because its soul doesn't return to the aetherial realm when its host is defeated. Instead, it flees to the place that lies between our world and the void.


400050

Therefore, the first step to permanently defeating an Ascian is preventing its soul from making this journey. And if you recall, when we last gathered here, I had verified that white auracite has adequate capacity to entrap the beings, albeit only briefly.


400060

Which left the small matter of their extermination.


400070

Aye. To unmake an Ascian soul, one must needs smite it with a concentrated burst, or “blade,” of purest aether. However, we wanted for both the data and the means to forge such a weapon.


400080

Short of experimenting on an actual Ascian, you see, there's no way to gauge how much aether its soul is made of.


400090

As such, we don't know what aetheric density our blade needs to have in order for it to work.


400100

So we'll just have to make the densest blade we can, and hope for the best! Though that would require a lot of aether...


400110

Hang on a minute! Why didn't we think of this before!? White auracite can hold an absolute heap of aether, can't it!?


400120

Please tell me you're joking. Gods' sakes, Yda! I feel as though I'm reliving the same scene over and over with you! How many times do you need to be told that white auracite cannot store aether for long periods?


400130

Being intangible matter, aether is given to dispersion; only in its crystallized form is it a stable source of energy. I will test you later on this, so see to it you do not forget.


400140

Ah...r-right, yes... It's all coming back to me...


400150

So our hopes rest on good old crystals again, do they? While they are certainly reliable, they leave something to be desired in the area of portability.


400160

Indeed. I am reminded of the quantity of corrupted crystals required to thwart Leviathan, and the extraordinary lengths to which the Lominsans went to transport them. What if it should prove that a similar quantity was needed to destroy an Ascian soul─or still more...?


400170

I do not envy the poor sod who has to lug all of that around on the off chance that an Ascian appears.


400180

That's the very problem we set out to solve, and I reckon we've found the answer. If it isn't practical to lug around the aether we need, we'll just have to draw upon another source.


400190

And the only viable source is the land.


400200

If you mean to tap the great river of aether, know that it will entail considerable risk. Meddling with the currents may well induce a surge like to the one which despoiled Mor Dhona.


400210

Give me a bit more credit, will you? Why would we need to tap the river when there're veritable reservoirs jutting out all over the land?


400220

Aye, I speak of corrupted crystals. It might be that their aspect is out of balance, but a crystal's a crystal─it contains aether, and we can help ourselves to it.


400230

While corrupted crystals are indeed abundant, there is no guarantee that they will be in close proximity at a crucial moment.


400240

Ah, but what if we don't need them to be? What if we could tap their power from afar? A malm away, say?


400250

If we could do that, we'd have ready access to aether aplenty in almost every corner of Eorzea.


400260

I've yet to put my theories to the proof, but I've got a good feeling about this. If no one has any objections, I'd like to see where this avenue leads.


400270

If you think it worth your while, you have my blessing.


400280

But tell us, what are your theories? I for one am most eager to understand the process, however vaguely.


400290

I thought you might say that. But no one wants to listen to boring old theories all day, do they? I know I don't. So, with your permission, I'd like to try something a bit more hands-on. I've already built an aetheric siphon especially for this purpose, and I've been meaning to try it out.


400300

Thing is, the profusion of corrupted crystals in Mor Dhona makes it something of a high-risk testing ground. If anything goes awry with the siphon, it would be better if it didn't happen within spitting distance of quite so much aether.


400310

Ideally, I need an isolated specimen. Does anyone know where I can find one?


400320

May I suggest northern Thanalan? There you will find corrupted crystals of middling size, standing a reasonable distance apart. Ideal for your needs, I should have thought. Oh, and if you do elect to visit the place, I should be much obliged if you would assist me in another matter while you are in the area.


400330

Has something happened?


400340

Movement has been observed at Castrum Meridianum.


400350

During Operation Archon, the Alliance dealt the stronghold a heavy blow. Its facilities were extensively damaged, and its garrison reduced to a fraction of its former strength.


400360

Not long after our forces withdrew, however, their ranks were replenished by reinforcements from Castrum Centri. They now seek to rebuild, and to this end they have their sights set upon the Ceruleum Processing Plant.


400370

Having lost the Empire's support, the XIVth Legion lacks the resources to sustain itself. To them, this is a bid for survival, and they will doubtless fight like desperate men.


400380

Though I have dispatched the Crystal Braves, I fear their strength alone may not suffice to stay the imperial assault. I would request the Scions' aid in the defensive effort.


400390

If I didn't know better, I'd say you were trying to inveigle us into fighting your battle with the promise of shiny crystals!


400400

Well then, consider me inveigled! I won't lie, the crystals you speak of sound perfect─so the Garleans have to go!


400410

Besides, we can't afford to beat about the bush. There's no telling when the Ascians will next appear.


400420

Thine eagerness to hurl thyself into the jaws of danger cometh as little surprise. Exercise due caution, I prithee.


400430

Though you have become a Crystal Brave, you are yet a Scion, Alphinaud. We could hardly refuse you.


400440

Pray join the Crystal Braves and lend them your support. Thancred and Papalymo shall accompany you.


400450

Yda and Y'shtola─in the meantime I would have you assist Moenbryda. Scout out the crystal clusters, that the testing may commence as soon as the Garlean threat has been eliminated.


400460

If it please you, I shall continue mine own experiments on white auracite.


400470

Thank you, Urianger. Everyone, pray see to your preparations and depart as soon as you are able. Go well, and be safe.


500010

Hold on. I won't be a second.


500020

The beast seemed peckish, so I gave it a taste of my axe.


500030

I know, I know... As Urianger never tires of reminding me, “An axe ill becometh the hand of a scholar.” What can I say? I like axes. To hear my mother tell it, I came into this world holding one.


500040

And it's not as if it stopped me picking up a quill, is it? I often think of the man who introduced me to the joys of learning... He's one of the reasons I decided to come to Eorzea.


500050

...Him and my excruciatingly stiff childhood friend. Considering how unalike we are, it's a wonder we ever got on. The world's a strange old place, isn't it?


500060

Aye, that ought to do it.


500070

So far, so good. At these concentrations, it shouldn't matter too much if something goes awry. Just enough aether to make it interesting.


500080

Did you see that? The way the crystal glowed?


500090

The siphon works, I'm happy to say. With a few refinements, it should satisfy our appetite for aether. Which just leaves the small matter of forging our blade.


500100

I'm not sure how to go about it just yet, but I swear to find a way. I'll put a blade in your hands if it's the last thing I do.


500110

(-???-)She senses me. A useful talent.


500120

An Ascian!? Are they onto us!?


500130

By your brand, I see you are an Archon of Sharlayan. Keeper of knowledge. Seeker of truth. Meddler.


500140

I don't know what the hells you're saying, but I don't much like your tone.


500150

Hahaha. Your instincts serve you well. But come, be not unsettled on my account. That lovely brow was not made for frowns. Ah, but I waste my breath.


500160

Let me direct my words to one who understands them. We meet at last, Warrior of Light. I am Nabriales...


500170

...And you have long been a thorn in my side. I suffered the overweening presence of Lahabrea that men might host the power of gods, only for you to undo my hard work.


500180

Yaaarrrgh!


500190

Oh, bugger...


500200

Urgh!


500210

Do settle down.


500220

You must concede that I acted in self-defense.


500230

But what's this? I do not sense the blessing of Light...


500240

Oh dear! Could it be that frail Hydaelyn has forgotten Her champion!? This I did not foresee!


500250

Shorn of Light as you are, you are no longer a threat. And better yet, the seal is broken.


500260

Now is the time to claim the staff!


500270

With it in my grasp, I shall rise above them all and take my place at Lord Zodiark's right hand!


500280

What did that bastard want with us?


500290

Nabriales, he calls himself? With charm like that, I'll bet he has maidens falling at his feet. Unconscious.


500300

But this staff─you say just talking about it had the bastard grinning like a brat on his nameday? Must be quite a staff.


500310

Oh, gods... He means Tupsimati, Master Louisoix's staff!


500320

Minfilia's in danger! We have to get back to the Rising Stones!


600010

You two!


600020

So you were able to divine my intent. What now, Warrior of Light? Ah, but that name is no longer fitting. You have become decidedly dull, and quite incapable of barring my entry.


600030

What do you mean!?


600040

You truly do not know? Then I suppose it is only right that I enlighten you.


600050

The blessing of Light kept you and your fellow meddlers safe. It was that which prevented my kind from entering your domain.


600060

My kind, I say, though it had no power over the likes of Elidibus and Lahabrea. Being of this world, they could come and go as they please, while I could only look on...


600070

But I need look no longer. Now that the seal is gone, I mean to act. Unlike the others, I am not given to waiting. I shall take that staff and bring about the next Rejoining.


600080

...Rejoining? Then it was your doing! The Isle of Val, the scholars─all of it!


600090

You will not harm her!


600100

Urrrgh!


600110

Moenbryda!


600120

Why must you insist on forcing my hand? Did you learn nothing from our last meeting? Ah, but I forget─my words fall upon deaf ears.


600130

The staff is but a broken relic─a memorial to the departed. What possible use could you have for it?


600140

What use!? You mean to say that all this time, you kept the key, never knowing what it was you possessed?


600150

The staff Tupsimati─or rather, the stone tablet it bears─is host to a great power.


600160

Together with the horn, it can be used to draw vast quantities of aether from its bearer's surroundings.


600170

How else do you think Louisoix was able to invoke the power of the Twelve without making them an offering of crystals?


600180

Summoning requires not only prayer, but a profusion of aether. Even a child knows that.


600190

If I did not know before, you may be certain I do now. But above all, I know that we cannot allow this staff to fall into your hands. I will die before I let you take it.


600200

Insufferable woman. I would happily end your miserable life here and now... Alas, Elidibus would never let me hear the end of it.


600210

Very well. If you will not part with the staff, I will take you too.


600220

After them! Quickly...before the rift closes!


700010

It appears I have underestimated you... You are a formidable foe, even without the blessing of Light...


700020

And now I am forced to reveal this unseemly form. Hmph.


700030

You're safe... Thank the Twelve...


700040

You may have bested me this day...but what of the next? What of all the days to come!?


700050

Remember: Light no longer holds sway here. I may return whensoever I wish. Again and again and again. Eventually, you will falter and the staff will be mine. Until next time, Scions.


700060

There will be no next time! This is the end!


700070

What!? What trickery is this!?


700080

No! Nooo! You cannot! Nooooooooo!


700090

Use Tupsimati to gather aether! Quickly, before he breaks free!


700100

Concentrate! Call to mind the time you struck down Lahabrea with the blade of Light!


700110

Why won't it work? Is it because we lack the blessing of Light?


700120

Damn it... So much aether...and it still isn't enough...


700130

Fools! No mortal prison can contain me! I shall make you pay for your insolence!


700140

Please, Mother Hydaelyn! Hearken to our plea! Lend us Your divine Light!


700150

Why can You not hear us? Do our words no longer reach You?


700160

If only we had...a bit more aether...


700170

Moenbryda! What are you doing!?


700180

Master Louisoix... I understand now...the choice you made...


700190

In death...there is life... Farewell, Urianger...you daft old coot...


700200

Moenbryda, no! You mustn't─!


700210

What!? Nooo! It...it cannot end!


700220

I am eternal! I am immortaaaaaal!


700230

Moenbryda... She's...she's gone...


700240

You did it, my friend. The Ascian is dead.


800010

This device is a legacy of Moenbryda's toils and sacrifice.


800020

I shall hold on to it for safekeeping.


800030

Minfilia! Are you all right?


800040

I am.


800050

We were surveying northern Thanalan when we received the distress call.


800060

We returned as swiftly as we were able.


800070

It seems you have everything in hand, however.


800080

What happened here? Where is Moenbryda?


800090

She gave her life to temper the blade of Light? I...I have no words.


800100

Rather than await the inevitable, she took her fate into her own hands.


800110

Does...does Urianger know...?


800120

My friend. There is something I must tell you.


800130

I heard all, my lady.


800140

The moon sinketh, taking her leave of the heavens. Yet her passing heraldeth the coming of a new day.
...Moenbryda hath fulfilled her destiny, hath she not?


800150

Long ago, far across the seas in the Sharlayan motherland, Moenbryda and I did study under the sage tutelage of Master Louisoix.


800160

Full oft did he impress upon us that knowledge existeth to serve the greater good. This sentiment, however, was contrary to the nation's policy of neutrality, which censured intercedence in the affairs of foreign lands.


800170

In spite of vehement opposition, he founded the Circle of Knowing and journeyed hither to the heart of Eorzea. Through his noble sacrifice was the realm spared its doom.


800180

Yet this great soul, whom all should rightly have honored, was branded a pariah in his own land. His peers did accuse him of forsaking his duty as a man of learning, and of meddling in the course of history.


800190

When he left Sharlayan behind, Master Louisoix gave no word to signal his intent to Moenbryda. Close as they were, as master and disciple, she was deeply wounded by the sudden exclusion from his confidence.


800200

Above all, however, she was confused. Try as she might, she could ill comprehend her master's motive. The slanders that were heaped upon him after his passing served only to inflame the turmoil within her.


800210

For years upon end, she knew not what to believe, torn as she was 'twixt the man whom she revered, and the man who forsook her and his duty both.


800220

The Louisoix I knew would never forsake his duty, much less one of his own.


800230

This I know full well, my lady. 'Twas not for want of love that Master Louisoix hid his intent. He but desired that Moenbryda discover her own path, free of the shadow of his influence.


800240

Long did I contemplate revealing the truth to her, and long did I hold my peace. After all, was it not Master Louisoix's wish that she come to the truth unaided? I told myself it was, and resolved to let her suffer.


800250

Knowingly did I deny my friend the comfort she craved. And now she hath gone to her rest with doubt still in her heart.


800260

Speakest thou in earnest? Did Moenbryda truly come to understand Master Louisoix's will before the end?


800270

The realization hath set her free. She may now find the peace which hath for so long eluded her.


800280

Oh, Moenbryda... My dearest... How I shall miss thee...


800290

Moenbryda gave her life that we might possess the means to defeat the Ascians.


800300

Her sacrifice must not be in vain. Let us continue her work on the blade of aether and see it to completion.


800310

My lady. I would mourn Moenbryda in mine own way. I beg your permission to return to the Waking Sands.


800320

Of course, my friend. Take all the time you require. We shall be here should you have need of us.


900010

Forgive me, Moenbryda. Had I been quicker, or wiser...


900020

Q00260 You! You die! Q00270 Hmph. Q00280 I never doubted you. Not for a moment. But there is more to this than I yet understand. Q00290 Flee this place. Clear your names. Q00340 Avoiding the fumbling advances of some very persistent admirers. Q00341 When I realized the celebrations had turned sour, it seemed prudent to slip away and take stock of the situation. Q00350 'Twould appear that much of the city is already under tight guard. It occurs to me that expanding the Brass Blades' authority may not have been such a wonderful idea after all... Q00360 The success of this plan was contingent upon those thugs having the run of the place. Just how long has this scheme been in motion? Q00370 The careful preparations, the maneuvering of forces... I am inclined to agree with the General's insistence that a deeper plot exists here. Q00380 So...would I be right in thinking we now have an excuse to pummel as many Brass Blades as we like? Q00390 Unless you plan on pummeling them all, I'm not sure that will greatly aid our cause. Q00400 The sultana's assassination was but one part of the scheme. We too were its targets. And though we did not share poor Nanamo's fate, we are yet hobbled by the charges laid at our door. Where now might we seek refuge? Q00410 Where indeed. We may safely assume that our foe has thought to have the Rising Stones watched. Q00420 Forgive me for stating the obvious, but our choice of destination will matter little if we cannot secure an escape route out of Ul'dah. Q00430 Happily, I believe I can provide one. Papashan once told me about the passages hidden in the walls of the palace. If I recall correctly, the fireplace in Nanamo's chambers conceals the entrance to a tunnel. Q00440 It should lead outside the city, and allow us to avoid any messy confrontations. Q00450 The rest of you go on ahead. I'll handle this lot! Q00460 By yourself!? Q00461 <sigh> ...I suppose I shall just have to join you. Q00480 Crystal Braves, too, huh? Now this should be interesting! Q00470 Yda! Papalymo! Q00490 We will hold our pursuers here. Hurry, now! Find this tunnel of Thancred's! Q00500 Minfilia! We cannot linger! R00010 Ow! Now look what you've done! R00020 Yda, are you all right!? There are just too many of them... R00030 I'm fine! I could do this all day! How about you? R00040 ...Nearing the end of my tether. R00050 This is so stupid! We're the Scions of the Seventh Dawn! The ones who stand between this realm and the evil that's trying to destroy it! R00060 And if you think we'll leave the stewardship of Eorzea to the likes of your masters, then you're sorely mistaken! R00070 Sorry I dragged you into this, Papalymo... R00080 Hah, 'tis hardly the first time. And I'll be damned if it will be the last. R00090 Let them have it, Yda! R00100 I was hoping you'd say that! S00010 I never knew such a watercourse existed beneath Ul'dah. S00020 The architecture is of the Sil'dihn style, if I am not mistaken. The ancients plainly foresaw the need for a ready means of escape. S00030 (-???-)This way! S00040 Well, that didn't take long. It seems these tunnels were not as secret as I had hoped. S00050 You two go on ahead. Thancred and I will deal with this. S00060 Wh-What do you mean to do!? S00070 Only that which is required to ensure that the dawn's light survive to brighten the morrow. S00120 Numbers will count for little when I bring the tunnel down upon their heads. Though I cannot say I relish the thought of being entombed with you for all eternity. S00130 You wound me! Now would be a good time, milady! S00160 'Tis done! S00170 Forgive me, Mhitra... S00180 Farewell, Minfilia... T00010 Hydaelyn... She speaks to me. T00020 No! T00030 I must remain behind...but you cannot stay with me. T00040 Please, you must go on! You are the Warrior of Light! You are hope for the Scions, and for all the realm! T00050 As long as your flame continues to burn, the light of the dawn may ever be relit! T00060 You must escape, and save Eorzea from those who would plunge it into darkness! T00070 'Tis the only way... U00010 I am glad to see you safe, my friend! What of the others? U00020 Damn that man! U00030 Teledji played me for a fool! I thought the Crystal Braves mine till the very moment I felt the blade at my back... U00040 (-???-)There will be ample time for soul-searching later. For now, we must put some malms between us and Ul'dah. U00050 Well, if it ain't the hero of the Scions! You look to me like a woman in need of a nice, relaxin' carriage ride! U00060 Well, would you look who it is! Need a ride? I doubt it'll be half as excitin' as the last trip we took not if I have anythin' to say about it, anyway! U00070 Let's not dawdle, eh? All aboard! V00010 I was stockin' up on supplies over in Vesper Bay, you see, when your sister come up an' begged a favor. Said her brother was havin' some trouble down in Ul'dah, an' likely needed a helpin' hand gettin' away. V00020 Thinkin' them ruins would make a fine hidin' place, I decided to try there first...an' lo an' behold, there you were. V00030 Aye, an' judgin' by them soldiers as were pourin' out of the city, I arrived not a moment too soon... V00040 Must've been fate that we happened to find you there though, eh? V00050 I had thought to look out for Alisaie, but 'twould appear she was the one watching over me. I've made such a mess of things... V00060 An' who might you be, young sir? V00070 Pipin Tarupin, Vice Marshal of the Immortal Flames. V00080 I had been on the Ala Mhigan front these past few moons, but an urgent communication called me back to Ul'dah. V00090 Scarce had my boots touched the cobbles, though, when the streets erupted with cries of assassination. I immediately went in search of answers, and came across Master Alphinaud here. Needless to say, I did not think his imprisonment justified. V00100 The blame plainly lies with the Monetarists. Their greed and corruption are well known to me, but for them to take advantage of the situation with such alacrity... V00110 ...Was that  Pipin,  you said? Ain't that the name of General Aldynn's lad? V00120 Yes, I am his son. Adopted, of course. 'Twas only as we were leaving Ul'dah that I learned of Father's fate. V00130 Once I have seen you a safe distance away, I mean to return to the city and extricate him from this madness. V00140 Then you needn't travel no further than Black Brush our fugitives have a friend waitin' for 'em there. V00150 I dreamed of bringing about Eorzea's salvation, but in the end... V00160 'Twas I who needed saving. W00010 There has been word from the capital. Ishgard has weathered another assault, and 'tis said several wyverns broke through into the city proper. W00020 The Temple Knights succeeded in slaying the beasts, but the intrusion prompted orders to further strengthen the guard and to place the city under a perpetual state of alert. W00030 How keenly we feel the loss of our wards at the Gates of Judgement... W00040 Yet we must not bemoan our misfortune. Ser Aymeric is safely returned from Ul'dah and once more leads the defense of Ishgard. W00050 As for the matter of your asylum, I am afraid no progress will be made until the threat to our nation has diminished. W00060 But do not despair! You are not without allies. W00070 You are more than welcome to shelter here for as long as you wish. Pray think of it as a new headquarters of sorts the  Falling Snows  or some such! W00080 All frivolity aside, any who come here in search of you will receive no aid from House Fortemps. For once, the Ishgardian reputation for inhospitality shall work in our favor. W00090 Agents of Ul'dah will find their every inquiry dismissed, and their every request for entry rebuffed, until such time as their masters have acknowledged your innocence. W00100 You once fought to preserve the honor of my dear friend 'tis a blessing that I may now repay that debt in kind. W00110 But let us dwell no more on this. Pray join the rest of your companions. W00120 'Tis bitterly cold this day. I suspect there are those who might welcome the warmth your presence brings. X00010 'Tis all my doing... X00020 I believed myself the only one who truly understood Eorzea's woes. And look what that arrogance has wrought. X00030 I gave commands, influenced governments with my certainty... X00040 I treated the Crystal Braves, and even the Scions themselves, as pawns in my great scheme to save the realm. X00050 But in my headlong rush unto imagined glory, I paid no heed to the ground upon which I trod! X00060 The salvation of Eorzea... What was it that I hoped to achieve? X00070 Did I believe that I could rid the realm of every danger and difficulty? That I could defeat the Empire and the Ascians, and find homes for every refugee? X00080 Oh yes, I was so very clever.  Become a guardian of Eorzea,  I implored, and sat back to watch my perfect army cleanse the land of chaos. X00090 'Twas all but a means to feed my own vanity. X00100 Only when all is lost do I finally realize the truth. X00110 Oh, Alphinaud... X00120 So, Master Alphinaud, are you content to remain a broken blade? Is there no flame hot enough to reforge you? X00130 What of the fine companions who yet stand at your side? I daresay the fires of their determination will soon have you slicing the air again with your customary wit! X00140 I hardly deserve such friendship. And besides, where are we to go...? X00150 Alphinaud? If I may...? X00160 Should this place not serve our purpose, then...then we shall go to Ishgard! X00170 Minfilia told me many times: as long as we stand fast against despair, the beacon of hope will never be lost to sight. X00180 Be it in the snow or in the clouds, we few will see that the dawn's light shines again! X00190 <sniff> <sniff> X00200 You are right, Tataru, thank you. And thank you for your kind words, Lord Haurchefant. X00210 'Tis true that Eorzea yet has her guardians. X00220 The Scions have achieved much, and 'twould be remiss of me to discard it all in a fit of self-pity. X00230 Let us then resume our journey, together...one step at a time. Y00010 All has been arranged as you desired, my lord. Y00020 Hmph. Z00010 Heh heh heh. Thou thinkest sanctuary lieth beyond? Z00020 Delusion. Despair. Death. Thou shalt find naught else here.

name: 3.0 Heavensward Cutscenes [VoiceMan_03000]
text_html:
000020

Owww! It hurts! It hurts!Enkidu! Your master wants for succor!


000030

Fancy some feathers...bird brain?


000040

This should cut you down to size...


000050

Fight on, Enkidu, my ever faithful─hm!?


000060

Enkidu! Are the bonds of our friendship so fragile!?


000070

Not the strongest of swords, but it should suffice.


000080

Gilgamesh is in the mood...for dancing!


000090

Divide and conquer, Gilgamesh style!


000100

...And now for something truly shocking!


000110

What's the matter, friend? All tied up?


000120

Uh-oh! Someone just woke the dragon...


000130

You have some skill, I'll give you that...
But Gilgamesh has only just begun to fight!


000140

Most impressive!
Very well─I, too, shall fight with all my strength!


000150

No! The mighty Gilgamesh will not be defeated!


100010

At long last, we meet again on the battlefield!
I daresay Enkidu shall come to enjoy our tussles as much as I.


100020

You, however, might not find this one so enjoyable.
...Unless you enjoy getting pounded senseless. Hah!


200010

Me? Run away? Hah! I-I was but seeking out a
more suitable spot to celebrate my inevitable victory!


200020

But enough exposition! Now we fight like men!
And ladies! And ladies who dress like men!


200030

For Gilgamesh...it is transmogrifying time!


200040

The mightiest warrior ever to grace Eorzea stands before you─
by which I mean I, Gilgamesh! Prepare yourself!


300010

To think that my full complement of arms would avail me naught...


300020

No more high jinks from Gilgamesh. You have my word.


300030

The Treaty-Blade, too, I shall return.
...Just as soon as I remember where I hid it.


300040

Anyway, I yield to your unparalleled puissance!
Spare my insignificant life, I beg of you!


400010

...NOT! Ha, I lied...again! Like a rug! Oh, I kill me!


400020

You can take that fusty old blade for all I care! I thirst for true
power, and naught save the strongest of swords will suffice!


400030

Warrior of Light─you have proven a worthy opponent.
But I warn you─treasure every moment with your weapon.


400040

For as sure as day follows night, the hour will come when
I claim it as mine own! Till we meet again!

name: 3.0 Heavensward Cutscenes [VoiceMan_03001]
text_html:
000020

So long as we have these specious accusations hanging over us, we will struggle to achieve anything.


000030

You must go to Ishgard, as Tataru proposed. I will return to Ul'dah and set things right.


000040

Pray do not be so hasty, Master Alphinaud.


000050

Lord Haurchefant?


000060

Full well do I understand your desire to clear your names.


000070

But now is not the time for drastic action. You yet have allies upon whom you can rely. There is no need to act alone.


000080

Yes...yes, of course. Pray forgive my impatience.


000090

I bring tidings. Count Edmont has decreed that the three of you be taken in as wards of House Fortemps. Under our patronage, you shall be granted access to the city proper.


000100

Pray consider our manor your new headquarters, from which you may gather information and plan how best to proceed.


000110

Needless to say, should any of your missing allies be found─as I am certain they shall─they will of course be welcome to join you there.


000120

You are more than generous, my friend. On behalf of my fellows, I humbly accept your offer of hospitality.


000130

The count is a good man and just. He will treat you with the kindness and respect that a hero─and dear friend─deserves.


000140

To Ishgard, then─together.


000150

There we shall carry on the Scions' legacy. There we shall begin anew.


000160

Hear, hear!


100010

And so they came, at a friend's behest.


100020

Heroes once celebrated as saviors of Eorzea, brought low through treachery,
their names blackened with royal blood...


100030

With memories of the lost and dreams of redemption,
with hope yet in their hearts, they came...


200010

To Ishgard, shining city on the mount, overlooking the dominion of Coerthas...


200020

A great and proud nation devoted to Halone, the Fury, ruled by Thordan VII,
Archbishop of the Ishgardian Orthodox Church...


200030

The last bastion of the Faith, her walls ever bristling with
the sworn swords and spears of her four High Houses...


200040

A land that after a thousand years of war
had forgotten what it was to be at peace.


200050

Through gates long closed the Warrior of Light and her companions passed,
entering at last a city whose history was written in blood.


200060

In the midst of the Dragonsong War they came─three weary travelers
whose arrival would set in motion great change...


200070

Though none knew then how great...


200080

From the memoirs of Count Edmont de Fortemps
Heavensward


300010

My lord, I have returned with the Scions.


300020

I hope your journey was not too taxing.


300030

I, Count Edmont de Fortemps, do bid you welcome.


300040

As wards of House Fortemps, you shall be afforded every courtesy. My home is your home.


300050

My companions and I are deeply honored, Count Fortemps.


300060

The honor is mine, Master Alphinaud. Consider it an expression of our gratitude for your service to Ishgard.


300070

Forgive me, my lord, but...are you not concerned? To accept foreign guests at such a juncture─especially ones with our...reputation...


300080

Do not worry yourself on my account. 'Tis true that Ishgard's first thought has ever been the war effort, hence the closing of our borders...


300090

...Yet it is in troubled times most of all that men should seek allies, don't you think?


300100

Granted, my decision will have raised eyebrows in the Vault and in the halls of the other High Houses.


300110

But so long as you continue with your altruistic endeavors, I doubt my honored peers will feel moved to voice their concerns.


300120

Then there is naught to fear. Though our numbers are much reduced, we are no less determined to carry on our work.


300130

Full glad am I to hear it. Ah, but before you return to your labors, why not take a tour of the city?


300140

You would do well, I think, to acquaint yourselves with your new surroundings. After all, you may be here for some time.


400010

To the frozen wastes of the western highlands,
once verdant tracts made pallid by the Calamity...


400020

Beyond the towering wall of ice, to lands long forsaken
that the knights of Ishgard strove tirelessly to reclaim...


400030

To the hamlet of Falcon's Nest, once abandoned,
now freed of its pall of snow and ash, she came...


500010

(-Iceheart-)Looking for me, I presume.


500020

Ahhh, the child who glimpsed the truth.


500030

(-Iceheart-)No, it cannot be!


500040

She cameth unto me, as didst thou.


500050

Alike in gifts, yet set upon different paths.


500060

(-Iceheart-)He speaks true, Warrior of Light. Like you, I have been blessed with the Echo.


500070

(-Iceheart-)The visions terrified me at first. They came without warning. I wondered what I had done to deserve them...


500080

(-Iceheart-)But I had no time to ponder such things once the Calamity came.


500090

(-Iceheart-)The land turned against us, and in a matter of hours, Falcon's Nest was buried under ten fulms of ice and snow. We had no choice but to flee for Ishgard.


500100

(-Iceheart-)We came to the wall, and while we searched for a way through, there was an avalanche. And then I was alone.


500110

(-Iceheart-)So I set forth for Dravania. I knew full well what might happen were I found, but I could not survive on my own.


500120

(-Iceheart-)I was found, of course─and not by a mere dragon, but by the great wyrm Hraesvelgr!


500130

(-Iceheart-)And it was then that I knew why I had been given this gift, for with it I heard his voice, and saw the truth through his eyes!


500140

(-Iceheart-)I was chosen to deliver this revelation to the people─to bring dragon and man together, as they once were, and should ever be!


Q1

What will you say?


A1

Killing civilians won't bring them together!
What of the innocents who died when you attacked Foundation?


500150

(-Iceheart-)It wasn't supposed to be like that! You have to believe me! It was...beyond my control...


500160

(-Iceheart-)Children taught to fear the skies, who saw their loved ones slaughtered...


500170

(-Iceheart-)Yet the Dravanians─though they know where the fault truly lies─fell upon them with such fury...


500180

Men die, and their children forget. But we are everlasting. To us, then is as now.


500190

Thou canst not comprehend the violation. The outrage. The fury.


500200

(-Iceheart-)I will make this right.


500210

(-Iceheart-)I am neither a saint nor a savior─just another sinner. Yet I will not forsake this cause. I cannot. I will see this cycle broken and peace restored.


500220

(-Iceheart-)I... We can do naught else, for we are now as one...


600010

Upon an airship conceived within the fecund mind of Cid Garlond,
renegade prodigy of Garlemald who had come to call Eorzea home...


600020

High into the heavens where isles of earth and stone floated as clouds─
a frontier the knights of Ishgard had scarce begun to explore...


600030

To a fledgling outpost within the Sea of Clouds where careworn scouts
ever scanned the skies for winged shadows, she came...


700010

Reinforcements!?


700020

Anger of Honu, chief of mighty Vundu, roils like blackest storm clouds!


700030

Offer netherlings to the White! Cloud sea swells and He comes!


700040

The White! The White! Mighty Bismarck, Lord of the Mists!


700050

A flying whale!? By the Fury, i-it's a primal!


700060

We must away!


700070

Damn!


700080

Bloody typical... All right─we're going in!


700090

(-Biggs and Wedge-)Aye aye, chief!


700100

All aboard!


800010

The hero returns! I cannot thank you enough for saving young Emmanellain's life. Aye, aye─he told me everything.


800020

I've also received letters from both House Dzemael and Durendaire praising your conduct─and that of House Fortemps. You've won us much honor, my friend.


800030

My lord!


800040

What is it? Speak.


800050

Pray forgive the intrusion, my lord, but I-I bring grave tidings!


800060

Master Alphinaud and Mistress Tataru have been detained on suspicion of fomenting heresy!


800070

What? Explain!


800080

They...they were observed entering a tavern in the lower levels on some half-dozen occasions. There, it is claimed, they made a number of inquiries...


800090

Inquiries which brought them into contact with certain...ahem...elements. 'Twas this which prompted a knight of the Heavens' Ward to demand that they be questioned. Ser Grinnaux, my lord...


800100

Ser Grinnaux is a brute─an exceedingly accomplished brute, but a brute nonetheless. Alas, he is also a son of House Dzemael.


800110

How quickly we forget the petty nature of men. I'd wager your friends are no more than pawns in another of my countrymen's games. Such is the way of things between the High Houses...


900010

We are gathered here today, under the watchful gaze of the Fury, to ascertain the guilt of two souls in a trial by combat! Petitioners, step forward!


900020

Ser Grinnaux─for the benefit of all here present, I would ask you to repeat the charges which you have leveled against this man and this woman.


900030

I, Ser Grinnaux de Dzemael, brother of the Heavens' Ward, did bear witness to these two foreigners consorting with heretics!


900040

Let the accused step forward!


900050

Alphinaud Leveilleur, Tataru Taru─you have heard the charges leveled against you.


900060

Will you take up arms to refute Ser Grinnaux's claim and thereby prove your innocence in the eyes of gods and men?


900070

I, Alphinaud Leveilleur, am innocent of this charge, and claim my right to trial by combat!


900080

I, Tataru Taru, am innocent of this charge...


900090

But I am no warrior, and cannot fight, so I claim the right to name a champion!


900100

To the old and the infirm, the young and the weak, this right we allow. Very well. Who will stand for this woman?


900110

Just as I was beginning to doubt the efficacy of the Ishgardian justice system! Come, my friend─let us put an end to this mummer's farce!


900120

O Halone, render unto us Your judgment! Raise up the righteous, and cast down the wicked!


A00010

Your Eminence, it is my honor to present to you the Warrior of Light.


A00020

I have heard the tales of your many grand endeavors. The lord commander has also been most effusive in his praise.


A00030

I am Thordan VII, Archbishop of the Ishgardian Orthodox Church, and I bade you come here that I might offer my personal apologies.


A00040

You will forgive me for not calling upon you as courtesy would dictate, but as you can see, my more sprightly days are long behind me. But I digress.


A00050

Your companions were wrongly accused of heresy and subjected to gross indignities. This, I am sorry to say, was the result of negligence on the part of our nation's protectors─negligence born of an excess of zeal. Is that not so, Ser Zephirin?


A00060

Yes, Your Eminence... Regrettably, it would appear that we of the Heavens' Ward were in receipt of erroneous information.


A00070

Ser Grinnaux has ever been headstrong. He pressed charges before the truth had been ascertained, for which I most sincerely apologize.


A00080

An unfortunate misunderstanding born of an earnest desire to serve Ishgard─but one which should never have occurred...


A00090

For who could doubt the character of those who bested Shiva and drove the Horde from the Steps of Faith? Not I, that much is certain.


A00100

That will be all, Ser Zephirin. I would speak with our guest in private.


A00110

Your Eminence? I─


A00120

As you wish, Your Eminence. That will be all for today!


A00130

Privacy is a luxury rarely afforded one in my position.


A00140

Now, tell me, young lady: what do you know of the Ascians?


A00150

Much and more, I shouldn't wonder, being the Bringer of Light. You should know that I myself have met with them─have entertained them as guests, even.


A00160

Those harbingers of chaos and strife offered us power, that we might continue our war against the dragons.


A00170

I have no intention of aiding their cause, of course, nor less of being their puppet.


A00180

Yet were I to refuse them outright, I should learn naught of their true objectives and remain powerless to stop them.


A00190

Thus have I hearkened to their words with interest, and paid lip service to their beliefs, biding my time and preparing for the inevitable conflict.


A00200

And why do I tell you this? Because there is naught in this world they fear more than the power of the Warrior of Light.


A00210

If we are to rid ourselves of these vile interlopers, we must needs work together. With our combined strength, I have faith that we can wrest Eorzea from their grasp, and pave the way for a lasting peace. Think on it.


B00010

There you are. I confess, I was more than a little concerned when I learned that you had been summoned to the Vault. What did they want with you?


B00020

Well, well. A formal apology and an admonishment of those responsible? I see my fears were wholly misplaced.


B00030

By the gods, the archbishop freely admits to consorting with Ascians? So their ambitions extend to Ishgard as well...


B00040

We will have new primals to contend with ere long, of that you may be certain. 'Tis but a matter of time. Yet shorn of the support of our missing allies, what can we realistically hope to achieve?


B00050

Ahhh! In the midst of all the excitement, I completely forgot to tell you!


B00060

When I was asking around about the Scions, I heard the most awful rumor!


B00070

General Raubahn is to be executed for crimes against the sultanate!


B00080

If the Flame General dies, we will lose a staunch ally, and the one man capable of holding the sultana's assassins to account.


B00090

Lord Haurchefant was wise to counsel restraint, but this business will brook no delay.


B00100

We cannot permit this execution to take place. We must save Raubahn!

name: 3.0 Heavensward Cutscenes [VoiceMan_03002]
text_html:
000020

Thankfully, we had allies there who took us under their wing. And theirs was not the only aid we received, I suspect.


000030

When we fled Ul'dah, we fully expected to become wanted men, known to all and hounded at every turn. Yet that did not come to pass. On the contrary, 'twould seem the charges against us have not been made public. Might we have you to thank for that, Admiral?


000040

Sharp as ever, Master Alphinaud. On Marshal Tarupin's urging, the Elder Seedseer and I demanded that the Syndicate suppress news of the Scions' alleged crimes until such time as irrefutable evidence could be found.


000050

Our argument was simple: lacking proof, to accuse the saviors of the realm of so unlikely a crime would have the people up in arms. In their wisdom, the Syndicate agreed, as you yourself have seen.


000060

There is something you should know. Some few days prior to the banquet, the Elder Seedseer and I were summoned for a private audience with the sultana.


000070

There, she revealed her intent to announce her abdication, that she might pave the way for the establishment of an Ul'dahn republic.


000080

What? But such an announcement would have plunged the entire nation into chaos!


000090

She was well aware of that. 'Twas for fear of what might ensue that she summoned us. Her Grace wanted the Elder Seedseer and I to lend Raubahn a helping hand, you see─to aid him in preserving the peace during the transition.


000100

So...having somehow caught wind of her plan, Lolorito and Teledji plotted the sultana's assassination in the hope of maintaining the constitutional status quo...?


000110

But they must have known that her death would sow as much chaos as her abdication─chaos from which Teledji alone might feasibly stand to profit. Surely Lolorito would never knowingly─


000120

Ah. Could it be...? I dare not hope...


000130

The Ul'dahn authorities have yet to announce the sultana's passing.


000140

To allay any suspicion that may arise from Her Grace's absence, they have issued a statement to the effect that she is presently convalescing from illness.


000150

Mayhap they're waiting for a fitting moment to break the news. Or mayhap they know of some other reason to delay.


000160

Something else has been bothering me, Admiral. I was dismayed to learn that General Raubahn is to be executed─yet upon hearing the news, I could not help but wonder why he had been kept alive for so long.


000170

Pray mistake not my meaning─I am, of course, overjoyed that our friend still draws breath, and that he might yet be saved. But if his enemies truly wished to eliminate him, they could have done so immediately. I see no reason for this delay.


000180

Aye... You've struck upon an important point, Master Alphinaud.


000190

Following his capture, Raubahn had been held in the Marasaja Pit within Ul'dah. In recent days, however, he has reportedly been moved to an unknown location.


000200

Queerly, 'twas not the Brass Blades who spirited him away, either, but a band of soldiers decked in blue...


000210

The Crystal Braves.


000220

Aye. If I read the winds aright, the arrangement between Lord Lolorito and the Braves has come under strain.


000230

At any rate, if we're to rescue Raubahn, we'll have to find him first. And you'll be glad to hear that I have already entrusted the task to those best able to see it done─our friends of Doma.


100010

Pray forgive me my lateness.


100020

Lady Yugiri!


100030

Master Alphinaud. I am pleased to see that the light of resolve shines in your eyes once more.


100040

Ah, yes... How pathetic I must have seemed to you when we last met. I am ashamed to recall it. For a time I was well and truly lost. But with the aid of my comrades, I have since refound my purpose, and I shall take care not to misplace it again.


100050

Since your escape from Ul'dah, my fellow shinobi and I have shadowed the Crystal Braves' every step in hopes of learning the Scions' whereabouts.


100060

Regrettably, our investigation has yet to yield any useful information. Pray forgive us.


100070

You need not apologize, my lady─we are grateful for all that you have done on our behalf. Besides, Raubahn is no less a friend, and we cannot well abandon him to his fate.


100080

Hozan─the three of us shall attend to the Flame General's rescue. Pray draw away the guards by the entrance. Take Doware and Higiri with you.


100090

With me!


200010

This changes nothing!


200020

It is over, Ilberd! Lay down your arms and surrender yourself to justice!


200030

Justice!? Justice for what exactly? 'Twas not I who assassinated the sultana, boy!


200040

Ere we debate who is responsible for the assassination, I would ask whether an assassination took place at all.


200050

Clever little shite...


200060

If you think you fight for justice, lass, you'd best wake up. The truth is, you fight for whoever bloody well tells you to. Can you not see you're being used!? By the Scions, the city–states, even the Crystal Braves. They none of 'em care a whit what you want─only what you can do for them.


200070

And how do I know this? Because I'm the same─a pawn to be used as my masters see fit. All I ever wanted was to liberate my homeland, and I ate dirt to make it happen. But what have I achieved after all these years in servitude? Nothing! Not a bloody thing.


200080

If we ourselves are not free─free to think and to act─how are we ever to reclaim our homeland? Know this: there is nothing I would not give to take back Ala Mhigo! NOTHING!


200090

You'll not get away!


200100

No, Master Alphinaud. Now is not the time.


300010

I'm but a cripple and a fool, and still you came for me... I'm in your debt.


300020

We are all of us fools of fate, General. But even fools have a part to play.


Q1

What will you say to Raubahn?


A1

We stand with you.
On your feet, gladiator. This fight is not over.


300030

Rest assured, I was not planning to die till I'd avenged the sultana... Still, your words are welcome, lass.


300040

Know this, Ilberd... There is nothing I would not give to see you pay for what you've done. My wealth, my arm, my life...nothing.


300050

General─are you aware that Lord Lolorito has yet to announce the sultana's death to the public?


300060

...What? No. No, I was not aware of that─nor of anything else outside my cell. 'Tis passing strange, though... I assumed the bastard would make it known at the first opportunity and set about tearing down the sultanate.


300070

As did we all. And it is indeed strange that he did not─strange or perhaps revealing? Now, I have no conclusive proof, nor do I wish to give you false hope...but I have reason to believe that Her Grace may yet live.


300080

What? But how can that be?


300090

Forgive me, friends, but it is not safe here. Let us continue this conversation without.


400010

My dearest friends! Praise be unto the Twelve for delivering you from the clutches of treachery.


400020

Father!


400030

Pipin, my son... And Master Papashan besides...


400040

Forgive me, Father... I should have been at Her Grace's side...


400050

(-???-)Save your tears. The sultana yet lives.


400060

You...


400070

(-???-)It was I who arranged this gathering.


400080

And judging by your perplexed expressions, it would seem introductions are in order. I am Dewlala, head of the Order of Nald'thal, and member of the Syndicate.


400090

What you said about the sultana─is it true? Is she alive?


400100

Young lady─I understand you were with the sultana when she drank from the poisoned goblet and collapsed. Would I be correct in assuming that you did not personally verify Her Grace's vital signs?


400110

Why ask, when 'tis plain you know the answer!


400120

Calm yourself, General, and let me finish. The truth is not as you imagine it. You are all victims of a most ingenious ruse─a ruse conceived to eliminate the threat posed by Teledji Adeledji.


400130

'Tis my belief that Teledji plotted the sultana's assassination alone, but that Lolorito caught wind of his plot, and exploited it to his own ends.


400140

He sought to manipulate you into eliminating Teledji for him, and you duly obliged. At one fell swoop, he removed his two foremost rivals, all the while remaining above suspicion.


400150

Gods strike me down for a fool... But the sultana─how can it be that she lives?


400160

She lives because Lolorito willed it. Her own lady-in-waiting is but one of his many little birds; by her sleight of hand, the poison was switched for a less deadly draft before it could reach her mistress's lips.


400170

Some manner of sedative, perchance...of a potency sufficient to induce a slumber like unto death.


400180

Were I to guess, I would say Her Grace is being held somewhere, dreaming dreams of a brighter Ul'dah, even as we speak.


400190

Oh, Nanamo...


400200

I will never forgive Lolorito for his part in this.


400210

Though Lolorito's hands are far from clean, they did pluck Her Grace from the jaws of death. That must count for something.


400220

And though one may call the man's methods into question, it cannot be denied that he knows the value of stability─to the very gil, like as not. He craves power, 'tis true, but he has no desire to depose the sultana.


400230

I had never taken sides in your feud with the Monetarists, but it was not for want of concern for our nation's welfare. Indeed, 'twas out of the desire to see order restored that I furnished your Far Eastern friends with information, and arranged this gathering.


400240

I hope you are ready to work, General, for there is much work to be done. Our first priority must be to bring matters back into balance. Lest you forget Her Grace's words, the true wealth of Ul'dah lies in the health, happiness, and hopes of her people.


400250

As for the more worldly kind of wealth, I am content to let Lolorito help himself to whatever Teledji Adeledji left behind.


400260

You, meanwhile, must do that which you alone can do: rescue Her Grace and take your place at her side once more. For her sake...and that of our nation.
