name: 3.0 Heavensward Cutscenes [VoiceMan_03003]
text_html:
000020

But what other choice do we have? It's not like we can talk it over with them. Dragons and men aren't exactly on speaking terms.


000030

...With certain notable exceptions.


000040

You don't mean...Iceheart!?


000050

When last you spoke with her, she lamented her crimes, did she not?


000060

Then there remains a sliver of hope. If we can persuade Iceheart to act as our intermediary, we may yet be able to convince Nidhogg to abandon his bloody course.


000070

If there is to be a meeting, I would accompany you.


000080

...Estinien!?


000090

Even with your intermediary, Nidhogg's bloodrage may render him deaf to reason. However, the mere attempt may afford our forces precious time to prepare.


000100

Of course...you might also consider a more direct approach to ending this conflict. With the power of the Eye at my disposal, and the vaunted strength of the Warrior of Light, we could conceivably slay the beast outright...


000110

If we are to risk a face-to-face meeting with the dread wyrm, I for one would feel safer in the company of the Azure Dragoon. However, I should only turn to your lance if my words failed to find their mark. Is that clear?


000120

Perfectly. I shall assume that Iceheart enjoys similar diplomatic protection until instructed otherwise.


000130

A word of advice: think carefully before divulging the particulars of this plan to Ser Aymeric. 'Twould not do to have the lord commander accused of consorting with heretics.


000140

Indeed. I thank you for your counsel, Estinien. We shall be honored to have you with us.


000150

I am glad to be of service.


100010

I want the defenses of the outer ward rechecked. See to it that the ballistas are in good repair and supplied with enough ammunition for a prolonged siege.


100020

At once, my lord!


100030

Ah, 'twould seem I have visitors─and unlike those massing beyond our walls, these ones are welcome.


100040

Pray forgive us for interrupting you in the midst of your preparations, Ser Aymeric, but our suit concerns the impending assault. To speak plain, we believe there is a chance the invasion might be halted before it even begins.


100050

I can divulge little more at this time, but I must nevertheless request that you advise the Holy See to refrain from launching any preemptive sorties whilst we seek to put our plans in motion.


100060

I will gladly lend my support to any endeavor that could spare the blood of my countrymen─but I would know more of the cause you would have me champion. Will you not share aught of this mysterious undertaking?


100070

Know that I have offered my lance to aid in this endeavor. I cannot claim that its success is assured, but our actions should serve to delay Nidhogg's advance at the very least.


100080

Which is more than can be said for the ill-conceived counterattack advocated by the See's more vocal crusaders. They offer glorious death, but little hope of victory.


100090

Aye...their proposal does not inspire confidence. Our resources should rightly be spent shoring up the city's defenses.


100100

Hmmm. The Azure Dragoon and the Warrior of Light, sallying forth together to face the dread wyrm, Nidhogg...


100110

I must admit, the mere thought of it does much to dispel my misgivings. Go, then─carry out your plan. I shall do what I can for you within the Holy See.


200010

Such commotion...


200020

Yes, Your Eminence. The bells of the Observatorium warn of our enemy's approach...


200030

So...the dragons are coming.


200040

Let them come─in their hundreds and their thousands. With the divine blade in our hands, we shall rend their flesh and drown the heretics in their masters' blood. Even Nidhogg and his foul brood shall be powerless to resist us.


200050

And when we have rid the world of their pestilence, we shall turn our attention to our Ascian allies─see that they are suitably rewarded for their invaluable assistance.


200060

If I may, Your Eminence. The Paragons wield powers strange and unknowable. Can we be certain that they will not see through our deception?


200070

We can be certain of naught save the righteousness of our cause. If you would be a true leader of men, you must possess conviction as well as caution.


200080

We seek to excise the root of an evil that has blighted us for a thousand years. The risk is worth the reward.


200090

And what of Estinien and this Warrior of Light? They have plans of their own...


200100

Leave them to their purpose. We must each play the role we have been given...you and your chosen brothers most of all.


200110

For the glory of King Thordan...


300010

(-Iceheart-)Ah, I should have known it would be you...


300020

(-Iceheart-)Word reached me of a struggle with a small but well-armed band of trespassers. Forgive my comrades their hostility─few come here uninvited, and fewer still with good intent.


300030

(-Iceheart-)Now, tell me why you are here.


Q1

What will you say to Lady Iceheart?


A1

We wish to stop Nidhogg's attack on Ishgard.
We wished to speak with you.
It's a long story...


300040

(-Iceheart-)So, you seek to stem the Dravanian tide with talk? A romantic notion.


300050

(-Iceheart-)If you but knew the truth─the spark which lit the flames of this animosity─you would understand the futility of your quest.


300060

(-Iceheart-)Shall I relate it to you? The sordid history my gift has shown me? That which the Holy See has taken such pains to suppress?


400010

(-Iceheart-)'Twas more than a millennium past when an Elezen tribe first sought to claim the lands of Coerthas as its home.


400020

(-Iceheart-)Unfortunately for them, Coerthas was already home to dragonkind, and they were not inclined to make way for the invaders. Thus did a bloody war begin─a war which might well have rumbled on until one or the other side was exterminated, had it not been for the resolve of a single woman. That woman's name was “Shiva.”


400030

(-Iceheart-)While those around her fought and died, she attempted to parley with the dragons, and in so doing discovered them to be possessed of profound intelligence and reason. The great wyrm Hraesvelgr in particular so enchanted Shiva that she found herself growing to love the creature, whom her people considered a monster.


400040

(-Iceheart-)In the eyes of a near-immortal dragon, however, the fleeting life of an Elezen is as that of a freshly cut rose─scarce has the flower bloomed before it begins to fade and wither.


400050

(-Iceheart-)Such melancholy musings plagued Hraesvelgr, who had found in Shiva an unexpected and beloved soulmate. He knew that all too soon, death would snatch her away from him.


400060

(-Iceheart-)Unable to bear the thought of their separation, the maid bid the wyrm consume her, that their spirits might be entwined for eternity.


400070

(-Iceheart-)...Though loath to perform the deed, Hraesvelgr ultimately gave in to her plea, and soon thereafter, the tale of their ill-fated love spread throughout the two warring factions. No more could they raise blade or claw against one another, knowing that the souls of their kin were so inextricably bound.


400080

(-Iceheart-)In the days that followed, man and dragon learned to live in harmony, and together built a nation unlike any the world had ever known. For two hundred years did this blissful age of peace continue, as it would to this day, had vilest envy not stirred in the hearts of the Elezen.


400090

(-Iceheart-)It is said that wyrms owe their longevity to the boundless reserves of vitality found within their eyes─and 'twas in this belief that a traitorous band of knights deceived their allies of some two centuries, and took by force that which they coveted...


500010

(-Iceheart-)Nidhogg─he who now stands poised to unleash his wyrmlings upon Ishgard─was the great dragon who lost an eye to Elezen treachery.


500020

(-Iceheart-)And until he prises it from the hands of the traitors' progeny, no amount of conciliatory words will stay his fury.


500030

You are wrong, Lady Iceheart.


500040

Lest you misunderstand, I do not doubt your vision of the past─'tis true that Nidhogg greatly desired to reclaim the Eye.


500050

Indeed, it was for that very reason that I kept it with me as I roamed the land, attempting to draw him away from the city.


500060

Good gods...


500070

Until recently, Nidhogg seemed unable to resist its allure, and pursued me relentlessly. Needless to say, that is no longer the case. Now, it would seem he has fixed his attention on Ishgard itself, though he knows full well the Eye does not reside there.


500080

(-Iceheart-)You believe he targets the capital for another reason...?


500090

I believe reason has all but left him. Through the Eye, I feel much of what Nidhogg feels, and the dragon's thirst for vengeance will not be quenched by aught less than a sea of blood.


500100

If Nidhogg is indeed lost to reason, might we not seek an audience with Hraesvelgr instead?


500110

He has thus far shown no inclination to aid in the invasion of Ishgard, and may yet welcome our efforts to broker a peace.


500120

(-Iceheart-)You still believe that a peaceable solution can be found? Very well. I will take you to him.


500130

(-Iceheart-)Our road will lead us to Dravania, the homeland of dragonkind. There we shall ascend unto the clouds, where Hraesvelgr resides...


600010

Is aught amiss, my friend?


600020

I sense the many battles are beginning to take their toll. Rest awhile. And should you lose sight of us─Dravania lies beyond the mountains to the west.


600030

Curious... The vestiges of thy mistress's blessing are not as faint as once they were...


600040

Thy will to succeed grants thee unusual fortitude. But will it be enough...?


700010

Beyond Abalathia's Spine─the great mountain range
that spans the continent of Aldenard from east to west...


700020

Into the deepening shadows of Sohm Al,
where lies the ancient home of dragonkind...


700030

To a land where the soil slithers, and the skies seethe
with sinuous shapes, they came.


800010

Vidofnir!


800020

Ah, 'tis thee, Little One. From above, I did mistake thee for a Gnath. 'Tis well I chanced to look again, or thou wouldst now be ash.


800030

Dear Vidofnir...how I have missed you. Would that I had come sooner...and not out of dire necessity.


800040

Thou art troubled. Speak, that I might know thy plight.


800050

Thou wouldst have Father admonish his brood-brother?


800060

I would end this war without further bloodshed.


800070

How am I to believe thee, Little One...when thine own companion beareth Nidhogg's stolen eye!?


800080

Have care, dragon...or I shall gouge out one of yours.


800090

You forget yourself, ser! We are here on a mission of peace!


800100

My sire's will forbiddeth me from inviting discord to our home... 'Tis for this reason, and no other, that thou still drawest breath, knight.


800110

Vidofnir, please─we must be allowed to convey our intentions to Hraesvelgr in person, with words of our own choosing.


800120

Grant us this favor, and open the way to Sohm Al!


800130

Thou hast ever been welcome, Little One.


800140

...But I cannot grant thy wish. I am bound to remain here, and protect my kin from the Gnath's god.


800150

The Gnath have summoned a primal!?


800160

Pray excuse my forwardness, but if we were to eliminate the threat to your territory, would you consent to Lady Ysayle's request?


800170

Ha! Dost thou imagine thyself equal to the task─to succeed where dragons have failed?


800180

'Tis beyond thee, mortal. But thou art welcome to try, nonetheless. Only know that idle promises shall avail thee naught!


800190

It would seem we have no choice but to make good on Alphinaud's offer. Why must our every bid for peace breed yet more war?


810010

Now we have but to wait...


810020

O Lord Ravana! Master of the Sacred Blades! Wrath of the Colony! Conqueror of the World! Hear our prayer!


810030

Pray grant unto Your devoted children the gift of Your divine presence!


810040

He comes!


810050

All strength to the colony. Speak and I shall listen!


810060

O Glorious General! We have captured intruders, and would make unto You an offering of their life's blood...


810070

These feeble fleshlings dared to invade Gnath lands?


810080

Hear me, Lord Ravana! My companion and I did not come to contest your children's territory.


810090

We wished only to learn the reason you wage war against the dragons.


810100

Thou wouldst flirt with death merely to satisfy thy curiosity? Wherefore should the glorious conquests of the Gnath concern thee so, Elezen?


810110

...Ahhh, mayhap thine own kind's struggle against the wyrms fareth poorly, and thou art desirous of a pact.


810120

We crave no alliance, Lord Ravana─only peace. We would bring an end to our war with the dragons. Yet so long as they remain embroiled in this conflict with your children, our goal shall remain out of reach.


810130

Never before have the Gnath risen up in such numbers, and never yet with you at their head. Why do you lead them to war?


810140

Thy question hath no meaning. To live is but to fight.


810150

Long have my children waited, gathering their strength in the shadow of thy ceaseless conflict.


810160

The Gnath would see the Dravanians slain, and their territory secured─and by such fervent prayers am I now given form and purpose.


810170

As I feared, your very existence is an obstacle to our goal. Since you are so fond of fighting, we challenge you, Lord of the Gnath!


810180

And should we emerge the victors, I would have you swear to withdraw your soldiers from Dravanian soil!


810190

Gahahaha! Thou art bold indeed to risk thy fleshy hide so readily!


810200

Very well. I, Ravana, fourfold master of the blade, do accept thy challenge!


810210

But should I emerge the victor, I would have thee swear to serve in mine army till thy last breath is spent! Do you accept!?


810220

I do! And I believe the first bout is mine!


810230

What is this!? A god clad in flesh!?


810240

Is aught amiss, my lord? Thou wilt not break thy word, I trust.


810250

Mine oath is unbending as steel, little goddess! Thy ruse will but add to mine enjoyment!


810260

I thought myself...stronger... Mayhap with more crystals...?


810270

Be thou god or maid, thou art nothing to me! ...And what of thee, mortal? Art thou warrior or craven?


810280

A warrior, then! Good! Mayhap thou wilt provide more sport than thy feeble companion!


820010

Thus doth the sacred rite of combat proclaim the victor...
I lay my blades at thy feet, child of man...


820020

You do not disappoint, Warrior of Light. Would that I had your skill in battle. ...I do begin to see why so many place their faith in you.


820030

For all his savagery, I do not think Ravana one to break his word. Provided the dragons do not trespass upon Gnath lands, they should have little to fear of the primal's biting blades. We have done well, have we not? Come, let us return to Vidofnir and share these glad tidings.


820040

Once more you achieve the impossible, Bringer of Light... But with every mortal heart that succumbs to fear and fury, another voice is joined to the chorus beseeching divine succor.


820050

At their bidding, warring gods will shake the firmament, and your world will be consumed in the swelling storm of chaos...


900010

To the peak of Sohm Al, at the end of a perilous mountain path...


900020

Whence could be seen a string of pearl-like islands,
floating impossibly atop a sea of clouds.


900030

To a domain where dragons and men had once lived in harmony, whose majesty
no mortal eye had glimpsed for nigh on a thousand years, they came.


A00010

Mortals... Why do you disturb my solitude?


A00020

Hraesvelgr...


A00030

Thou speakest the name of a creature that but awaiteth the release of oblivion. Leave me...


A00031

By the Twelve... Mine ears hear the tongue of dragons, yet the meaning rings clear within my mind... How can that be...?


A00040

Hraesvelgr...do you not remember me? 'Twas I whom you found in Dravania─I who glimpsed the truth.


A00050

The truth about your past, about Shiva─


A00060

Do not speak her name, mortal!


A00070

But speak it I must! I have summoned Shiva's soul from the beyond, and offered myself as her vessel! She has made her heart known to me!


A00080

Foolish girl. Thinkest thou my beloved's spirit hath descended from the heavens!?


A00090

That the secrets of her heart are thine to know!?


A00100

I have surrendered mine to her! Do you not see, my love? I am Shiva reborn!


A00110

Gullible fool... The Light but illuminated the past for thee, it did not grant thee omniscience.


A00120

The spirit thou hast summoned belongeth not to Shiva─'tis but a shade conjured by thine own fancy.


A00130

In an age long past, mine own kin were guilty of like folly. Beguiled by the dark ones' lies, they attempted to resurrect a king amongst wyrms─yet the divinity they called forth merely borrowed the semblance of my fallen brood-brother.


A00140

Such gods are not summoned, but created. Phantoms spun from the threads of misplaced faith.


A00150

Then the spirit that answered me...


A00160

...Was but thy dream of Shiva. Thy soul hath been corrupted by a deity of thine own making, child.


A00170

Be that as it may, Lord Hraesvelgr, Ysayle's desire to heal the rift between man and dragon is real, and it has borne us this far.


A00180

We would spare both our kind and yours the ravages of this senseless war! Pray join your voice to ours in a call for peace and forgiveness!


A00190

The tale of thy kind is one of avarice, treachery, and death─and thou wouldst speak to me of peace?


A00200

Hark thee, mortal, to the naked truth...then tell me thou deservest forgiveness!


B00010

Twelve hundred years ago, my beloved Shiva's sacrifice served to bring an end to the war 'twixt man and dragon, paving the way for an age of peace and cooperation.


B00020

Two centuries of harmony were to follow, during which time the Elezen learned much about us, not least that the eyes of a great wyrm are the wellspring of his strength.


B00030

H00130 You should know, General, that your dear friend Ilberd was fully aware of my plan. H00140 I had him lie about the assassination as a means to prime your rage against Teledji. We weren't entirely sure how you would react, but things went rather better than expected. H00150 You conniving little worm... You had your claws in the Crystal Braves before their first recruit had sworn to serve! H00160 But of course. When a new game begins, 'tis only prudent to have a piece on the board. Ilberd was mine. H00170 Truth be told, a significant proportion of the Braves' initial endowment was also mine. With such large sums moving about, 'twas a rather trifling matter to disguise my own contribution. H00180 Ah, Ilberd... I secured his services with a promise to support his cause once my authority had been solidified. I swear, the man thinks of naught but prising Ala Mhigo from the grasp of the Empire. H00190 Unlike you, General, the poor fellow seems quite unable to forsake the land of his forefathers. Mayhap that's why he called you a traitor to your people and a disgrace to your homeland...amongst other things. What was it he always compared you to? Oh, yes!  An overgrown lapdog, begging for scraps at the sultana's table!  Oh, how we laughed... H00200 Alas, Ilberd's entertaining little outbursts eventually gave way to wearisome tirades, and the zealous brute became rather unruly. I had no wish to see you executed, you understand, but he would not take no for an answer. Rest assured, his employment with me has long since ended. H00210 ...Which brings us neatly to the present. What say you, General? Both you and the sultana are alive; we have one corpse and one fugitive; and preparations have been made to restore your good name. Shall we cry quits and start again with a blank ledger? Hm? H00220 The hells we will! Do you honestly expect me to forgive and forget? After all you've done!? You're guilty of high treason! H00230 Stay your blade, Master Aldynn! You yourself are not innocent! Or have you forgotten your own crime in executing Teledji Adeledji without trial!? H00240 Though you acted out of loyalty to the sultana, such deeds are in violation of both the word and spirit of the law! H00250 ...If you would, Lord Lolorito? H00260 This potion will wake the sultana from her slumber. Consider it a gesture of conciliation. H00270 You will find Her Grace resting comfortably within her private chambers. Should you doubt my word, I shall willingly accompany you to the palace as your hostage. H00280 I like not your motives, Lolorito...but you saved the sultana's life, and for that you have my gratitude. H00290 Raubahn Aldynn, you are hereby reinstated as general of the Immortal Flames! The citizens of Ul'dah shall once more be united under Nanamo Ul Namo, and together we shall usher in a new age of prosperity! I00010 Ugh... I00020 I was having the longest dream... I00030 'Tis time to wake up, Your Grace. Another day begins in Thanalan, and the sun blazes bright upon the sands. J00010 Her Grace is awoken. The palace physician assures me she is none the worse for her slumber. J00020 I believe Her Grace will soon resume her plans to place the government of Ul'dah into the hands of its citizens. J00030 Whatever path she chooses to take, I shall walk it with her. And we shall tread slowly, lest the nation be unsettled in our wake. J00040 Her Grace's compassion is a shining beacon to us all...but what our city truly thrives upon is competition. J00050 'Tis in the struggle against our rivals that opportunities are seized and fortunes made. And with the Empire on the offensive once more, now would hardly seem the time to turn our system of government upon its head. J00060 Are you privy to new intelligence, my lord? J00070 I would hardly call it new. Remind me: what was the name of that enormous imperial warship which met its end in Mor Dhona? Wait, I have it! The Agrius. Yes, well, 'twould appear that the Garleans have been hard at work on another such vessel. J00080 How close are they to completing this ship!? Is it operational!? J00090 Its maiden flight was a success, I hear. I should imagine Emperor Varis is eager to see how it performs in battle. J00100 My lords and ladies, I move that it is time to repair the damage caused by Teledji Adeledji, and prepare our great nation to repel the Empire once more. K00010 'Tis well that the sultana has awoken. The Syndicate yet needs to put its house in order, but 'twould seem the worst of the confusion has passed. K00020 Ul'dah has taken control of its future...and I must do the same. K00030 I have decided to disband the Crystal Braves. K00040 Among the recruits, there were those who supported our order's goals and convictions with all sincerity. 'Tis my hope that these loyal men and women will choose to remain our allies in the battles to come. K00050 As for those who sided with the traitor, Ilberd, they shall be hunted down and held to account for their crimes. It is my earnest hope that they will surrender themselves peaceably when the time comes...though I think it unlikely. K00060 Ah, my all-conquering Crystal Braves... The model army meant to pave the way for a single, unified Grand Company of Eorzea. That so high an ideal should be brought so low... K00070 I need not tell you how deeply the betrayal stung me. Yet I see now that it was mine own naivety and pride which allowed the Braves to fall prey to corruption. K00080 As ever, it is to your own shining example that I turn for inspiration. Like you, I mean to stand firm in the face of hardship, and give mine all for the cause. K00090 Let us resume the search for our missing comrades, that we might come together to shine the light of dawn across the realm once more. K00100 The role of Crystal Brave commander suited me ill, and I shall play it no longer. Henceforth, I shall be no more or less than Alphinaud, proud member of the Scions. L00010 All stands ready, Lord Commander. L00020 Ah, the moment has come, then? L00030 Pray excuse my lateness. I paid a brief visit to the workshop to inquire about the manacutters. The engineers assure me that they are ready. L00040 The Aery is now but a short flight away. Yet what a long and winding path we took to reach this point. L00050 Were it not for Master Alphinaud's proposal, we never would have attempted to parley with the dragons. L00060 Though our negotiations yielded little, our expedition with Lady Iceheart taught us much. L00070 You took an unimaginable risk... I could scarce believe the tale Estinien told. L00080 Aye, 'tis true that many of our countrymen would sooner die than join hands with the heretics' mistress, but 'twas through that most unlikely of alliances that we came to speak with Hraesvelgr. L00090 A conversation that went rather poorly, as I recall. L00100 In this instance, the journey was more important than the destination. Had we not slain Nidhogg's consort, Tioman, and put the great wyrm on his guard, the Dravanians would have arrived at Ishgard's walls long ago. L00110 Aye, that they would. Full grateful am I for every hour of respite your actions have afforded us. Thanks to you, our defenses are much improved. 'Tis but a pity they won't be enough. L00120 Thus you believe an assault upon the Aery represents the city's best chance of survival. Is that not so, Estinien? L00130 I am under no illusions. Nidhogg's might is legendary. But with his eye in my possession, I can stifle his strength at the source. L00140 Victory will be hard-won, even so, and I shall be glad indeed to have the Warrior of Light at my side. L00150 You shall have my blade as well. There are more of these  manacutters  to be had, yes? L00160 (-Lucia-)Lord Commander, no! L00170 How can I, a proud knight of Ishgard, stand by and do naught while an outsider risks life and limb for our homeland? I swore an oath to protect this city! L00180 Pray leave the slaying of dragons to dragoons, ser knight. Your duty to command the city's defense is no less vital. L00190 Should we fail, and Nidhogg slip through our grasp, who, then, will hold the walls against him? Will you leave Ishgard in the hands of the Holy See's zealots? L00200 There are others  L00210 Who but you has the authority and the standing to orchestrate a citywide defense? I do not, and neither does the Warrior of Light. That is why it is our place to fight, and yours to remain here, Lord Commander. L00220 What, you too, Master Alphinaud? By the Fury... You have shown some promise, but this adversary is far beyond your skills. L00230 Your candor is appreciated, ser dragoon. I shall remain, then, and cheer you from afar. L00240 Well, my friend, 'twould seem I have discouraged the last of the volunteers, and claimed the task as ours alone. But if any alive can best this wyrm, 'tis surely we two! M00010 We're through! M00020 So, this is the Aery! Where are you Nidhogg!? You have guests! M00030 There! M00040 Greetings, Lord of Dravania! I believe we have something that belongs to you! M00050 Wicked mortals! I shall melt your flesh, and turn your bones to ash! N00010 Thou wouldst use mine own eye against me!? Time hath done naught to dilute thy kind's depravity! N00020 I have not forgotten thee, dragoon! Mine essence claimed thee once...and shall do so again! N00030 No, wyrm! This ends here! N00040 You gifted my people a thousand years of suffering. Now I gift you an eternity in darkness! O00010 They are ours, Lord Haldrath... The eyes of Nidhogg! O00020 Aye... The wyrm lies broken and my father is avenged. With the wellspring of his vitality thus denied him, Nidhogg shall not linger long in this world. O00030 But behold the terrible price we have paid. My sire is dead; so many brother knights slain. O00040 We traded our honor for the strength which now courses in our veins. And still we are forced to make such sacrifice. O00050 But not in vain, my lord. Hraesvelgr is the only great wyrm left in Dravania, and he dares not leave his lair. O00060 With Nidhogg's eyes in your possession, who now can challenge the might of Ishgard? Ascend the throne, and take your rightful place as the ruler of our people! O00070 Nay, my friend, I must forsake the mantle of king. Though Nidhogg be defeated, his wyrmling horde yet darkens the skies with wings beyond counting. O00080 As one who partook of Ratatoskr's strength, it shall be my penance to bear a knight's arms until death grants me leave to retire. When that day comes, no prince shall perish, but a hells-bound hunter of dragons... O00090 But Lord Haldrath! What then shall become of the royal line!? O00100 Think of your people, my lord! Without a king, who will the common man turn to in his hour of need? How will he find his way without your benevolent hand to guide him? O00110 I thank you, Ser Flavien and Ser Sylvetrel for dispelling my remaining doubts. With men of such wisdom and compassion in service to the realm, 'tis plain that Ishgard has no need of a king. O00120 But if you must bow to the demands of tradition, you need look no further than yourselves for one worthy to wear the crown. O00130 Fare thee well, my brother knights...my loyal friends. On these shoulders shall I bear the weight of my father's sins; with this lance shall I repay the debt accrued through our misdeeds. O00140 What cruel jest has fate played upon us...? Have we seized this desperate victory only to lose a king? O00150 We can but act as our lord has bid. We few who remain must divide between us the rulership of Ishgard and her people. O00160 Not I. My oath was to Lord Haldrath, and he alone. If he is not to be king, then I would hang up my shield, as well. O00170 Will you abandon us, too, ser? O00180 I would wash my hands of blood and betrayal and take up an honest trade. Mayhap I shall serve ale instead of sharpened steel... O00190 We four, then... O00200 Fortemps, Haillenarte, Durendaire, and Dzemael... O00210 But four houses to rule all of Ishgard... O00220 ...And what of the throne? O00230 We keep it empty. Until the day a king rises once more, we must assume the role of stewards. O00240 We shall shape our nation anew with a history of our own making and let the truth of this dark day die here, upon the battlefield. P00010 What ails you, friend!? Are you wounded? P00020 You have borne witness to history...to the culmination of the first battle with Nidhogg. P00030 The legend of Ishgard's founding tells that our ancestors were led to the land of Coerthas by the valiant King Thordan. P00040 In the midst of their journey, they came to a wide chasm, where they were set upon by a great wyrm Nidhogg. A furious battle then ensued, with Thordan leading the van. P00050 Though the brave king was slain defending his people, his son, Haldrath, the first Azure Dragoon, fought on undaunted... P00060 And with a mighty thrust of his lance, he gouged out Nidhogg's eye, forcing the wicked creature into retreat. P00070 Thus did this eldritch orb become a sacred treasure of Ishgard, lending its power to every knight deemed worthy to bear the title of Azure Dragoon. P00080 A rousing tale, is it not? Would that I could still believe it. But your vision, which we must accept as immutable truth, leaves no room for doubt save on one point. P00090 If Haldrath took both of Nidhogg's eyes, then how came this eye to be lodged in the wyrm's skull? P00100 Beneath every answer we unearth, another question lies buried... Q00010 'Twas a fierce battle, but one I knew we would win. Your fame is well deserved, Warrior of Light. Full proud am I to have fought at your side. Q00020 I would fain return with all swiftness to Ishgard to inform the lord commander of our triumph... Q00030 But we must first have words with Hraesvelgr. There are parts of this tale that the wyrm has kept from us, and I would know wherefore... R00010 Impenitent mortals, ever seeking to bury old wrongs under new. R00020 I did sense the moment of Nidhogg's demise... R00030 You mean the moment I prised your eye from his head? R00040 'Twould seem thou hast uncovered my secret. Aye. Unto the blinded Nidhogg did I yield one half of my strength... S00010 Nidhogg... What hath befallen thee? S00020 We are undone by covetous mortals. They did take Ratatoskr's eyes...and glut their appetites upon her essence... S00030 She is slain, then? What madness hath unmade our peaceful accord!? S00040 Did I not warn thee, brood-brother? They have ever been untrustworthy creatures, these short-lived Elezen. S00050 But thou wert enchanted by thy mortal maid. Thy folly hath cost Ratatoskr her life, and me mine eyes... S00060 Oh, my beloved Shiva... How swiftly are thy kin made bestial by their appetites. S00070 Hraesvelgr. 'Twas thy blindness that did invite disaster into our lands. Surrender thee an eye to me, and let that be thy penance. S00080 Nidhogg... S00090 They bested me once, but I was reckless. I shall need but a single eye to inflict enduring torment upon these traitors and every child of their line! S00100 Yield to me thy strength, brood-brother! S00110 My vengeance is begun! T00010 Thou hast borne witness to a scene from my past. T00020 It was yours... Your strength that sustained Nidhogg all these years... T00030 Would that Haldrath had dealt the wyrm a killing blow... T00040 When my brood-brother did appear before me, bloody and blinded, his life was all but spent. He demanded half my vigor, that he might exact his revenge upon the mortals who had wronged us. T00050 And so you acquiesced! You surrendered your eye to Nidhogg knowing full well the suffering he would inflict! T00060 The peace my beloved so dearly desired had been shattered by her own kin. T00070 Their treachery claimed my brood-sister's life and my brood-brother's reason! Thinkest thou thy fits of indignation will move me to remorse!? T00080 Go, mortals! Take your unruly passions and leave this place... Your presence here spelleth naught but misery. T00090 Were it not for Shiva's soothing embrace, I would slay you where you stand. Woe betide you should the bond we share ever weaken! U00010 'Twas my life's goal to slay Nidhogg, but I find there is little joy to be had in its accomplishment. U00020 But you have rid the world of a hate-filled creature, and ended a bloody war in so doing... U00030 I lost my family to Nidhogg's flames. And 'twas with fury in my heart that I took up the lance. Every blow I struck, I struck in the name of vengeance. We were not so different, he and I. U00040 I will not judge you for your deeds I have not the right. Too many innocents have perished in the name of my  greater good.  U00050 Yet even with all that has passed, the tale is incomplete. U00060 We are short a great wyrm's eye. Of the pair which Haldrath took from Nidhogg, only one is known to us the one I bear. What, then, became of the other? U00070 Why did Nidhogg, who had taken such pains to prolong the Dragonsong War, suddenly decide to hurl his entire army against the walls of Ishgard? U00080 Lord Commander... Aye, the deed is done. Nidhogg is slain. U00090 What? ...In the city!? A battle with whom!? U00100 At once, Lord Commander. Hold firm till our return. U00110 Fighting has broken out in the city. Lord Aymeric was sparse with the particulars, but it seems some commoners threw open the gates to a force of heretics. U00120 I gave no order to attack! U00130 Are we to mark the end of the Dragonsong War by spilling the blood of our own? Mayhap Hraesvelgr was right about us... U00140 Let us away, Warrior of Light. The people must be saved from themselves. U00150 Wait! I would join you! U00160 There has been enough violence. I will appeal to my people in the city and make them see reason! U00170 Come, then, Lady Iceheart. Let us write the final chapter in this damnable war. V00010 A small army of heretics has invaded the city, Your Eminence. V00020 But there is no cause for concern. A sizable contingent of our soldiers is already in place to repel the Dravanian assault, and the intruders will soon find themselves outnumbered and outmatched. V00030 Our plans proceed apace, then. V00040 Yes, Your Eminence. This unrest shall serve to feed the people's fear of the heretics and the dragons both. V00050 And lend renewed fervor to their prayers for deliverance... V00060 Very good. Grant our guests what time they need to sow a measure of chaos, then order the Temple Knights to crush them. V00070 Your will be done. V00080 The moment is at hand? V00090 Excellent. All shall soon be in alignment. V00100 It is time for the Bringer of Light to die.

name: 3.0 Heavensward Cutscenes [VoiceMan_03004]
text_html:
000020

Comrades! Sheathe your swords! There is no need for further bloodshed!


000030

My lady!?


000040

She is come!


000050

Hear me, brothers and sisters! The war is ended! Nidhogg is no more!


000060

Aye, it is so! This adventurer and the Azure Dragoon laid the great wyrm low!


000070

The endless cycle of violence between man and dragon was born of our forefathers' treachery.


000080

You have followed me─bled with me─to bring this truth to light, that we might all know peace!


000090

But Nidhogg is dead─Nidhogg is dead, my friends! He who bore such hatred towards Ishgard is dead!


000100

Let his hatred die with him, I say! Let us sheathe our swords and go in peace!


000110

Have we lost!?


000120

No, my friend, far from it! At long last, the peace for which we have so desperately fought is within our grasp! And I for one would not forsake it!


000130

Peace...?


000140

Seize the witch! Let none escape!


000150

Providing aid and succor to the wounded should be our first concern.


000160

If the heretics mean to observe the peace, then it would be folly not to do the same!


100010

Praise Halone, you are safe!


100020

My safety was never in doubt, Father, for I had the Azure Dragoon and the Warrior of Light by my side.


100030

We bring the most wonderful tidings!


100040

The infamous Lady Iceheart, here in Ishgard? This is most unexpected...


100050

She has done much to quell the violence. The inquisition may not approve, but we are glad of her presence.


100060

And with the great wyrm's demise, even our nation's more reactionary elements will have scant grounds to press for her immediate impeachment.


100070

My thoughts exactly.


100080

What of the truth revealed to us by Hraesvelgr? That the origins of the Dragonsong War─a core tenet of Ishgardian faith─are quite unlike those depicted in the scriptures.


100090

...That men and dragons once lived together in harmony, and that it was man's treachery which shattered the peace and plunged our peoples into war.


100100

The same scripture also describes the origins of the High Houses. Were it exposed as false, the legitimacy of our rule would be called into question.


100110

If both highborn and lowborn can trace their ancestry to Thordan and his knights twelve...


100120

But a single sip of dragon's blood is required to confirm their lineage.


100130

If the Holy See knew of this and chose to remain silent, their crimes are grievous indeed. Regardless, this state of affairs cannot be allowed to continue.


100140

Ser Aymeric! You cannot mean to raise this matter with the archbishop!?


100150

Pray consider what you are proposing! If the Holy See chose to conceal the truth for centuries, what reason would they have to reveal it now!?


100160

At best, you will be branded a heretic and clapped in irons!


100170

Then, at least, the archbishop will have shown his true colors. My friends, this war will never truly be at an end until the truth is made known.


100180

You must see what lies on the horizon if it is not. When ruled by fear of a common enemy, we were united.


100190

But now we have none. During the war, the highborn needed men to lead, and the lowborn, men to follow. Not anymore. 'Tis but a matter of time before the old order is called into question.


100200

Lady Iceheart will share the truth with her followers, and the Holy See will be powerless to stop its spread. The disenfranchised will rise up, united, and blood will flow in the streets once more...


100210

A divided Ishgard will not survive.


100220

Tread carefully, Lord Commander...


200010

My lady, is it wise to let him go?


200020

I sympathize with the lord commander's desire for reform, but to approach the archbishop in this manner bespeaks an idealism to which I did not think Ser Aymeric prone.


200030

Though he comports himself as a realist, he has long dreamt of reform. 'Twas that idealism which first drew me to him─that which made me swear an oath to serve.


200040

We must not think of ways to hinder his cause, but rather ways to aid it─even should the Holy See cry heresy.


200050

You cannot mean...


200060

If the lord commander does not return from the Vault at the appointed hour, I mean to go and fetch him.


200070

Have care, my lady─your words border on treason! Should they reach the wrong ears, you would be declared an enemy of Ishgard!


200080

That is a risk I am willing to take. Lest you forget, my lord─I am not born of this land. My loyalty is to the lord commander alone.


200090

But I speak only of what may come to pass. If the rumors regarding his heritage are to be believed, we have naught to fear.


200100

Hmph. Lies and slander.


200110

Forgive me─what rumors are these?


200120

That Ser Aymeric is the archbishop's bastard son.


200130

Senior clergy are not permitted to marry and sire children. But even the holiest among us are not immune to temptation.


200140

I labor to believe it... Ser Aymeric is truly the archbishop's son?


200150

He has never been publicly acknowledged as such, but the rumors have plagued him since childhood.


200160

That he rose to his current position, despite being despised as a bastard, and accused of profiting from his father's influence, bespeaks the quality of his character.


200170

It is my hope that on this occasion, the burden of his birth will work in his favor. Should our worst fears be realized, the archbishop will not be so quick to execute his own flesh and blood, affording us time to mount a rescue.


200180

Bastard or trueborn, he is our nation's best hope. If the Holy See dares to threaten him, I shall lead the charge against the Vault myself.


200190

Hear, hear! The future of Ishgard rests on Ser Aymeric's shoulders! I too will do mine utmost to aid his cause!


200200

Haurchefant, be reasonable...


200210

A knight lives to serve, Father─to aid those in need! The people need Ser Aymeric─more than ever─and we may be his only hope!


200220

There is no greater calling for a knight than to save the life of his fellow man. I swear to you, on the sigil of our house, that I shall do this and make you proud.


200230

Even you? Romantic, reckless fools, the lot of you. So be it─make your preparations.


200240

I thank you all for your support.


300010

Where d'you think you're goin', missy?


300020

I-I-I'm sorry, I didn't mean to offend!


300030

What's going on here!?


300040

What's it to you, boy!? Piss off!


300050

Hold on! I've seen them around. They're in and out of House Fortemps's manor all the time.


300060

Ohhh, I see. Skulkin' about at your highborn masters' biddin', eh? Bloodhounds hopin' to catch a whiff of heresy, is that it?


300070

You are quite mistaken, I assure you. We came here to help. And if you know what's good for you, you will let us pass!


300080

Haha! Listen to the pup's yappin'! Come here, boy─I'll give you cause to yelp!


300090

(-???-)Enough! Leave threatenin' women and children to our “betters”! We don't have the knack!


300100

Hilda!?


300110

Lay a finger on the blue bloods' pups and you're like to lose the hand.


300120

It ain't often I get called on by glorious heroes like yourself. So tell me: what have I done to deserve you?


400010

...So while you were on your way to kill Nidhogg, you stumbled on some dirty secrets that the Holy See has been hidin' for centuries.


400020

Eh? What are they on about?


400030

The High Houses, and what makes a nobleman so bleedin' noble. They trace their blood back to King Thordan and his knights twelve─the founders of Ishgard.


400040

But our friends here reckon we're all descended from the heroes of eld─highborn and lowborn alike.


400050

And so Ser Aymeric, lord commander of the Temple Knights, has gone to ask the archbishop if he wouldn't mind lettin' everyone know.


400060

Is he simple!? The old bastard'll have him executed for heresy!


400070

Well, seems to me that's what the good ser wants. Seems he thinks a noble sacrifice will serve to prove his claims.


400080

We cannot stand idly by and allow Ser Aymeric to do this. Ishgard has need of him.


400090

Look, you've a good heart. I can see that. Willin' to risk your neck for someone else, even when his troubles ain't yours. But what's this got to do with me?


400100

If Ser Aymeric is imprisoned in the Vault, we will need all the help we can muster to breach their defenses and rescue him.


400110

What in the hells─!?


400120

Ahhh, the unmistakable scent of heresy...


400130

And what do we have here? The honored guests of House Fortemps consorting with the queen of rats?


400140

Oooh. Plotting insurrection I shouldn't wonder! Tsk-tsk. That won't do.


400150

Sickness is wont to fester and spread. It must be burned out ere the infection takes hold.


400160

I reckon ser'd be happy to wield the irons himself. Well, so happens I've got irons of my own.


400170

Ahahaha! Such simple creatures, rats. Certain to attack when cornered.


400180

Let us step outside, milady. In here, your toys could hurt someone.


500010

There's no denying your gifts... A well-deserved reputation indeed.


500020

Enough!


500030

Hmph.


500040

Gah! Lucky bastard.


500050

Nay...'tis we who are lucky. Had we fought on, 'twas but a matter of time before our conflict claimed the life of an innocent bystander.


500060

I thought the Heavens' Ward might come here as well.


500070

They came to the Temple Knights' headquarters?


500080

Aye. Ser Grinnaux announced that the lord commander had been imprisoned under suspicion of heresy, and that the Heavens' Ward had been granted full authority in his stead.


500090

Then the Heavens' Ward now commands the Temple Knights...


500100

Those still loyal to Ser Aymeric answer to me. Alas, that amounts to but half our number.


500110

The other half, who opposed his promotion to lord commander, have gathered at the Vault as ordered.


500120

Bolsterin' the guard already, eh? If I didn't know any better, I'd say you're expected.


500130

I take it you're in charge around here?


500140

Hilda, and yes. The young master was just persuadin' me to join his lost cause. Convincin' little beggar, isn't he?


500150

Aye, your passion moved me─a bit. That, and the fact that we're sick of livin' off the leavin's of our “betters.”


500160

If you've a mind to change things around here, then we've a mind to join you!


600010

Our power... How can this be!?


600020

Fall back!


600030

Father, please!


600041

For a mercy, we were not too late.


600050

Why must you do this, Father!?


600060

Nidhogg is fallen! There is no need for further deception! Now is the time to renounce the lies which led us down this path─to start anew!


600070

And tear down the very pillars of our society─our history, our values─everything we have built over a thousand years? A fool to the last.


600080

Look out!


600090

Go. Azys Lla awaits.


600100

Lord Haurchefant!


600105

It's no good... The wound is too deep. It refuses to mend...


600110

You...you are unharmed? F-Forgive me... I could not bear the thought of...of...


600120

Oh, do not look at me so.


600121

A smile better suits a hero...


700010

Don't. Please.


700020

A knight lives to serve. To protect. To sacrifice. There is no greater calling.


700030

Leave me to mourn, and give chase. For my son, and for the nation he loved. Go.


700040

...His sacrifice shall not be forgotten.


700050

My son...


800010

My friends. I am in your debt.


800020

Think nothing of it. Your wounds are healing well, I trust?


800030

Some wounds do not heal...


900010

The founding, the scriptures─a thousand years of lies─all to deceive the common man!


900020

Nay, our own brothers and sisters─for the blood of the knights twelve flows within all our veins! You knew this to be true. You knew and you concealed it!


900030

I should be interested to hear how you came by this knowledge. But yes, you have the right of it.


A00010

The architects of Ishgard, King Thordan and his knights twelve, entrapped and butchered the great wyrm Ratatoskr, that they might partake of her eyes, and thereby transcend their mortal limits.


A00020

Upon learning of their treachery, Nidhogg was consumed with a murderous─and justified─rage. I daresay you know what followed...


A00030

The great wyrm slew the king and half of his knights.


A00040

Aye...but Nidhogg was subdued, and his eyes plucked from their sockets by the knights that remained.


A00050

Their one mistake was to show mercy, for from his brother Hraesvelgr did Nidhogg receive a new eye, thus rejuvenating his form and empowering him to embark upon an eternal quest for vengeance.


A00060

...Whilst Thordan's son Haldrath took one of Nidhogg's eyes and learned to wield its power in defense of his people...


A00070

Thus was the first Azure Dragoon born. And ever since that time, his honored successors have risen to drive Nidhogg from our lands whenever the wyrm has returned to plague us.


B00010

I ask you, my son: will you answer for my sins? Will your son and his son answer for me as well?


B00020

What do you mean?


B00030

If a man cannot atone for his sins in the course of his all-too-fleeting life, must his progeny then be held to account? Must every subsequent generation be judged as well?


B00040

Thordan's betrayal of Ratatoskr was an unconscionable, unforgivable sin.


B00050

Should we, then, as his descendants, meekly surrender ourselves to an eternity of punishment?


B00060

Nay, say I. I would not see our children sacrificed in a vain attempt to appease an implacable foe.


B00070

Dragons are not like us, my son. To they who live forever, the wrongs of antiquity are as those of yesterday. No reparations shall ever suffice.


B00080

This fact alone should serve as ample justification for our actions, yet some refuse to see it as such. For men like you, who yearn to commit themselves to a nobler cause, a more compelling narrative is required.


B00090

This is your solution!? This is how you protect our people?


B00100

You have given us a lost cause! A death sentence! With your compelling narrative, you but doom our countrymen to give their lives for a lie!


B00110

And they do so gladly. Highborn and lowborn alike are proud to serve─to fight and die for their country.


B00120

And what would you say to them?


B00130

What would you tell the wives who have lost their husbands, the mothers who have lost their sons? ...That their loved ones died for naught?


B00140

I...


B00150

Over the course of a thousand years, countless men have donned these robes, and every one of them came to accept the necessity of this solution. Once, I hoped you might come to accept it as well.


B00160

Do not despair, my son. Soon I shall free us from the sins of antiquity...


B00170

...And bring about the change you so fervently desire.


B00180

If he has spoken with others, I would have their names. Escort him to a cell and question him─thoroughly.


B00190

Your Eminence.


C00010

You saw something, did you not? A vision of the past?


C00020

So this is the power of the Echo. Would that it had shown you a finer moment from my past.


C00030

'Twas an exercise in futility, as you saw. Faced with the firmity of his conviction, and his many ready rejoinders, my words deserted me. To be frank, I am embarrassed to recall it.


C00040

A friend once impressed upon me the importance of differentiating between words, deeds, and beliefs. Were he here, I suspect he would judge your father's “conviction” to be no more than rank, self-serving delusion.


C00050

Even so, I cannot help but wonder what manner of “change” he intends to bring about.


C00060

I have given some thought to that as well.


C00070

During the battle within the Vault, the Heavens' Ward demonstrated strange and unnatural abilities.


C00080

Aye, the manner in which Ser Zephirin struck down Lord Haurchefant was unlike anything I've ever seen before.


C00090

The spectacle called to mind King Thordan and his knights twelve as they are depicted in scripture─holy powers and all...


C00100

Mere fabrications...which have become objects of faith...instilled with the belief of countless devoted souls...


C00110

Seven hells!


C00120

If Lady Iceheart can use her own body as a vessel for summoning, I see no reason why others could not...


C00130

Are the Heavens' Ward truly so reckless?


C00140

Unbelievable.


C00150

As they fled, my father spoke of Azys Lla.


C00160

Though I know not what he intends, I fear no good shall come of it. His ambitions are too great, and his minions too powerful...


C00170

We must find the Heavens' Ward, and stop my father, before it is too late.

name: Small Talk
text_html:
TALK

Well met! I've been dispatched by the Adventurers' Guild to recruit volunteers for special small-scale operations known as guildhests. You look to be of sound mind and body. Might you consider joining?


SELECT

What would you like to do?
Participate in a guildhest.
Learn more about guildhests.
Nothing.


NOT

Well met! I've been dispatched by the Adventurers' Guild to recruit volunteers for special small-scale operations known as guildhests.
These operations will pit those volunteers against deadly foes, and the odds won't always be in their favor. This is why we require all participants to be of sound mind and body─something that you do not yet appear to be.


SELECT

Select an operation.
Seek & Destroy.
Sprint & Obey.
Shield & Sweep.
Under the Armor.
Pulling Poison Posies.
Stinging Back.
Down the Black Rabbit Hole.
Flicking Sticks and Taking Names.
All's Well that Ends in the Well.
Nothing.


START

Commence the operation?
Yes
Not yet


INFO

To participate in the operation “Under the Armor,” you must be in a party of four Disciples of War or Magic with a level of 20 or higher.
To participate in the operation “Pulling Poison Posies,” you must be in a party of four Disciples of War or Magic with a level of 20 or higher.
To participate in the operation “Stinging Back,” you must be in a party of eight Disciples of War or Magic with a level of 20 or higher.
To participate in the operation “Down the Black Rabbit Hole,” you must be in a party of four Disciples of War or Magic with a level of 25 or higher.
To participate in the operation “Flicking Sticks and Taking Names,” you must be in a party of four Disciples of War or Magic with a level of 25 or higher.
To participate in the operation “All's Well that Ends in the Well,” you must be in a party of eight Disciples of War or Magic with a level of 25 or higher.


BEHEST

Guildhests are similar to guildleves in that clients in need of assistance petition the Adventurers' Guild to find them volunteers. Adventurers are then summoned at the guild's behest to undertake these tasks. The difference is that while guildleves can be accepted by individuals, guildhest operations will often require parties of four to eight persons.
Beyond that, the rules are simple. Finish the guildhest objectives before time expires, and you and your companions will be promptly rewarded for services rendered. Drag your feet, though, and you won't see a single coin.
If it is your first time tackling an operation, you will also be provided with a bonus upon completion.
Finally, proving yourself on the field will unlock more high-profile tasks. Other battlewardens stationed throughout the Twelveswood may also provide you with similar work, but only if you are deemed capable.


ERROR

You were unable to commence the operation “.”


HOWTO

Wait... Might this be your first time participating in a guildhest? I remember my first hest. It was the night of my twentieth nameday. My fellow guildmates invited me to join them in the slaying of a family of peistes who were stealing chocobo eggs from Bentbranch Meadows.
The moment we arrived, one of the terrible beasts immediately turned to me and charged. The thing was thrice my size and had already maimed several chocobokeeps.
There was no way I could win, so I simply froze and waited for the end. But that's when I remembered that I was not alone. My friends rallied around me, and together we defeated the peistes! That, my friend, is what a guildhest is truly about.

text_html:
FIRST

I represent the interests of the nations in educating adventurers on the technologies available for strengthening the bonds between them.
To that end, I would like to introduce to you the “linkshell.”
A linkshell enables you to communicate with others over any distance, as if they were before your very eyes!
You may have as many as eight linkshells open at any given time, allowing you to communicate simultaneously with any number of people. The only time your physical presence is required is...well, never!
Would you care to give it a try? I can create a personal linkshell for you now, if you like.


MAIN

Would you like to learn more about linkshells? Or are you perhaps interested in creating your own?


MAINMENU

What would you like to do?
Hear a basic explanation of linkshells.
Learn more about using linkshells.
Create, rename, or disband a linkshell.
Nothing.


GUIDEMENU

What would you like to learn more about?
What will you ask?
How do I create a linkshell?
How do I invite others to join my linkshell?
How do I join a linkshell?
How do I communicate using a linkshell?
Who are linkshell leaders and masters?
How do I quit a linkshell?
How do I disband a linkshell?
Nothing.


PROCEDUREMENU

Excellent! Shall I create a new linkshell for you? Or do you wish to make changes to an existing one?
What would you like to do?
Create a linkshell.
Rename a linkshell.
Promote a member to linkshell master.
Disband a linkshell.
Nothing.


FIRST

A linkshell enables you to communicate with others over any distance, as if they were before your very eyes!
You may have as many as eight linkshells open at any given time, allowing you to communicate simultaneously with any number of people.
The only time your physical presence is required is...well, never!
Would you care to give it a try? I can create a personal linkshell for you now, if you like.
Textless.
Textless.


MAKE

If you wish to create a linkshell, you need only speak with a linkshell distributor like myself and register the name you desire.
Should your registration be approved, your linkshell will be created and you will be designated its master.
As linkshell master, you can invite and remove other adventurers from your linkshell at will.
Textless
Textless


ADD

If you are a master or a leader, you can invite other adventurers to join your linkshell at will.
Only linkshell leaders and masters have the authority to invite other players.
To invite a player to join a linkshell, target him and select the name of that linkshell from the subcommand menu.
You can also invite players by selecting their names in the social interface and choosing a linkshell from the subcommand menu.
If he accepts your invitation, he will immediately become a member of your linkshell!


ENTER

In order to join a linkshell, you must receive an invitation from that linkshell's master or one of its leaders.
If you choose to accept the invitation, you will become a member of the linkshell.
When you receive an invitation to join a linkshell, you will be given the chance to view a list of its members.
However, until you select Accept Linkshell Invite, you will not be able to send or receive messages through that linkshell.


CHAT

Conversing with others over linkshell is as easy as speaking with them in person.
To send messages to members of a certain linkshell, select the speech bubble icon situated by the chat log, followed by the linkshell to designate it as the default chat mode.
You can also change the default chat mode by selecting Linkshells under Social from the main menu, selecting a linkshell, and choosing Open Communication from the subcommand menu.


LEADER

The linkshell master has the authority to invite and remove members, as well as rename and disband the linkshell.
The linkshell master can also designate other members as linkshell leaders, bestowing upon them the authority to invite and remove members.
While the powers possessed by leaders and masters are similar, true authority still belongs to the linkshell master.


LEAVE

If you wish to withdraw from a linkshell, you may do so at any time.
You can quit a linkshell by selecting Linkshells under Social from the main menu, selecting a linkshell, and choosing Quit Linkshell from the subcommand menu.
Please note, however, that the linkshell master cannot resign without transferring his or her authority to another member.
You can transfer authority by selecting Linkshells under Social from the main menu, selecting a linkshell, selecting a player, and choosing Promote to Linkshell Master from the subcommand menu.
In the event that you are the only member in the linkshell, you must instead disband your linkshell by speaking with a linkshell distributor.


BREAK

If you wish to disband a linkshell, you must speak with a linkshell distributor like myself. We will need to notify the other members so as to prevent confusion.


MAKE

One personal linkshell, coming right up! What name would you like to register?
It appears you are already a member of eight different linkshells. For your own safety, I cannot permit you to create another─the cacophony of voices constantly reverberating in your head would place undue stress upon your mental faculties.
Congratulations! You are now the proud owner of your very own linkshell.


NAMECHANGE

I see. Which linkshell do you wish to rename?
I'm afraid that a linkshell can only be renamed by its master. Our records indicate that you are not she.
It is done. I have altered your linkshell as per your request.


BREAK

These things happen. Which linkshell would you like to do away with?
I'm afraid that a linkshell can only be disbanded by its master. Our records indicate that you are not she.
Very well. I confess, I die a little inside every time I disband one of these.


00005

Select a name for your linkshell.
Names must be between 3 and 20 letters or numbers. The following punctuation marks are also allowed:
' . , : ; ! ? & - _
• Double spaces/underscores are not allowed.
• A space cannot be used before or after the name.
• Names consisting solely of punctuation marks are prohibited.
Name
Set name as “UNKNOWN”?
Yes
No
You are about to disband UNKNOWN. All members will be notified. You will not be able to restore this linkshell once it has been disbanded. Are you certain you wish to proceed?
Disband linkshell.
Yes
No

Return.

name: Small Talk
text_html:
LETTERMOOGLE

Well, if it isn't our favorite delivery Hyur! No new letters for you today, kupo!
There's a smile made of sunshine! I can deny you nothing─except new letters. There are none, kupo.
While I'd love nothing more than to deliver a letter to my proud protégé, I fear there is nothing for you today, kupo.
Why, hello! UNKNOWN, was it? I'm afraid I don't have any letters for you today. If I did, of course, I'd deliver them to you with speed and gusto!
Look what we have here! A new letter has arrived just for you, kupo!
Look what we have here! A new letter has arrived for our favorite assistant.
Our loyal assistant is rewarded for her persistence! A new letter has arrived for you, kupo.
Kupo-ho-ho! I'm pleased to say that I have a new letter for you, my most proficient pupil!
Let me see now... Why, yes! I do have a new letter addressed to UNKNOWN. Isn't today your lucky day, kupo?
Your mailbox is filling up fast! You should do something about it quick, or I won't be able to fit in any more letters, kupo!
Your mailbox is filling up fast! You should do something about it quick, or I won't be able to fit in any more letters! I would have expected our favorite assistant to be more organized, kupo!
Your mailbox is filling up fast! I won't be able to fit in any more letters unless you do something, kupo! And then where will you be?
A consummate carrier like yourself letting her mailbox go unattended? This simply won't do, kupo! Do some cleaning, and with haste, lest there be no room for new deliveries!
Your mailbox is filling up fast! You should do something about it quick, or I won't be able to fit in any more letters!
Your mailbox is a complete and utter mess! There wasn't any room left, so I had to send back a letter, kupo!
Your mailbox is a complete and utter mess! There wasn't any room left, so I had to send back a letter, kupo! Perhaps you've been spending too much time delivering others' letters and not enough attending to your own?
Your mailbox is a complete and utter mess! There wasn't any room left, so I had to send back a letter, kupo! The phrontists say that a letter carrier with an unkempt mailbox is like a barber with an unbled cousin...
Your mailbox is a complete and utter mess! There wasn't any room left, so I had to send back a letter, kupo! To see my prized pupil be so careless─why, it brings a tear to my eye...
Your mailbox is filling up fast! You should do something about it quick, or I won't be able to fit in any more letters, kupo!
Greetings, tall one! I'm a delivery moogle, kupo!
Oh, I know what you're thinking. “Moogles are supposed to hide in trees and avoid contact with outsiders! Whyever would they agree to carry about letters?”
"Why" indeed! If I had my way, I'd be curled up under the canopy of a nice oak dreaming about some beautiful mooglette with a rainbow-colored pom-pom, kupo!
But no, the moon had to go and drop from the sky, causing all of that terrible commotion! Aetherytes were shattered and linkpearls rendered useless. For moons, the poor, wingless people of Eorzea had no way of communicating with each other...beyond screaming at the top of their lungs, which no one really approved of, kupo.
That is, until the little horned ones asked us to assist them by delivering messages. At first we were wary of showing ourselves, worried that one of you might catch and skin us, like you do every other forest furry. But once we saw how much we were appreciated, we knew we'd found our new calling!
And I personally promise to try and not read any along the way, kupo!
Greetings and salutations! Wondering why I'm wearing this funny hat and toting around this oversized bag, kupo? Well, it just so happens that I had a dream the other night. A dream of moogles like me who spent their days delivering letters to travelers like you.
I thought, I could do that─so here I am! Should Feo Ul happen to receive any missives or epistles for you from beyond, I'll ensure that they safely find their way into your hands, kupo.
Your speedy and accurate deliveries have earned you carrier level one, kupo! And yet, a delivery moogle's work is never done. Should you see the deputy postmoogle outside Limsa Lominsa's Bulwark Hall, that's your sign that we have another job for you!
Your unflagging dedication to letter delivery has earned you carrier level one, kupo! I'm not certain what that means, I'm afraid, but Feo Ul insisted that I pass on the word. They also mentioned that if you're looking for more work, you should speak to the moogle who looks like me, but lives by the sea beyond.
Your postal prowess has earned you carrier level one, kupo! A letter carrier's heart is a restless one, always thinking of the next job. If the deputy postmoogle has another letter for you, he'll be outside Limsa Lominsa's Bulwark Hall. Run to him, kupo. Run, don't walk!
I must convey my congratulations again! Where once stood a rank amateur, now stands a veritable maestro of mail carrying, kupo. The countless postmoogles you have inspired are carrying your torch well. We may call upon you again, but until that day─stay safe in your adventures!
Feo Ul was saying that the delivery moogles from “beyond”─wherever that is, kupo─have high hopes for you! I wonder if they have high hopes for me, too?
Every day, I train and toil that I might one day be as peerlessly proficient at my profession as the postmoogle I met in my dreams, kupo!

name: Tataru
text_html:
Tataru Taru
Scion of the Seventh Dawn Coinkeeper

Though publicly known as the organization's receptionist, Tataru also serves as the Scions' coinkeeper─a role she executes with an enthusiastic cunning that borders on the terrifying.

Born to Ul'dahn merchants, the young Tataru had everything a Lalafell could ask for─until her family lost it all to bankruptcy. Plagued by debt and still smarting from this abrupt introduction to the harsh realities of the sultanate, she apprenticed herself to a lapidary at the age of twelve, and henceforth supported the household with her meager earnings. It was during this period that she met Minfilia─a miner come to sell gems and ore─who would later recruit Tataru to oversee the Path of the Twelve's finances.

Tataru, in turn, resolved to use her newfound position not only to accrue personal wealth, but also to serve others. Indeed, when the Path of the Twelve relocated to the Waking Sands, and her role was expanded to include secretarial duties, she used her considerable social acumen to build relationships and increase its influence. As the organization slowly but surely grew into an association of like-minded and gifted souls, she was instrumental in seeking out potential members blessed with the Echo.

After the Seventh Umbral Calamity, when the Path of the Twelve merged with the Circle of Knowing to form the Scions of the Seventh Dawn, Tataru continued her tenure as secretary and coinkeeper combined. When the political situation in Ul'dah drove the Scions from their headquarters for a time, she journeyed with Alphinaud and the Warrior of Light to Ishgard, that they might there regroup and rebuild the organization. Later, she accompanied a contingent of Scions to the Far East, where she established ties with the East Aldenard Trading Company's Kugane branch in order to fund local anti-imperial resistance efforts─one of her many laudable ventures on the Scions' behalf.

Privately, Tataru has long regretted her inability to assist her comrades in martial endeavors, and thus sought to train as an arcanist. Alas, these efforts met with misfortune, including the escape of her Carbuncle companion, and so she has since resolved to provide financial support through trades such as mining and weaving. In so doing, she has become something of a master artisan─going so far as to establish her own boutique in Old Sharlayan─yet she always manages to find the time to fashion new outfits for her Scion friends when they stand poised upon the threshold of journeys new.

name: The Scions of the Seventh Dawn
text_html:
The Scions of the Seventh Dawn

This secret society was the product of a merger between the Circle of Knowing, led by Louisoix Leveilleur, and the Path of the Twelve, led by Minfilia Warde, following the Seventh Umbral Calamity.

Working in concert with the leaders of Eorzea, the Scions strove to address the myriad problems that plagued the realm, be it the godlike primals, the imperialistic Garleans, or the scheming Ascians─beings who have long shaped history from the shadows. As a means to achieve its objectives, the society sought out those blessed with the Echo, a mysterious power with myriad manifestations, the most notable of which was the ability to walk in the memories of others. It was for this reason they extended an invitation to the Warrior of Light.

On account of their contributions in dealing with several primals and the XIVth Imperial Legion, the Scions' existence became public knowledge. Utilizing their newfound reputation, Alphinaud Leveilleur founded the Crystal Braves, a military organization intended to pave the way for a unified Eorzea. However, the society's activities had made it the target of a Monetarist faction of Ul'dah, and an elaborate betrayal by Alphinaud's presumed allies resulted in the Scions being framed for the sultana's assassination. Though branded fugitives and scattered for a time, they eventually learned of a plot within a plot that saw the monarch put into a deep slumber rather than slain, and succeeded in clearing their names.

Their honor restored, the Scions went on to become key players in the liberation of Ala Mhigo and Doma from imperial rule, and after helping to avert the Final Days, they judged their mission fulfilled. So it was that they announced their disbandment─at least outwardly─and retreated from plain sight to labor in secret once more.

name: The Final Days
text_html:
The Final Days

This dreadful calamity befell the star in the distant past, when it was known as Etheirys.

In that shining age, men had the power to manifest anything at will, even living beings, and through this miraculous creation magick, their civilization thrived. One day, however, following a keening sound from the land, their magicks ran rampant, giving form to eldritch horrors born of fear and despair. Their blissful lives became a waking nightmare, and mankind was driven to the brink of extinction.

The Convocation of Fourteen, the people's chosen representatives, observed that the phenomenon manifested where the celestial currents, the star's outermost flow of aether, had grown weak and stagnant. In order to address this deficiency, they summoned forth the mighty Zodiark to exert control over the laws of creation. Though this act demanded a high price─the sacrifice of half of mankind's remaining number─the vast majority willingly rendered up their lives, and thus were the Final Days forestalled.

Over the intervening millennia, this star-encompassing calamity had faded from memory. But faced with its second coming as engineered by the Telophoroi, the Scions of the Seventh Dawn embarked upon a desperate quest for the truth. At length, they discovered that an ancient named Hermes had created Meteion, a being capable of traversing the great expanse, to ascertain the meaning of life by seeking out other civilizations in the universe. Alas, Meteion and her sisters found naught but despair, driving them to conclude life was suffering and death the sole mercy. Fleeing to the edge of existence, they became the Endsinger, and proceeded to unleash the power of dynamis, an esoteric energy set in motion by feelings, to usher all stars to their doom, that life need not continue in vain.

Despite seemingly insurmountable odds, the Scions held fast to hope, and amidst darkest despair lit the way for their champion as they confronted the Endsinger at her nest. And at the end of a fierce battle, they emerged triumphant, and put an end to the Final Days once and for all.
